reviews.review: We wanted to try places where the locals go, someplace off the strip, where you don't literally get beat over the head when the check comes.  Found this place and we're very glad we went!  While they didn't have a gluten free menu they were very accommodating.  I had an omelette and hash browns and they gave me some sliced tomatoes in place of the pot of bread.  Hubby was lucky enough to have the french toast sandwich which was totally not what he expected.  It was french toast, made from their pot of bread and had cooked apples on top.  When I say his eyes rolled around in his head while he was eating it's an understatement.  He said it was probably one of, if not the best breakfasts he's ever had!! Service was great.  We would definitely go back!

After sitting 30 min, our server comes to our table to let us know the kitchen never got our order.  Not once during that time did she come to our to to refill our drinks. Not to mention she didn't think to ask the kitchen why our order wasn't up yet. Will NOT return. Such bad service.
Best corned beef hash on the damn planet. Seriously.

Oh. My. Gosh. Seriously SO GOOD. I've heard many good things about Jamms, and I work right down the street so I stopped in this morning for a veggie omelet to-go. I don't know if I can ever eat an omelet from anywhere else ever again. Seriously... 5 stars is not enough. I will be back again and again and probably again!

Ate here on a Monday at lunch...the business was steady, not too busy. The decor is way outdated. The carpet is supposed to be red but is black because it's so old. The portion sizes are good but all of the food lacked seasoning.  I order the country version of eggs Benedict, which consists of a biscuit, sausage, poached egg and gravy with a side of country potatoes. I was so disappointed that the white gravy looked and tasted like it came from an instant mix...definitely not a good quality sausage gravy...it had no flavor. The country potatoes where crispy but again lacked any seasoning. Bottoms line...will never go back

What can I say?? Jamms is the best.  Expect to wait on the weekends,  the place is packed.  Try the pot of bread.. The service is always great.  Been going here for about 17 years,  and the same waitresses are working there.  That tells me that they are treated well and are happy. Our order is always correct,  the coffee is good and they always have a smile on their faces for us. Best place for breakfast in town.

The food was good and the staff was wonderful. The place was not to bad on a Saturday morning at 8am. So get here early to get a good seat. After about 9 this place is starting to get busy.
OK the food is good but not great. I probably will not be going back. My omelet was to full of feta cheese and spinach, I get that's what was in it at least chops them both up in smaller pieces. 
I will not tell u to go and I will not tell u it's the best food in town. I would have rather gone to hash house a gogo. Now that food has good taste.
That's it the food did not have a lot of taste maybe it was what I had to eat. I like to taste my food.
One more thing I forgot to tell the waitress that I had a free pot of bread so I told the lady as we were checking out and she was not the nicest. I had told her it was no bid deal but she was not very nice about it. What ever....... And if u post on yelp in another social media place u will get 10% off u need to show the lady when u check out.

Jamms has the best chicken soup in the world!  : )  The owners are extremely friendly and so are the waitresses.  They always remember that i drink ice tea with extra lemon and always go the extra mile!
A great weekend breakfast or brunch spot! A little pricey, but it's all worth it. Their pot of breads are worth it alone!

The hostess was not great.  I just needed a table for 2 and my boyfriend was about 10 minutes behind me.  Even though no one was waiting, she made me wait to seat me.  I understand if there was a ton of people waiting and I need a big table but it would have been nice to sit and have a cup of coffee while I waited.  Our waitress was a pleasure.  Recommended stuff and was very quick with service.  The food was just ok.  I ordered the hash because it was listed as a favorite.  I didn't love it.

***Local Vegas Breakfast Spot***

#LocalFlavor

There is a basket of Juicy Fruit and Big Red Stick gums at the hostess counter to sweeten up your taste buds before or after breakfast because guess what? I did pick up a stick or two to chew on while waiting about 20 minutes before and another stick after an awesome meal.

I've ordered their Irish Skillet which consist of corn beef hash, bell peppers, onions, potatoes scrambled with eggs and melted cheddar cheese, it didn't disappoint! I know a good skillet meal when I try one when it all just melts in my mouth, but hey the potatoes on these were not dry but almost light as butter, the scramble mesh well the all the toppings that made it a hearty meal for me. 

Addition to the experience my wife's Ruben Benedict was delicious! English muffin topped with corned beef, two poached eggs covered with hollandaise sauce? whats in that sauce?! it was creamy and it added some flavor, the corned beef was sizzlin'! and I love corned beef!

No coffee this time! but I've ordered the specialty Mexican Cinnamon Hot Chocolate/no whip cream which was good it's almost a horchata, just not as sweet. On the side, I recommend giving their Bacon Ranch Pot of Bread a try! It's a small bread with bacon bits pouched inside with butter spread, very tasty along with the softness core to bite in.

The ambience inside is like one of those old school diners with spacious booth seating and of course awesome service. Our server reminds me of some lady in the Simpsons because she had that friendly lovely voice.

I highly recommend this spot to do away classy Vegas eats for breakfast time.
I've been coming here for years. Great place for breakfast and lunch. Highly recommend.

My fiance and I love this place!! A little far from our house in South Las Vegas but so worth every minuate of the drive. I always get upset at many breakfast spots because they are small and crowded but at Jamms they have plenty of places to sit and the food come fast! 

Keep up the great service! See you this weekend
It was our first time here and the food was good especially the pot of bread. We'll be back again!

We ate here in February and we all enjoyed our food. We all ordered omelets this time and were disappointed. The egg was fully cooked with the ingredients stuck in the middle and the Denver omelette had more cheese than egg! Too much.

We saw Jamms on television when the chef Guy was checking out different restaurants in vegas. So we decided to try them out, we are so happy we did. The service has that family owned feel where you feel welcomed the whole time your there. Their pot o bread is the best i have had in vegas, i love the variety of flavors and there is always a different special flavor when we dine. So far the nutella banana and the pineapple cream cheese ones are my 2 favorites. My husbands favorite breakfast to order no matter where we dine is the Corned beef and hash with potato and eggs. He says hands down they make it the best in the city. I normally pick an omelet and they are always light and fluffy and taste fresh. The prices are affordable and you get a discount for checking in on social media and you show them at the register. We love this place and it's our new breakfast place when we decide to eat out. I can see why they have so many great reviews and repeat customers.

My family and I have been going to this restaurant since I was 12, that is currently 11 years. There are 3 people who I see everytime I go that have been there since before we first went there and they always greet me with and extra big smile. I recently took my wife and her parents and our nephew and there was not one complaint about the whole meal. I was suprised that my super picky fatherin law who is also an amazing cook did not say 1 bad thing about the meal and that was a shocker, he always complains. This restaurant is wonderful, the pot of bread is to die for (if it's fresh) and they are aware of the Yelp, free bread deal, and the waitresses are always so very nice. It is definitely 1 of my favorite places to eat in Vegas.
Babalama omelette had huge pieces of avocado and lots of bacon (too much?) well worth the price. French press was great as well. Definitely suggest it.

Thanks to Yelp, I found this little place that has the best brunch. I ordered the eggs Benedict and home fries and it was delicious. My husband ordered the build your own burger. He wasn't very impressed. 

The Yelp app gave me a free pot of bread which was orange cranberry and it was amazing!!

A great "locals" joint in Vegas.  Awesome breakfast place...plus they have a yelp offer if you check in.  How awesome is that?  Overall great food and great experience.  If you go on the weekend...be prepared for a line!

We live on the other side of town and are willing to drive to Jamms because it's so tasty!  It's small, so be forewarned that a wait is always imminent! They're quick in turning people around though!  The pot o' bread is good, but their lunches are AMAZING!!!

Thank you, Yelp, for introducing me to this fantastic breakfast spot.

Great coffee, refilled frequently. Provencal omelet (tomatoes, provolone, fresh! spinach), delicious. Pot of cinnamon raisin bread, light, fluffy, and perfectly addictive.

Cannot believe Jamms has been right there all along and we never noticed it. Now that we've found it, though, I expect we'll happily become regulars.

Wow- so good! The service is wonderful. The menu has EVERYTHING for everyone - even a sample menu for those who want it all. The fresh corned beef hash is the best I ever tasted. Light and filled with meat and flavor. The biscuit and breads are fresh light. My friends omelets were "yummy and perfect". Oh And the coffee is great!!The Price is Right - Jamms is JAMMIN!!
Very friendly and attentive staff. Had French toast combo that was great! Pot of bread was tasty!
Great place Great food. Shirley our server was the best! Will definitely recommend and come back

My girlfriend and I have been here a few times and everything is great here. Last time I went I got the s'mores French toast and it was awesome. Also customer service here is excellent especially the busboy who gets u drinks, he was great.
Really good breakfast. I ordered the Hungry Lion breakfast and everything looked great. Service was great and our server was very friendly. Good atmosphere too.

Great food and packed but they know how to turn tables quick. Great food, great service but much need of gluten free option for people who can't have it. Will be coming soon. Hope one day I can try at least of the items on the menu.
Loved the early morning atmosphere and the pot of bread. Coffee and company is awesome!
We had breakfast at Jamm's and enjoyed the hearty food served by the great attentive staff.  I had the bacon burger w seasoned fries...very good.
We enjoyed a delicious breakfast here.  Loved the fresh-baked cinnamon bread!  Service was great.

Love breakfast at this place! The corned beef hash is amazing. The staff is always so friendly and I have yet to eat anything I didn't like off the menu and we've tried lots of thing. And the tapas plates are such a great idea!!

My second time here, my husband's umteenth time (used to live in Vegas for 2 years) & it's still the same delicious food as when he took me here 8 years ago.  The bread in a cup is a MUST, especially when they have the different flavors.  LOVE the small plates choices also.  Staff is super friendly & the place is extremely clean.  Be prepared for a wait if you go on a weekend later in the morning tho!  But, the wait is well worth it!!

I am one of those lovely ladies who is unusually obsessed with carbs. I say unusual, but in reality I believe there must be a lot of people like me in the world because restaurants like this keep using the bread to draw us in! Their little bread pots are everything I need in life! They always serve the plain and cinnamon and then have a special bread of the day. I never normally like the bread of the days as much, so I stick to the plain. I hate to say this, but the rest of their food is probably a three star total. It's delicious breakfast food but nothing spectacular or different. Come for the bread, get fat for the bread, die for the bread. I just made them a new slogan! 

A lot of older people go here, it seems to be their customer base. This is fine, except for sometimes I feel like I don't get good service because of my age. They aren't rude, they just aren't super accommodating. I'm not a teenager or anything but I try to go with my mom to make sure we are taken care of right. Still, love this place!!

Taste: 3
Creativity/Authenticity: 3
Atmosphere: 2.5
Service: 2.5
Bang for your buck: 3

Whats with all the hype, maybe because it was on the TV, but i dont really get how people can give it such good ratings. First its packed so be prepared to wait. The interior of this place looks like one of those diners you would find in the middle of nowhere, very run down and dinghy. Our waitress was an old lady who seemed to be somewhere else, just doing her 9-5 so you can imaging the service. I got the country fried steak and eggs with hash browns and a biscuit; my gf got steak and eggs with home fries and a side of biscuits and gravy and we got the free bread bowl with our check in on yelp. First the bread bowl had been sitting on the counter with all the other bread bowls because it was very hard on top and cold so that was horrible, my gf steak looked like it had been cooked in a mirco wave, very dry and chewy (medium rare). On the other hand my country fried steak was great, deep fried perfectly great taste however my eggs were mediocre just your basic mass amount of pre made eggs sitting in the back so again cold and flavorless. The biscuits and gravy weren't too bad, good flavor to the gravy and the biscuits were soft and flakey. Overall nothing special about this place dont see where the hype is, back to Mr Mamas better breakfast

I absolutely love this place! Every time I'm in town I have to make a trip here. I usually get their California club with the fat fries. Not only is the food amazing, but the service is 100% too! Definitely recommend

Very good! We had breakfast everything hot and yummy, even the syrup, For my french toast that was nice with vanilla and just the right amount of pieces (4). Bacon thin sliced and not over cooked, perfect~
   Coffee is in a generous mug and they are asking for refills promptly.
   All servers and staff quite friendly. The pot of bread a nice option and 1 is definatly  enough for 2 people.
   We live in Henderson so this was a bit far for us, but it was with the drive and if we are on the area would surly return.

Delicious!!! We were in vegas and Friends that live there took us here for breakfast I want sure about it by it's looks but I loved it the ham was delicious and the pancakes everything I will definetly go back
Great little place! The food was good and the grits especially were awesome! We also got the chocolate strawberry pot of bread, yummm!

The decor could definitely use some upgrades. However, I enjoyed my Mushroom omelette, home fries and cinnamon raisin pot bread. Although, there is nothing special here, I would still more than likely return.

my first time and it won't be my last.  Jamms could become my favorite breakfast place.  Fantastic omelettes.  The bread choices are better than any around bagel, English muffin, toast, or pot of bread no extra charge.  Service is excellent and staff is great.  Try I  did and was not disappointed.
Great place to eat. Everybody is so friendly. Busy busy busy on weekends. Be prepared for a line. Well worth it though. Have a pot of bread.

I recently stumbled across Jamms and decided to check the reviews before visiting.  The reviews and food pics got me interested.  I'm new to the Vegas area so always on the hunt for a good restaurant.  I had some (southern) family come visit so figured that this would be the perfect time to try it out.  There were 7 of us that arrived around 11 on a Friday morning.  As any great restaurant/dinner should be, they were packed out.  We only had to wait about 5 minutes and the lady at the cash register was super nice.  

Once seated, we were immediately greeted and got our drinks only moments later.  Everyone decided quickly what they were going to eat so we got down to business.  Our choices ranged from breakfast items to kids meals to the crazy awesome french dip sandwich.  Our food didn't take long to arrive and we were all surprised by the amount of food that came out.  Everyone had more than enough to eat and between the 7 of us, we managed to finish off everything.  The pancakes are to die for!  Kids loved the grilled cheese sandwiches, chicken tenders and the chicken nuggets.  And they all loved that the fries came in a "frying basket" for each plate.  The service was great.  Our drinks were never empty and we were checked on several times during our meal to make sure everything was great. 

The menu gives a great variety of choices and we will definitely be back to try something different minus the 4 kids under 7 we were accompanied by originally. Between the 7 meals, 7 sodas/teas and a couple of extra add ons, our meal totaled $68.  Considering the amount of food we consumed, that was a great $68 spent.
The servers are always so nice and welcoming and the food is awesome! I recommend the corned beef hash as it is the best I have ever had and the Sandy omelet makes my grandmother very happy!

This has been my regular breakfast spot for years. 

Sometimes it's a bit long of a wait to get in but normally the wait is worth it. My only real complaint about this place is the grits (way too watery) and the fact that many minor issues will come up if you have a special prep on your order (like simple substitutions or asking to leave items off) if they are busy. Don't think this is an waitress issue as its pretty consistent so maybe the kitchen is just willing to take the recourse. They really are minor but then again, I don't have allergies. That may be an issue for someone else.

My husband and I decided to have a late breakfast.  I ordered a typical breakfast; pancakes, eggs, and bacon. My husband ordered a bacon, tomato, avocado, green onion omelette with breakfast potatoes. We also ordered something called a pot of bread. The pot of bread was homemade bread that was baked in a muffin ten. You could tell that this bread was  homemade and freshly made. It was very good. The service was excellent and we would definitely come back to Jamm's restaurant.
A nice homey place for breakfast with  friendly servers and decent food. The Pot of Bread is tasty and soft.

This is a nice breakfast place. Interesting menu however I probably will NEVER go back since the waitress TOLD us to leave when we were finished eating. My friends and I were having a conversation, finishing up with our beverages and she walked over and said we had to go since people were waiting to be seated. 
RUDE!!! 
Too bad cause I like the place and we usually go out to breakfast every week! 
If you go, be quick!

Food was good as usual but service was not as great. The server was sweet but they brought out our food a couple of plates at a time. Mine was the last and about 15 minutes after everyone else's so they were pretty much done. We also ordered a small plate of French toast sticks that they never brought out and she didn't come back enough for us to say anything. 

Later, the waitress told us she realized she forgot and removed it from the check but never apologized or offered to get us any which I thought was a little rude. At that point, we were over it and didn't really want them. 

Other than that, food was good just maybe not in a big group.
Delicious food, great prices, great service. I love coming here, always have had an exceptional time. It can get crowded and have a bit of a wait, but it is worth the wait.

I've been going to jamms since before I can remember, and I mean how can you go wrong with piping hot mini loafs of fluffy perfect carbs rising out of cute little tin pots!

They always have the white and cinnamon pot of breads and monthly they change the third flavor this time we had chocolate chip banana! 

This place is consistently good, and the people are always nice. I Usually have an omelet provencal and joe's omelet are my fave :)
Great Cuban sandwich and sweet potato fries. Would eat here's often when I worked at the H&R Block around the corner.
Great local breakfast  spot been here for a long time super yummy food great service just an all around great place to eat and yummy coffee

One of my favorite breakfast spots! The line is intimidating at first but I have never had to wait longer than 10 minutes! Walking in you feel welcomed right away, everyone has a smile on their face which is a plus for me! 
The waiters are fast and friendly, the food is great. I had the steak and eggs and it was perfectly cooked. One of best places to eat forsure!

Food was awesome and the service was good. Had the signature omelet with a side of corned beef hash. Wow was that hash good. Beware if you don't like salty food but cut the corned beef with some bagel and hash brown and your in heaven! the side was huge too. had to leave half on the plate but only because i could no longer fit anymore food into my stomach!

The food is good but the presentation is too simple and unappealing. The two thin chicken strips that came with my "Chicken & Waffles" meal were disappointing but tasty. If you're looking for simple home cooking this is place is for you!

Me and the wife's favorite breakfast spot. There French toast is very good. But by far the best thing about jamm's is there weekly pots of bread. Each week a new kind. Chocolate coconut and salted caramel were my two favs. Would recommend to anyone who's hungry
Great breakfast place.  Wide variety of omelets and entrees.  Good service, fast seating.

Good place for breakfast.  They have a big menu w/typical breakfast foods presented different ways   Place is small so there is always a wait.  The Pot-Of-bread is good but just bake fresh bread.  U can get a free one if u check-in on Yelp.
Will definitely return. Food was fresh and plenty on the menu to choose from, Service is top rate. The pot-of-bread is great, but not unique to Jamms.

This place is just on the o.k. side, but really nothing special. Far better breakfast places just miles south down Rainbow. The great breakfast places are Baby Stacks, Egg Works, and Cracked Egg. Try these places and you will see the difference.

Updating....my last review was not very good but since then they have totally redeemed themselves.  I have been there many more times since then and am glad I did not give up o them.  The service has improved and I have not been disappointed again.  My favorite right now is the eggs benedict (minus meat) and is a great place to stop in on the weekends when out doing errands.  It is usually very busy as it seems to be one of the last Mom and Pop style restaurants in town.  


However, now the gum at the register is gone.  :(
I've tried numerous of the top rated breakfast spots in town and Jamm's is my favorite of all! amazing service, food, and hospitality.
We were seated within a couple of minutes the place was packed. When the server came she was super busy but nice. Food was served hot & tasty. Will come back.

Pretty standard breakfast/brunch/diner spot.
I didn't pay close enough attention to reviews or the menu on the coffee, make sure and order the fresh pressed coffee!!!!!! Otherwise you get a cup of light brown water with a hint of coffee aroma attached. Seriously I could see completely through to the bottom of the cup.
The large orange juice was infact quite large.... a small carafe.
I had the Jamm's Breakfast Sandwich with Ham. It is thin sliced ham, cheese, and scrambled egg on Texas toast. It comes with a side of hash browns or breakfast potatoes. 
This was okay..... not great, not bad. Probably wouldn't order it again.
My hubby had the Mattys Country Benedict. Two poached eggs, sausage patty on a biscuit covered with country gravy. He said his was okay. 
Again, not bad...... but with so many other options, I can't see us coming back anytime soon.
Great breakfast. Pot of bread is unique and delicious. As good an omelette as I've ever eaten.

Decent food is served here at affordable prices.  We came during the middle of the week for breakfast after reading so many positive reviews.  Was looking forward to trying one of their pots of bread that we read so much about.

We came at a good time because we had no wait at all.  The restaurant was about half full.  Our server was terrific, friendly, attentive, and fast.  

There are many choices on the menu.  We were getting confused because everything sounded so good.  I finally decided on Jamm's French Toast.  My wife ordered an omelet.

So, what did I think of the food?  Overall, it was okay.  Maybe, we did not order the best food off the menu.  Would I come here again?  Probably not.  There are so many breakfast places yet for us to try in Las Vegas.

Little places like this make me LOVE Las Vegas even more!
From the outside, in the midst of the shopping plaza, a tasty little breakfast gem hidden amongst the other stores.

Let me tell you! - This is what locals look for in LV!!

First and foremost....Pot Of Bread! Say it with me..."Pot of Bread"
assorted daily flavors, freshly backed tiny single serving of delicious little mini loafs of bready, muffinish,  pop-over type things. Hell YES!!!!

Everything else was really good. Yes, we did have to salt and pepper our breakfast. In my opinion, the seasoning could be turned up a bit...ok maybe a more than a bit.
But still all the ingredients tasted fresh and made to order.
Ate a traditional BLT sandwich. Quite tasty. Had wedge steak fries. Very tasty,as well. Highly recommended for breakfast and lunch.
The chicken fried steak is awesome! My favorite though is the potato pancakes!!

Had been hearing about this place and decided to stop by yesterday. Had the chicken fried steak, scrambled eggs, hash browns & cinnamon pot of bread. The best thing was the bread. Steak size was kinda small & gravy was bland. Small amount of hash browns. Not worth $12
Best breakfast on the west side. My granddaughter first introduced me to Jamms and it is jamming! !

Jamms is one of the best breakfast/lunch restaurants that I have been to here in Vegas. From their larger than life pancakes, to their soups and sandwiches; this is the place to be! Whenever you check into yelp you receive a free pot of bread. The pot of breads are really tasty as well. The waitresses are professional and have a great demeanor. Make sure to come early because this place fills up quick. I suggest ordering their chicken noodle soup which has thick noodles and large chucks of chicken as well as soft carrots and celery. Jamms is the place to be for a great meal, affordable, and perfect for groups.

Family Loved this place! French toast sticks are Amazing! Pancake delicious. Eggs Great as well and waffel. We live out of town. But when we come to Vegas this will definitely be a place we come back to again and again! Customer service was on point!

I'm a fan of their food, just not a fan of the slow service. When I first moved out here, Jamms was our go to breakfast/brunch because my boss loved this place.  At the time, we loved it too because we knew that our breakfast or brunch would take at least an hour of our work day.  The wait and the service usually takes awhile.  On my last visit, the wait was better and the our food came out faster.  But it still took a while, in my opinion.  

As for their food, there's a big selection of your typical breakfast items.  Price is actually pretty good and taste is not too bad.  

My Past Orders:
-Jamms Signature Omelet:  This is the king of all omelets here.  Steak and mushrooms dominate this omelet.  This is all you need because you are definitely stuffed after eating this one. 

-Chicken Fried Steak & Eggs:  Actually my favorite dish here.  Their chicken fried steak is tender and the batter is not too heavy.  Portions are huge as well. 

-Jamms French Toast:  Their french toast has a different look to them. I always thought that they were over-cooked, but they're not.  The french toast is crispy on the outside and after it's drenched in syrup, soft in the inside.  My second favorite.

-Steak & Eggs:  I had this on my most recent visit and can only say...stick with your favorites.  The steak had no taste and was a bit too dry.  I felt like I was eating cardboard.  But then again, stick with your favorites when you come here.  


Overall, Jamms is just okay.  With all the other breakfast joints in our beautiful city, it's tough to say that Jamms ranks above them all.  But if you're looking for a decent breakfast with a lot of options, Jamms is the way to go. 


YELP PERSONAL CHALLENGE - (056/366)
Always busy cos the food is always good! Waffles, pancakes, skillet breakfasts and grits with their large cups of coffee!

Where to start?

If you love corned beef hash - stop what you are doing and make a trip to Jamm's!!!!!!!! 


They're French press coffee is amazing and I'm now wide awake :D I'm not big into sweets but they're pot of bread is delicious (I had their weekly special flavor - pina colada) and they're s'mores waffles have changed my breakfast regimen. 

Service is fast, friendly, and very attentive. Sandy and Jose were great to us. The best $35 spent this year! We will definitely be driving the distance to come here. 

I sign off, fat and happy.

Consistently good.  I have never been here when I wasn't greeted like a friend.  Sometimes it is so busy that I don't have enough time to wait.  They try to wait until your entire party is there before they sit you which is annoying if you are trying to save a seat but wonderful if you are a party of two trying to get in.  The food is home cooked and genuine and the Pot of bread is an added bonus.  I had the sausage and egg breakfast with home fries.  The eggs were over easy perfection and the home fries were seared with a crispy lightness that was satisfying.  Today the special pot of bread was creamy peach served with sweet cream cheese frosting on the side.  If this were close to my home I would come here a lot more often.  MMMMM!

Go try it no matter where you're staying - best on your first day so you can come here every day after that.
LOVE the pot of bread. Also they have nutella!
The earl grey tea was not so good, but the rest makes up for it.
On the weekends (we went on friday and saturday - had to wait only on saturday) you might have to wait but it's worth it.

The food is super good !!! My two favs are the corned beef hash and eggs !! The best in town ..no one comes close ... And the country skillet... if ur running on empty this will fill u up !!! The service is great !!! my favorite part is just hearing Shirley's laugh...makes my day !!! Well worth the wait... because this place gets busy ..

I like the atmosphere. It's sort a place you would want to walk to in your neighborhood, grab breakfast, and read the newspaper. 
Jamm's has been a voted favorite for awhile and I can see why. But there is always room for improvement. 
On the first trip, I ordered the Provencal omelet. It came with spinach, tomatoes, and cheese. The omelet was very soggy probably because of the main ingredients, but it should never be presented to the customer in the way that it was. It looked more like soup. I have to add, I never appreciate places that put a slap of cheese on top to melt. It tastes better when inside the blanket of egg. 

The pot of bread, which this place is known for is a cool idea. However, if they want to make a pot of gold serving the carb in a cup, they need to perfect the recipe. It's dry. 

Second trip, I ordered the turkey melt on texas toast. It was good. Just make sure you ask for dry toast if you don't like it to be buttered up. 

This place is one of the better breaksfast joints in town. With a few quick improvements it could be even better. 

3 1/2 stars.

Had the sandy omelet and let me tell you that thing did the disappearing act.  Pot of bread was the holiday cranberry flavor.  I can't give Jamms enough love, I want to skip the silverware entirely and use my fingers next time.  Old fashioned homey atmosphere, huge portions, great service, family owned.

They also will do platter portions for carry out for you to supplement your next party!

Saw this place on the Travel Channel and had to try it out. When you first walk in your greeted with a smile and the place is all a chatter. No wait and I'm at my seat. Looking around its clean and everyone is smiling. Ordered my food( Texas Omelette) and was here with in 10 min. The food was great and the waitress was nice. This is a place that I can return to no questions asked.

This is the best breakfast restaurant in Vegas! We come here EVERY time we're here!  Everything is delicious! Good variety of dishes! Try their "pot of bread". Today's choice: s'mores waffles! Very friendly and efficient staff!
Great little place! Stopped by here on our way to the Natural History museum. Had medium rare steak & eggs, very yummy and great price. Waitress was friendly and attentive. Great place to stop :)
As always an absolutley wonderful place and staff! We love bringing the family here. The meals are delicious and hearty! Never leave without a full stomach.

Food is decent but service was an epic failure. I've been here before & I've had to wait 20-30 mins for a table even when people were done eating & just chitchatting. I've never had an issue waiting because I'll have my turn. 

Today a friend and her daughter joined me for breakfast and before I finished my food they brought me a to go box.  They brought us the bill twice & started cleaning off our table before we were done. Then as my friend's daughter was still working on her pancakes they asked if we were going to order anything else if not then they needed our booth for someone else.  WTF? 

Mind you we were there for less than an hour & the people behind me were there before us & were still there after us. No one asked them to leave... such a discriminating feeling. I didn't know that this sit down establishment had a time limit on seating.  Rude service is putting it lightly.  We'll never return!

Trying out a new breakfast spot in town was a good choice. Although this is in a shady neighborhood, don't judge a book by it's cover. What's inside is what counts. There was a short wait but as we were there I notice the wait got longer and there was a steady flow of customers coming in. I also noticed waitresses that spoke to customers by name, telling me there are regulars here. Those were all good signs to start. 

I got the veggie omelette which is my go to breakfast item of choice. This omelette really impressed me with large chunks of vegetables. They also cooked the onion and bell pepper prior to putting it in the omelette. I really liked this extra step and appreciated it. Having ordered this at many different restaurants, I can say that this was above the rest when it comes to giving me some actual veggies I can see in my omelette. Other places it is just tiny chopped pieces of veggies with no veggie taste. I also really enjoyed the hash browns. The bread that came with it I was not that impressed with. It was kind of dry and bland. We had the cinnamon. 

We also ordered red velvet pancakes to compare to others we have had, and these were different. They were huge, really thick and fluffy, and a little on the "less sweet" side which is a good or bad thing, depending on what you want. 

Service was good and quick. I think this is a good choice for a simple all American breakfast.

Jamms is my jam, for sure. I'll tell you one good reason why: diner type food, with big ol' booths you can enjoy it in. I love a good diner with booths. It's not a diner without booths, honestly.

I was intrigued by the variety of burritos on display, so went for the White Castle (I'm white trash like that). It was what you would expect (and as described): ground beef, onions, cheese, and they serve it with ranch on the side. I've never put ranch on a burrito before, but when in Jamms, I just went with it. Truth be told, it completed the experience.

Great service, nice people. Ample parking. This is a go-to for brekkies and brunch.

homefries and corn beef hash are one of the best i have had 
specially bread was excellent 
worth the trip off the strip for breakfast
Great customer service,  food was fresh and amazing, definitely recommend this restaurant,  will come again, was clean and employees were super Friendly
Not bad for a breakfast place. Very friendly staff.

Fantastic place and worth the drive! I was greeted as I came in and everyone was very friendly despite how busy they were. I had the corn beef hash and eggs, bread pot, hash browns, and toast. The CB Hash is the real deal made from scratch with bit pieces of CB throughout. Eggs were poached and exactly to specification, bread pot was delish!

I was told to pay up front when I was done with my meal and they kept the coffee topped off and offer a stronger blend if you desire.

Yelpers that did not rate this establishment higher need to try it again, because it seems they have listened to your suggestions/complaints and have acted upon those making the needed corrections.

I will return!

Jamms is family friendly, with great food and better service. Everything comes out hot. This visit we wanted chili cheese fries & my mom is diabetic so she asked if she could have them on sweet potatoes instead, they told her sure. They tasted great.

Awesome little breakfast place. My boyfriend and I decided to give this place a go on a Wednesday morning. 
I got an omelet with bacon, cheese and avocado with a side of hollandaise sauce. 
Reminds me a of cute little diner.

Always a perfect choice!! The portions are large and tasty, and the service is friendly. Their pots of bread are a special treat! Always a wait but totally worth it.
Defiantly A Place to visit....

Good food, reasonable prices, a friendly staff and homey decor.  It's NOT a chain which gives it extra stars in my opinion.  Service times were good and the menu choices were numerous.  Will definitely return.  Other reviewers have stated they had a wait time and that is certainly a personal choice, but the fact that they are not a multinational company makes the short wait worthwhile.  Buy local!!

This place seems more like your at home!
When checking in on yelp you get a free pot of bread! We tried the cinnamon and raisin, very moist and warm with a cream cheese icing (I think). It's just the perfect amount so you don't just keep eating bread.
My mom ordered eggs and ham Benedict and I ordered a build your burger.
The eggs Benedict came with hash browns and my mom was happy with it, I didn't taste it so not sure- she wished it came with toast.
On the burger you get a choice of 3 buns, 3 meats, cheeses, 3 toppings out of 8, and some sauce. I got provolone cheese, mushrooms, avocado and jalapeño mayo sauce. Tasted better than an average burger and I would come back for another one. I wished the jalapeño mayo was blended. It was literally mayo in a bowl and a chopped jalapeño in it haha I could've done that! Also I got wedge fries with the burger and these are probably the best fries I've ever had! They weren't greasy at all and I loved that they didn't have salt all over them! Soooo gooddd! 
Ps if you post on social media they give you ten percent off your bill, it's on every table so don't miss out!
Great service, food and atmosphere! If you like French toast get the Jamms French toast it has little bits of cornflakes on them, it's amazing
The service is always great, the food is very good. Eat here atleast once a week. I highly recommend Jamms.

We were here visiting from out of town and we like to Yelp hometown places to eat. Once again Yelp did not fail us. The food was great and the service was outstanding. Sandy was our server and she was right on top of things. My hubby had the hash and eggs which was probably the best we have ever eaten and I had the chicken enchiladas with green sauce and they were excellent, not to spicy and not to mild. Only negative I would say is that the refried beans that came with enchiladas were a little dry but there was plenty of enchiladas to fill me up so I just didn't eat the beans. I would highly recommend this place.
Excellent food and the service is awesome. A small Mom/Pop Linda place. My kind of place.
Great environment amazing food and love the service. My always go to spot for great breakfast
Had the Denver omelette and it was very tasty! Coffee was great, service was good, overall good experience.

Was on vegas for a mini vacation from los angeles but wanted to try a breakfast out of the strip... So i decided to give jamms a try... I can honestly say it was worth the drive... I can honestly say the have the best corn beef breakfast... Yummy.. I recommend this place

The first time i went here the food was awesome. Today it was horrible..hair cooked in my fries..and my daughters panini had next to nothing in it compared to the last time we were there. After telling the waitress about it she apologized by saying..hair flies around..we all have it and she would rather have a bug in it than a hair. Enough was enough but then she proceeded to tell us they found a frog in the spinach once. Not sure what her motive was but in the end she took 2.00 off for the fries. After finding hair i had only ate 1/4 of my wrap. My stomach turned at this point and made me sick. I dont go to a restaurant to order hair in the food and this should of been entirely written off the bill. What a disappointment!

This was the best breakfast I have had in a very long time. The service was very fast and nice. The cheese grits were awesome and the corn beef hash was just to die for. Reminds me of the way my grandma would make hers. The cinnamon raisin bread alone will keep me coming back again & again:)

The corned beef hash is the best in town!!!  Fresh, not canned.  Once you eat the cbh here you won't be able to have it anywhere else!!!  Also depending on the flavor of the pot of bread could be good or too much.  But anything with chocolate is so good!

Decided to stop here for breakfast about 1pm on Saturday. Place was fairly busy, but easy for a single like me to get seated. Menu looked like it had some interesting fair and some variety on old favorites. I decided to go with a Waffle Benedict for $9.99. $2.75 for an ice tea is a bit high, all the drinks were priced in this range. No offer for refill while I ate. 

Service was quick, and my meal was served inside 10 minutes of ordering. Crispy hash browns were cooked to my liking. The hollandaise sauce didn't have much to it, no taste of lemon or anything. Pretty bland. I ended up squeezing left over lemon from my ice tea on it to get a little bit of taste. The waffle was good, the eggs poached right and the canadian bacon a little small. Nothing that would make me want to come back for but I will try another meal here of something different.

Big breakfast for inexpensive prices is the drawing point of this restaurant in a non gross way. Unlike other places that give you a heaping plate of heart clogging ridiculousness, Jamms has more healthy options. I had ordered the veggie omelet with egg whites and no cheese. That was the health nut in me speaking and then the glutton in me decided that sweet potato fries and a cinnamon raisin pot o bread should accompany with it ($10).  

Looking around there were seasoned customers and I knew this place was a winner. When you can get a bunch of older locals into a restaurant and have them enjoy a meal, it must be good. 

The omelet was massive, filled with tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, and big chunks of broccoli. The sweet potato fries were plentiful and I made sure to eat them all. The pot o bread was nice and fluffy. I just wished with a name like Jamms, they would have homemade jam. Just nitpicking now. 

The staff was nice, split checks were not an issue, and our server was quick with refills.

We decided to come here after dropping my car off across the street, this place is busy like all good breakfast joints. We decided to sit at the bar since the wait was 20 minutes you can't be picky especially if your hungry! The vibe i got seemed to be like that show on cheers where everybody knows your name. At least that was the case for my server she knew the gentlemen sitting at the bar beside us, the staff is always busy but attentive. We ordered a eggs Benedict, the Denver omelette, and the French toast sticks it was sooooo good! Of course get the pot of gold!

I don't even know where to start!! Portions? Amazingly huge!  Customer service? Impressive! Food quality? Top notch! Pot o' Bread? OUT IF THIS WORLD! 

Although it is a tiny location in a strip mall on Rainbow, the wait time was less than fifteen minutes on a Sunday morning. Waiters and waitresses were super attentive and the choice of music for the place was awesome (a lot of Katy Perry, Adele and Ed Sheeran) even though the place was jam packed, you were still able to hear the person sitting across from you and no one was bumping you or your booth. 

What did I order? The most amazing skillet ever. It included,  sausage, bacon, the best potatoes possible, eggs, cheese, peppers, onions, all covered in white gravy. Seasoned to perfection and piping hot. Came with a side of perfectly toasted toast (ha, perfectly toasted toast), and I ordered a strawberry covered waffle on the side. 

I should not have ordered anything extra because the portions were out of this world. 

My boyfriend ordered an omelet which came with sausage, bacon, peppers and a pot o' bread. 

That bread...  My god that bread. When they offered it, I should've taken it instead of substituting the toast. My boyfriend inhaled it in a matter of seconds. I was barely able to get a tiny piece. It was just that effing good. No clue what they put in it or how they prepare it, but not only was it toasted and flaky, but when you bit into it, it was rich with flavors I can only describe as heavenly and the feeling in my mouth was simply orgasmic in nature. 

GO EAT ALL YOUR MEALS HERE.

so hard to decided what to order since everything looks good!   We shared a mini Sandy omelet and smores waffles.  Both were awesome but the omelet was to die for.... lots of bacon.  And we each had a pot of bread...I had the cinnamon apple....yum!!!

Sorry! Wasn't a fan. Went here with my gf and her family and so my hopes were high especially since I recommended this place based on reviews here. 3 out of 4 of us ordered the "hungry lion" which consists of eggs, sausage, bacon, ham steak and pancakes. Eggs and pancakes were pretty good, nothing special, ham steak ok, bacon and sausage bad! Bacon chewy like rubber and the sausage was unlike any other I've ordered in a restaurant. They were the kind you get at the cheap breakfast buffets that are snappy and are kind of gross without much flavor. So, to sum up, not too impressed. Service was nice though :)
I love Jamms! Their potted breads are so tasty! The fiance and I love going here on Sundays when we want a break from cooking. :)

The pots of bread are awesome! Plus I had the country style eggs benedict, best eggs benedict ever. After visiting Portland this summer, we were looking for something like that in Vegas and this is it.

Jamm's is always perfect. They have the best corned beef hash that I've ever had, the best fresh bread, the best coffee, the best everything. If you're in Vegas you need to go to Jamm's at least once. I come here every chance I get. And it's relatively inexpensive.

Really great.  The corned beef hash was delicious, my wife's fruit side was totally fresh, and the pot o' breads were soft and fresh. The POB is an individual baked bread the size of a large muffin. It comes plain white (what we had), or cinnamon raisin, or weekly special. I can't wait to try them. The restaurant is cute and homey and the staff is happy and friendly. I'll be back soon, especially to try "The Jamminator".
This is my 3rd time here. The food is always fresh and delicious and the service is more than excellent, everyone is super courteous and attentive.
My idea of a perfect yummy brunch! Everything was wonderful and I plan to go back soon to try more!!

Second visit and I am amazed by the over the top service. I had the opportunity to meet with Ronnie, the owner, and really enjoyed the pleasant conversation. I enjoy patronizing establishments with great service, who also take good care of their staff. I can tell that with long time staff, this place is extremely well run with the positive customer experience being foremost of importance. Thank you Ronnie and crew!
Good traditional breakfast the baked muffins are excellent and food portions are just right.

Best corned beef hash I've ever tasted! Even the English muffins were amazing! Also had the pumpkin cream cheese pot of bread which was also really good. Service was amazing! Definitely want to come back to try more dishes.

I was in the area with friends, so we decided to try it. Got the free cinnamon raisin pot of bread and it was good, just don't expect it to be big. I wanted to try a corned beef dish but as I tried to order, the waitress told me they ran out. Disappointed about that, but I ended up going for the chicken and waffles which turned out to be really good. My friends ordered burgers and said they were good too. 

So the food was pretty good, but the service was slowwww. The restaurant wasn't even half full, but the waitress barely visited us and when she did, her visits were short and she was very quick to leave, like she wanted to be somewhere else all the time. 

All in all, food was yummy, service was bad (lady at the front was nice though), and the price was about $10 each person. I give it a 3/5.

This place was average. I was excited to try the food but my boyfriend and I thought it was somewhat bland. We walked in as first timers and waited for a while before I had to approach the hostess myself that was up front starring at customers/walking around but not asking if she could help them..it was awkward. The pot bread was the only thing worth mentioning but the country skillet and eggs Benedict with sausage was again avg. Gravy wasn't very flavorful neither was the sausage. The waitress forgot our side order but she took it off the bill. At least the food was reasonably priced and we didn't have to wait..meh
Loved our breakfast!! The service was great and the food was yummy as usual..I had a breakfast burrito ans my fiancé had the egg breakfast.. so good

I love this place for simple but honest home style American fare. The food is not extravagant but good. It's just simple and delicious. 

The staff here are the best around kind, courteous and genuine. Good food great staff is always a good way to get me coming back, even from green valley.
Love Jamms! One of my favorite breakfast joints in Vegas! The Jamms French toast is amazing! And the omelettes are delish too! The service is friendly and welcoming!

this place is always busy (which is a good thing), so I came prepared to wait, however - the staff made room for me, as I ate by myself. The service was prompt & accurate. The server gave me the right amount of checkbacks - so I was happy about that. I didnt even have to ask for a refill - the assistance were right on it.
The food was hot & portions were good sized.
The chicken fried steak was plump & flavorful, Hashbrowns were golden & crispy and my eggs were perfectly cooked
I wished I had more room to try the bread specialties, but alas, I had to bank it for the next visit.
I highly recommend Jamms.
This place has the best breakfast and friendliest wait staff in Vegas. Do try to include this as one of your restaurants when in the area.
This is my favorite breakfast spot! I live in San Diego but EVERY TIME we are in town we have to stop in!
Great breakfast at the right price! Definitely want to come back and I live in north Las Vegas!
First time here and the service was really polite food was awesome, decor was cozy, recommend for anyone who is trying to grab something off the strip
Soooo good. I've had their Rueben Omelet and the Rueben Benny. Both were VERY good.

This place is alright if you're in the mood for a slightly heavy, but nonetheless tasty breakfast. The potted bread is fantastic. Anything with gravy is a bit overwhelming and insanely bad for you. Much of the menu is greasy and pretty strange. Some of it is just plain bad. Some of it is delicious. The menu is massive, which is a personal turn off. Perhaps the reason why the food takes so long to come out every time. However, the staff is friendly and on top of service. Great tips for our waitress each time. 

Small plate options are awesome. Just little samples of anything you want for an inexpensive or reasonable price. They also offer discounts for posting and checking in on social media. It's a pretty nice way to save a couple bucks on your meal. 

Overall, the food can go either way. I've had good experiences as well as awful ones in Jamms. The restaurant is old and outdated (this would usually not bother me, but it does make it look fairly dirty). The staff are great, no doubt. I personally would not eat here again, but my fiancé loves the potted bead enough to come back.
Yummy food!  Homemade chicken soup and bread bowls!  Great local place for breakfast or lunch!
I really loved the tapas breakfast. I had a small eggs Benedict florentine and two pumpkin pancakes. Super yum!!!!
Wow what can i say. This place is very good and service from Shirley was great she did a wonderful job. We will definitely be back here again. Thanks Jamms

Gr8 omelettes and other breakfast items.  Pancakes and waffles are good.   Lunch is less impressive.   Bread seems smothered in butter so ask for dry.  Service is efficient and friendly.  Gr8 coffee.  Good specials.
My favorite place for breakfast when I'm in Vegas. Love the pot of breads. The service is great and our waitress was real friendly.
Decent food but nothing special. The corn flake crusted french toast was OK but again, nothing special. I had the Irish skillet and was underwhelmed.

We had a fantastic time at Jamm's! The food was excellent (we had breakfast) and the service was very attentive without being overbearing. I recommend you go for a small portion if you eat the smores pancakes- our friend, who can eat - could barely eat 1.5 pancakes. We also enjoyed the "pot" of bread which was very fluffy and light; we had the cinnamon raisin version.
Best food .Excellent  pot of bread. We went five days in a row.Pan cakes  and cinnamon sticks are excellent.

"WHERE'S THE MEAT"  I hope my pic's posted!
We went in late, they close at 3:00 we got there about 2:15!  We got a seat right away.  I love the booths, there roomy.  Our waitress was Lorena, she was very professional, she greeted us with a smile.  She took our drink order, and as I was checking in when she came back, I showed her my yelp check in offer.  They have some bread for free.  So I choose the lemon and blueberry!  I have no idea what it is.  It came in this tin thingy, it was really a 1 person serving.  My husband got into it before I could take a picture.  But OMG, it was yummy!  The bread almost felt like it was not done, but it was so freaking good!
So I got the pastrami!  Ok, most places that serve pastrami, it's piled on the bread!  This looked like 3 strips of bacon between 2 pieces of bread!  for $10.00  Not worth it!  The skinny fries were good though.  My husband ordered french toast, eggs and sausage.  He loved every bit of it.
Next time I will stick with breakfast!
This is probably the best place for brunch in Vegas. Let bed the French press coffee and the toot toot omelet was over the top.

We come here at least once a week. The staff is super friendly. The food is fresh and is brought out quickly. Our drinks are never empty. We recommend this spot to anyone and everyone.. We love Jamms. -The Lenzen's

In typical Las Vegas fashion, do not be fooled by a store front.  So often I find that a strip mall with a nondescript doorway will lead to some wonderful experiences.  Point in fact for Jamms Restaurant.  

It was my birthday and I wanted to try something new.  Hubby is always ready to please me and so my Yelp search begins.  After all the nice things posted about Jamms of course we had to visit.

This is a homey kitsch diner.  It is a throw back to years gone by, but do you know what else is a throw back to years gone by?  Their SERVICE.  I found where all good service has gone.  They have come to Jamms.  Warm welcoming smiles are the first thing you notice as you go through the doors and it continues with the wait and service staff.  Just old fashioned goodness.  Then comes the food.  HELLO YUMMY.  The food is old fashioned, homemade, deliciousness.

I ordered the Denver Potato Pancakes, first of all there is no way I could ever finish this dish on my own.  It is massive and not only in size but in flavor.  I could taste EACH AND EVERY ingredient in this dish.  So fresh and made to order.  I would drive miles for this dish.

Hubby and our guests ordered the skillets and only one gentleman was able to finish his meal.  They were big on size and flavors again.  Excellently prepared.  Hubby ordered the homemade bread with his meal.  Today's flavored bread was a Chipotle, Cheddar concoction and it was D E L I S H...  I highly recommend that you order their homemade bread, especially if you are a popover fan.  They are very much more like popovers than a typical bread.

This may have been our first visit here, but will definitely not be our last.

PS I spied a crunchy french toast whizzing past us.  It looked wonderful.

I drove far and wide to try this place. The reviews everywhere I looked seemed to be on fire and to be honest, breakfast is my jam. I feel like I ordered almost every breakfast item on the menu. I'm a small girl with a Man vs Food appetite when it comes to brunching. As expected everything was beyond delicious. They serve their homemade bread in it's own little dish, have you ever heard of anything so cute?  Everything was fresh, comfy seating, friendly staff and top notch delicious fluffy pancakes. If you don't love a good fluffy pancake then you must be a monster. Go to Jamms now. Go on. Calories don't count there, or at least that's what I tell myself.

Don't let the outside appearance keep you from giving Jamms a try. Very pleasant interior and friendly fast service. The Waffle Benedict was heavy but tasty. Terra worked hard to make sure everything was to our satisfaction!
Great breakfast and all around meals for great prices. The servers are kind and prompt. So come and try it out. Tell them you know Fred TabronYou all want to come to my sisters

Unlike a lot of other reviews citing huge portions, there was nothing extraordinary and infact, the chicken fried steak was one of the smallest I have had anywhere. So the 'Huge Portions' thing is far from real.
Next, cold eggs and film/skin on top of both gravy and maple syrup is for rookies like Denny's, not the type of place the Food Network personalities film an episode at.

Very sub-par, below average and will most likely be removed from our Las Vegas Best Breakfast website!

My son and I are huge fans of biscuits and gravy. We have been on a mission to find "edible" B&G in Vegas. Loved Black Bear Dinner but the last 2x we ate there we found black hairs in our food...twice!! So never going back there again!!!
Now for Jamms...waited 30 mins not too bad. Service was incredible!!!! Never had an empty glass and she brought my son their famous pot of bread at no charge. Food was very good...still haven't found B&G like they make in the south but Jamms is pretty close. Will definitely be back!!

No words can describe how much I love this place!! Went here on a recent trip to the area, I was only in town for 4 days and had to go back twice! Growing up in a small town I always miss the breakfast place where everyone knows everyone and the servers know your order as soon as you walk in. This is that place!! The food is simple and classic.... except for the POT O BREAD!! Such a simple idea, and yet so good!!

We're visiting from out of town.  We didn't want to eat breakfast on the strip,  so we decided to try Jamms based on the reviews. The outside isn't much to look at but don't let that fool you.  Amazing customer service.  Friendly staff and even better food! My kids got some specialty pancakes and waffles.  I got the California eggs Benedict.  Everything was delicious.  Great prices too.  I highly recommend.

Met my buddy here for breakfast, recommended by him. I have to say I was very impressed.  He said anyrhing I order will be good. So I go for the country fried steak. It was simply scrumptious.  Then the hash browns. Oh my, cooked perfect. It's one of my indicators to knowing a good cook in the kitchen. Also hanb the bread in the pan. This is one of their specialties. Great stuff. Needless to say this will be another one of my must stop places while in Las Vegas and will be bringing all who come.

Decided to stop in and give Jamms a try after a bunch of positive reviews...Carol-Ann has got to be one of the best servers ever, always with a smile, and awesome attitude!

This place was packed with hungry diners and we were lucky to get in quick, as many others were in bigger parties.

As mentioned in other reviews, if you mention Yejp, free pots of bread for you!(Its actually bread baked in a ramekin) we had Original, Cinnamon, and their flavor of the week, Pumpkin Spice.

We also ordered a French Press of Illy Coffee and some OJ...after browsing the menu, wifey settles for the Sandy(?) omelette(according to Carol-Ann, the most popular one) and I go for the Corned Beef Hash with Hash Browns, both extra crispy. we also tried one s'mores pancake, just because:)

Overall, food was pretty good, but Jamm's serves up the best corned beef hash in town!(sorry Du-Pars, you're still king of pancakes though!)
Definitely an item I'd order again! ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(30/365) "Order the Corned Beef Hash!"

Excellent crispy hash browns, but average omelettes and terrible coffee. Staff was efficient. Figured we'd try something new this side of town, but next time will go back to Egg and I. Otherwise an okay place.

Ok so today was the day to check out what all the fuss was about! 

Went for breakfast this morning, this "greasy spoon" restaurant is comfortable and casual with booths. 

I ordered a Denver omelette and the country potatoes, of course the raisin cinnamon cup of bread. 

Yikes I was not aware they loaded their omelette's with cheese, was a bit overwhelming to say the least. They saute the Denver ingredients to oblivion, onions, ham and which should be green bell pepper as for a "traditional" Denver omelette, they used red. I like my Denver omelette with a bit more crunch of the onion and bell pepper. Way too much cheese about 1/2 pound it seemed, was basically a cheese omelette with some ingredients. It was insane the amount of cheese.

Anyhow, I will be sweating cheese for the next week, eek. 

The country potatoes and cup of bread was awesome, and the coffee is also good with plenty of refills. 

I will give them another shot and order something different next time, perhaps the french toast.

I have to say the service was awesome! We had a waitress that was sweet, charming and on top of things! She is one of those that calls you sweetie, honey, etc. I love that and eat it up, she got a hefty tip! lol

Would have been 5 again, but we wanted to start eating, and instead have to stand around.
 Star loss.
The Pot of Braad was a vivacious disappointment. Kind of Pillsbury Rolls with a sprinkle of brown sugar, no Peanut Butter flavor at all. They waited to bring it WITH our French Toast. Huh?
Great food! Great Service! Clean! The Potta bread was amazing so we're the waffles! Very nice place!
Solid.  It lives up to what it is supposed to be. I like some of their french toast options. Their best quality/commodity is CUSTOMER SERVICE!
The service is awesome. The people are friendly. The food was very fresh, tasty and presentation was great.Lenore is wonderful and she brought us their specialty Pan bread just like a cinabun.

You cannot beat this place for a good  hardy breakfast.  The freh rolls are to die for.   Plan a a little  wait. Usually crowded.  Service slow only because the food is made to ordr fresh. Prices $9- 15 . Most patrons are regulars.

Not very friendly customer service, the food was okay but not great. I could have cooked it better myself at home. Minus the bread, the pot of bread was fantastic. Not worth coming here for a roll though. Never again.
It's good food.... Service could be much better. I've been here for about 35 minutes.... And I'm extremely parched lol. Other than that.... Definitely stop by!!!
The staff was friendly and the food good. We went at 11a on a Tuesday, and it was insanely busy, so plan accordingly. The Margie's Omelet was great - best part of what we ordered.

Came here on a Sunday after working out at 24-hour.  Must have been early enough (around 1030AM), as we were seated right away.

Coffee was good, food was good.  We got a small stack of the grain pancakes, which was actually a pretty big stack.  They were good, but nothing to write home about.  Also got an omlete with cheese, bacon, and avocado.  Minimal avocado, tons of bacon and cheese.  After working out, would have preferred the reverse.  It was tasty though and came with a heaping side of cottage cheese and tomoatos.  Food tasted as expected.

Service was ok.  Not too spot on for a Sunday, which one would think would be the prime breakfast day.  Cost was around $20 for above mentioned food and 2 coffees.  Wish I would've ordered that cinnamon roll in a mug- looks divine!

The crowd must come around 11AM, as there were 4 or 5 parties waiting for a table.

Went here several  times. Food is great and recommended many to come here. Sadly to say I have not returned to eat here after our waitress , who come to find out was the manager, had asked if we were finished while I was finishing up my cup of coffee. She stated people were dying for a booth. Keeping in mind we waited over 30 minutes to be seated. Bad customer service and it coming from the manager made it even worse. Host insisted us to come back and be sat at another servers section. I just don't agree in supporting a business who's manager is a server and gives bad customer service. Many other cafes that don't rush you out that I can go too in this town.

We jammin! The cornbeef hash is the bomb, boom!
The staff is very attentive. I love the irish skillet with my eggs over medium. Tony really knows how to cook an egg to perfection. The egg white omletes are awsm too. The coffee is strong, and the french press is even stronger. If you like that classic cream taste in your coffee ask for half and half, or they will bring you milk. All around great breakfast joint. Try it a couple times, then a couple more. Shirley,Maria,Kathy,John, and Albert were great all the times we went. cheers!

So GOOD! first time here in all my life of living in Vegas.."pot of bread" was so delicious service was super friendly. .... reminded me of how Vegas used to be :) Dylan our server was awesome! Can't wait to come back.

Jamm's was smart to offer the Yelp deal of free bread.Those are DELICOUS. I am not even a big bread fan. I liked the cinnamon one the best. It wasnt heavily drenched in sugar, but just enough. The portion is a good amount. I had Joes omelet which was actually a little heavy on the mushroom but not enough meat, but overall it was still great. Not to mention the  hash browns were pretty tasty. The coffee is OK but not the best. I would definitely recommend it again.
Everything was fantastic the atmosphere was great and the service was on point. Everybody was really friendly and will come back again soon.

This place was great. Food was delicious, pot of bread was very cool concept. I liked the cinnamon raisin plus the strawberry lemonade bread. I would for sure go here again to eat. Loved the atmosphere and the waiter was super nice too.
Great family place.  Awesome great service great food. On mother's day lots of people but just a short wait.

Perfect breakfast. I am a huge fan of breakfast, coffee, and sausage gravy and all of these items were spot on. We will be back. Erin got the tuna melt and it was truly perfect. The tuna was grilled also as it should be. Why haven't I heard of this place? Go try it now!!

Me love breakfast.  Me like Jamms.

Jamms is an okay at best breakfast/lunch spot in Spring Valley. Tucked in strip mall. Jamms is packed on the weekend. I think the reason this little place is so popular is their Pot O' Bread. What is Pot O' Bread, let me assist you. It's fresh bread dough, placed in a little ceramic ramekin, then baked, then delivered to your table. Recently they've added flavors of the week (recent flavors: chocolate peanut butter cup, cherry cheese cake, cinnamon raisin).

Jamms has a wide variety of options found at any dinner. Jamms' food isn't all that special. It's on par with Denny's and IHOP. 

The service is friendly, warm, and prompt. Coffee mugs, water glasses, and iced teas are never left empty. The restaurant is clean and loud. There are scattered tables and booths. On the weekends (Sat and Sun), there is looooong wait, so get here early.

On the way out, be sure to pick up a free piece of gum to get the sausage, egg, and whatever else is on your tastes buds.
Absolutely love this place! Not only is the food delicious, the portion are great, and the menue is always updating with something new! Try the pot of bread, especially in the fall!

Oy vey! There was a ninety-minute wait at the Hash House a Go Go and not even a bench to sit around and wait. Damn that Rachael Ray. Alas, I went to the Yelp app on my iPhone and found a nearby breakfast eatery that was also averaging around four stars. It literally took us about three minutes to get to Jamm's and big surprise...it's in a strip mall, our third off-the-Strip place that was in a strip mall. We noticed the place was abuzz with customers but not nearly to the level of the Hash House. There was a fifteen-minute wait here, and the diners were not nearly as fashionably attired. 

It's a modest operation, the type that has a cheery hostess and cartoon murals on the walls. The menu is pretty robust, but unlike the nearby Egg & I, there was a lot more thought and care in the execution of the dishes. Jamie W. ordered the $8.45 Reuben Omelet, which was full of strands of corned beef and mounds of sauerkraut. There was also a generous slab of Swiss cheese melted on top and a side of crispy hashed browns (see photo). I went for a similar dish, the $8.50 Irish Skillet, which had the same corned beef accompanied by diced onions, green peppers and potatoes, all mixed into scrambled eggs and melted cheddar cheese (see photo). It was a mess of high-cholesterol goodness well put together. Tasty too. 

Jamie, in a moment of insanity laced with homesickness for his Midwestern roots, also ordered the $5.25 full order of Biscuits and Country Gravy, which was a gloppy pool on a plate (see photo). I won't deny it wasn't good in a deep Southern kitchen kind of way with the biscuits sopping up all that gravy, though I attempted to re-purpose it as an extra topping for my skillet breakfast. Bloated was the way we both felt afterward but also sated. Needless to say, I also noticed they decorated the restroom stall with the same cartoon murals. Somebody must have had time on their hands. By the way, the waitress was also cheery, chatty and about nineteen. She was refilling my coffee cup with unadulterated pleasure. 

FOOD - 4 stars...country breakfasts with deli twists, well executed with simple ingredients 
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...kitchen cozy with Fingerhut touches 
SERVICE - 4 stars...cheery thy name is Jamm 
TOTAL - 4 stars...good diner-style eats can be found in a strip mall

We were greeted quickly and the waitstaff was nice. We had whole grain pancakes with whole grain crunch. It was yummy. I ordered Eggs Benedict, again great.  If you mention yelp, you get a free bread. Price was under 22 bucks with coffe and a coke for two :). We left satisfied.

Not sure what the draw is here. If Las Vegans think this is the ultimate breakfast hotspot, then they have never been to an ultimate breakfast hotspot.  When we arrived the place was crowded and there was about a 10 minute wait. no problem.

When we were finally seated, it took the server nearly 10 minutes just to get to the coffee. Now I know the place is busy but it's never too busy to serve coffee in a timely manner. But in all honesty, I have to say that once the ball was rolling, we did not have to wait for refills. Maybe there was a little redemption there.

The location. What is up with that? It was a big ugly strip mall which I think is a weird place for a restaurant but Las Vegas is so full of big ugly strip malls, there's just no place else to put a restaurant. It's bizarre.

The food is nothing beyond mediocre. I had a veggie omelet that was so loaded with cheddar that it just became a big greasy mess and worse by association, death on a plate. I tried to push as much of it to the side as I could and by the time I was finished, it was quite a pile.

The next time I'm in Vegas, I'm going to do some research and come up with my own breakfast spot

A great place for breakfast!

I've had a couple different things on the menu and it was all great. 

The restaurant is pretty outdated and really needs a renovation, but that won't keep me from coming here.

What a great place to have breakfast or lunch! The staff is so friendly and the food is great at a reasonable prices. Definitely a nice place to sit and chat for a bit. If you get the chance, ask for Shirley, she's amazing!
Very friendly staff, great service and good food a great place to have breakfast or lunch ! Bery affordable and great portion sizes for the price.

Drove across town to fulfill my corned beef hash craving at this place. Because of all those remarkable "Yelp" comments on their corned beef hash, I could not get this place off my mind! Not only that, corned beef hash is my #1 preferred breakfast dish!!!

Corned Beef Hash and Eggs: NO Question, the Best Corned Beef Hash I've ever had to date!! They crisp up the top and bottom of the corned beef hash serving which added a very nice subtle touch of texture and the meat inside stayed juicy, tender and tasty as can be! The portion was also Generous! The accompanied fried potatoes were far from dry, simple and delicious!

French Toast - "Jamms Style" = corn flake breaded/crusted: 4 Thick half slices of toast that were a little crunchy, a little sweet and had a nicely executed spongy consistency. Add some of their softened butter and drizzle some maple syrup over the bits of powdered sugar.. Yummm!!

Pot of Bread: Thanks Yelp for the complimentary/special offer!  Extra Fresh, Extra Soft and Plainly Divine Roll of Bread!! 

Worth the Drive, Server was Very Nice and Enthusiastic, Prices were Fair and the atmosphere felt like how it should be!! APPROVED!!

This morning's breakfast was a huge disappointment.  It was busy-but Jamm's is ALWAYS busy on the weekend.  I ordered my favorite-The Sandy omelette.  The omlette part was a bit skimpy & it was bursting with bacon (some slightly crispy, some slightly undercooked)-almost too much bacon but the avocados were PERFECTO! Perfectly ripe and huge luscious slices. Sadly my potatoes were undercooked and very greasy 
: (  The Pot O bread was great as usual.  

My hubby ordered the irish skillet.  He said it tasted "fine" but from my view it also looked undercooked in places and I was not even tempted to ask for a bite as I normally do.  

I liked our waitress-we have had her a few times (I don't recall her name).  I asked about the potatoes.  She advised us to order extra crispy but did not offer to take them back... Maybe we could have had a small adjustment?  

This is the closest place to where we live.  I think we will put our other places back in rotation for now.

Long time lover of this fabulous, down home diner. Haven't been back in quite awhile. Wish I had stayed away. The service and friendly atmosphere is still fully intact. Wonderful, quick service. One start for that alone. 

Unfortunately, I think, over the years, they have tried to become something they're not. The menu has exploded with ridiculous, monstrosities for new dishes. They couldn't just add chicken and waffles. They had to create anything and everything with waffles from a BLT on waffles to a waffle pizza. Yes, I said "waffle pizza."  They managed to get a bit of notoriety on the Travel Channel with a crazy breakfast sandwich consisting of a corned beef hash omelet with sauerkraut and Swiss cheese piled on a huge pretzel bun that has been egg battered with cinnamon and sugar then deep fried. Couldn't bring myself to try it. 

The last time I visited, Jamm's had been venturing into exotic coffees and cappuccinos. They were heading in the right direction. This visit, the coffee tasted like it had been brewed through the same grounds all day. I could t even finish one cup. 

We went with a couple classics that we remember being the best in town the Hash and Eggs and the Country Benedict. The hash would have been fine without the handful of chopped garlic that was clearly tossed in right at the end of cooking. I love garlic, but that much undercooked garlic ruined what was once a breakfast legend. Since they clearly switched their sausage to a poor quality, frozen patty, they must not have had the flavorful sausage drippings and fond leftover to make a decent country gravy.  They changed their home fried potatoes to hash browns with onions and peppers. Which would be fine, but then don't call them home fries. Call them hash browns O'Brien. Of course, that wouldn't be necessary as they still offer hash browns on the menu. 

I am not only disappointed, but saddened by the changes this place has undergone since I last visited. This used to be a place where we new the crew and they new what we wanted and you could not pick a bad thing off the menu. I think they just fell victim to chasing the "foody" trend and lost sight of what was working so well for them. 

I hope they find their way soon. Would love to return to the good 'ol Jamms I remember.
This place was cool but service was a little slow. Fun atmosphere like a ma and pa place but the bacon was fatty. Food was great.

Ok, so after being a regular here for a few months, I can update my review a bit.  

By and large, their food is pretty good.  But there is room for improvement.  The omeletes are decent, but I prefer the kind where the ingredients are cooked into the eggs, rather than just piled in and folded over.  NO big deal though.  I will leave this at 4 stars, as I think the food could use a little more refinement, but all said, I am pretty happy with the place.
