Jamm's was awesome! ! Our server was very friendly and our food was fresh, hot and very tasty!! I was surprised that there was a bit of a waiting list on a Wednesday around 11am; however,  now I know why. This place is worth it. We will be back soon and often!!!

It's just so darn hard to find really great breakfast food. 

I was actually really happy with my order. I had the Sandy Omelet with sweet potato fries and it was pretty good. I was interested in ordering the pot of bread, but I forgot and ordered toast the first time around, but got it on my second visit. I don't really see what the hype is all about, I preferred the toast, actually.

The price was right, but the service was spotty. Hit or miss on my two trips here. Sometimes hard to get the servers attention and often would have to remind them two, three or even four times to get me a refill.

All in all, I'll probably be back, but I'm still on my quest to find the best breakfast in town.
Very good Friendly good food fair pricing my only negative comment would be the floors need to be replaced the carpet is done for ! All in all that would not keep me from coming back.
Come to this place all the time. Very delicious, great feeling, and amazing staff. Can't ask for more. My girlfriend loves the breakfast, and I love the lunch. Great place.

Service was a little scarce, seems to be only one server for our half of the restaurant. Biscuits and gravy are bland, bacon is good though. This is my first time here, so I'm sure they should have other menu items that should be good to constitute a 4 out of 5 star rating.

Solid breakfast food at reasonable prices. I got a "reuben omelet" and enjoyed it very much. The portions are large, the service is friendly, and they keep the coffee cups filled. What more can you ask for from a simple place like this? Great job, Jamm's. I'll come back whenever I'm in Vegas....

For me as a Dutch girl, I see this as a typical American restaurant. The people in there were very friendly!
We came here for breakfast and ordered provance and jamms specialty omelet with toasted wheat bread only, coffee and water. 
The omelets were nice! But I've tasted them better somewhere else. The toast was very very fat, but I guess that is normal in America. The waitress checked on us several times, which is a good thing! Overall an nice breakfast for American standards.

Damn, I LOVE Jamms!!!! I am JUST finding out about this place. I am going to keep taking people until I have to go alone! 

PROS: *Jamms Signature Omlet - steak, cheese, fresh mushrooms topped with 
             bernaise sauce. ( I substituted egg whites).
             Hamsteak - sweet and savory
             Pot bread - Party in a tin pan!!!
             Family owned AND operated

Great breakfast place. Eggs cooked to perfection, good coffee, and a special delight...a pot of hot bread! The bread comes in assorted flavors...we ordered the red, white, and blue...delicious! Service is excellent. Meals can be ordered "mini" size. I had the cheese and veggie omelet, mini, and it was still a decent size breakast..only $5.00!!
The food was decent, but the customer service was off the chain. Super nice people. That is why I gave this place 5 stars!

The service is always wonderful. We were promptly greeted at the door and shown to our seats. Just as we were sitting they came to take our drink order. Our waitress Sandy came by not to long after we received our drinks to take our order. 

We were there early so it wasn't quite as packed as it usually is on a Sunday. I loved seeing those with their football jerseys on. The new paint on the door and Windows is fabulous I love Frankenstein. 

My husband had the California Benedict with home fries. It was beautiful to look at. He said it was glorious. It had a fresh taste but was also rich with their hollandaise sauce that he loves so much. The tomato and avocado were perfectly ripe. I had my usual French toast combo. The bacon was extra crisp exactly how I like it. They have a Jamms French toast or a traditional both are good options but I do prefer the traditional. My eggs were over medium, which is what I asked for. We also shared their weekly pot of bread this week it was pineapple pumpkin. My husband  greatly enjoyed the pot of bread, but it was my favorite but that's the joy of having a different flavors to try every week. 

We love that they offer discounts of you check in on social media or yelp. Our waitress was very attentive throughout the entire meal and we were very satisfied with our experience there as always.
My favorite place for breakfast in las vegas, affordable prices, and Great customer service.

Arrived on a Sunday morning at around 8:30 am and it was already crowded. Waited about 15 minutes for a party of 6. This place is good. It's no wonder why they've won Trip Advisor Best of LV for four years in a row. If you're looking for an affordable brunch in LV, it's a must try.

Coffee - good. 

Pot of Bread - lots of hype, but all air - literally. If you must try it, do so. If you don't, you're not missing much.

Breakfast Burrito - delicious especially with all that cheese and potatoes. Lots of going in this burrito, but you won't be disappointed. 

Fried Chicken Waffle Sandwich - the star in this dish is the waffle. The fried chicken was crispy as was the waffle. The waffle had a sweet and cajun-like seasoning. Yummy. The tomatoes and lettuce tricked your mind thinking this sandwich was actually healthy. Regardless, it's good.

Corned Beef Hash - Different, but good. It's homemade with ample bits of cured ham. It could have been more "hashy", so it worked more like a skillet. The potatoes were good, but wasn't integrated well into the ham. Again, different, but tasted good.

French Toast - tried the the traditional french toast as well as the french toast sticks. This was my favorite dish. The french toast was made with thick toast and battered and fried to a nice crispy outer texture. The inside of the french toast was fluffy and moist. The french toast sticks were fun and easy to eat. Again, crispy outer and moist inner. 

Service was courteous and prompt. You get 10% off with Yelp check-in.
The best mom & pop breakfast& lunch spot in town. I don't even want to review because it's my favorite little secret.

I LOVE JAMMS!!! This place is absolutely delicious. You will NOT be disappointed. Large American sized portions, friendly staff, and a nice bright atmosphere. I love coming to JAMMS for breakfast. I had the chicken fried steak with country gravy, hashbrowns, and a special sprinkle pot of bread. My tummy feels warm and full and wonderful.

Steak and eggs disaster! 

Eggs were undercooked and steak was very overcooked.  The cut of steak was meager peace of flat steak, not best choice for the dish.  Would rather have a better steak and pay more, seriously Albertsons is next door.  Gave the opportunity to correct the steak, got it back rare with no seasoning/salt.

Sausage Gravy (for biscuits and gravy)

Very smooth due to the absence of sausage.  It was a strange yellow color.  (Side note:  should be able to order with pot of bread if you so choose)

Omelet and breakfast potatoes 

Large and stuffed nicely.  Potatoes well cooked and not mushy.

Coffee wasn't refilled as promised twice, then presented with a $5 coupon for next time... there won't be a next time.




Pot of Bread was excellent!

Jamms is always the place to go for breakfast.  There is not a thing in the menu that you can go wrong with.  Service is always excellent and attentive.  My wife and I come here as often as we can because they make you feel at home.

My fiancée and I went there this morning.  Awesome food, ok service.  He got the S'more pancakes I got the meat lovers omelet, it could had more meat for my taste but it was still delicious.  Both times we have been there, there was a wait but always very short.

If you are looking for southern comfort breakfast food, this is the place. We usually order the Rueben Benedict and the Chicken and Waffle BLT. Try the pot of bread as well! The servers are super friendly.  If you come on the weekend, be prepared to wait. Don't worry, it's worth it. Also,  they give 10% off for checking in on Yelp!

Wow - just noticed the last time i reviewed this place was in 2008 !!! I'm guessing i've been to JAMMS at least 10 times since then.  I'm also guessing the exact same employees work there now since i first tried JAMMS in 2008.

As the gf and I walked in we debated whether or not the place was freshened up with new paint - i generally don't look at decor but given our upcoming move to a new house and being bombarded by all the design/decor ideas coming from the gf for the new house, i've suddenly taken a closer look.

As usual, the service is spot on - water and coffee at our table within a minute, Flo taking our order within minutes and the food served within minutes ... honest ! 

Gf standard breakfast - veggie omelet - no seasoning, no oil , packed with 4-6 veggies, and of course, egg whites - given the large number of veggies, her food usually costs between $12-$15 at the various breakfast places we visit.  Surprisingly, no extra charge for the garden of veggies that the gf requested - but a $1.50 upcharge for the fruit side.  I believe her omelet cost $10.  She proclaims JAMMS is the only breakfast spot that consistently prepares her omelet correctly.

My ham and cheese omelet ?  All good - i like that they put the cheese on top the omelet AND inside the omelet.  

IF we lived closer to JAMMS ( and with the upcoming move, we will ) I suspect this will be one of our top breakfast spots.

pics included

Great place for brunch. The pot of breads was delicious fresh and hot! We got the cinnamon raisin and special of the week: FIG! My favorite. The steak and eggs was very tender, although the meat was a little overcooked for medium. I enjoyed the food nonetheless and would recommend coming here! Thanks for the great service and food! Oh, plus a free pot of bread with yelp check in and 10% off entire bill with a post and a hashtag of the restaurant.
I love this place for breakfast!!!!! I come here with my boyfriend and the food is great and completely affordable. It's great for a Sunday morning breakfast.

Great recommend on the potato cakes by our busboy (busman), Jose. The food was slow getting to us but good when we got to it. The waitress was slow in responding to anything we asked for, but Jose was Johnny on the spot, and has a great personality. He really should be moved up to waiter.

I don't even have the words to express how great this place is. Sandy was our waitress and was excellent despite the packed restaurant. We decided to sit at the bar to avoid the wait and the staff was quite exceptional. Not only was the service remarkable, the food was fantastic! Thank goodness there is a "tapas" menu because I wanted to try everything! I ordered three different tapas and loved every single one of them. My boyfriend ordered the corned beef hash and that was delicious as well! We will most definitely be returning to this restaurant!
Excellent food and friendly staff. Check in on yelp and get a free Pot of Bread, which is amazing!

Jamms is a great breakfast place.  I found them on Yelp a few years ago and now everytime we come to Vegas, we make it a point to have breakfast here.  I love the pot of bread (use Yelp and you can get a free pot) and the french pressed coffee.  I had never had it before, but always will now.  We haven't tried their lunches yet, but will need to do that on our next trip.  Jamms is a great local place.  I get so tired of the chain restaurants and fighting the traffic on the Strip.  Get in your car and take a short drive to Jamms.  You'll be glad you did.

The wait is crazy, 20-30 minutes (went on a Sunday). I was on Yelp looking at breakfast places and this is one place we were excited to try. 

It was worth the wait, I'll tell you that.
Great customer service and the food was great! 
Don't want to leave a full review because I know I'm going to be coming back here. 

Will return whenever I'm in town.

Service 5/5 Real friendly host, servers, bus boys.  Top notch.  very friendly.  They flip the tables pretty quick.  so there was a wait when we got there but we only waited 10 minutes on a holiday with a party of 8.

Corned Beef Hash (4/5)  Real corned beef (not the canned stuff).  Tasty
Country fried steak (4/5)  Ellis Island is way better but it's good here.
Pot O Bread (1/5)  Too small.  So you don't get much and because it's so small there isn't enough chewy inside to combat the crisp outside.
Pancake combo (4/5)  Tasty pancakes.
Hash browns are perfect here.

I'd expect when you go over $10 that your portions would be a bit bigger for being off-strip.

It's pretty pricey here for being so far from the strip.

We went here on the way up to Red Rock canyon (half way from the 15 to red rock)

You get 10% off for social media but that just offsets the higher prices.

Very down-home! Great, perky service! 
Love this place for the food...

I love the feel of a local neighborhood restaurant with yummy coffee and pot of bread. The food is plentiful and it is easy to get seating. Sometimes, I take it to-go to have brunch with friends at home. It's worth stopping by if in the neighborhood. A local gem!

I like Jamms. It is a great local joint. It is a lot like the bar Cheers, where everyone knows your name. My dad is a regular and falls into this crowd. I meet up with him from time to time and always enjoy the experience. The food is always good, the portions will fill you up for sure, and the prices are pretty good.

I'm always looking for great breakfast places.  I came across Jamms on yelp and wanted to try it due to the yelp reviews.  My husband had the cornbeef hash, which was good but def was salty and I had the stuffed French toast which was light and tasted amazing. The coffee was ok and service was friendly.  I wasn't blown away by this place but I would def go back to try other items.

I love this place!  It's always busy, which is a good sign.  The service is always quick and no-nonsense, which I also like.  

I would have given 4 stars, but some of their food is not consistent.  I've had their Cuban sandwich, which ended up being super dry pork.  It felt like the sandwich was just dry pork and bread, when a Cuban sandwich typically has pork, ham, swiss, pickles and mustard.  Maybe they were having an off day that day, because their menu states the sandwich ingredients as such.

Their signature salad - the Jamms salad is cabbage, almonds, green onions, and sesame dressing is absolutely amazing!  It's light, crunchy and not over-dressed.  Very very good.

The corned beef hash and eggs is fatty fantasticness.

Their chilaquiles special sounded amazing, but was far from it.  It was under-seasoned, and loaded with tons of cheese.  Some may think that's a good quality, but this time it wasn't.  I wanted to taste the chips, eggs, and sauce, and the gobs of cheese made that difficult.  The beans that accompanied the dish looked as if they had gone way past their hold time, with the crunchy, crusty bits that form on the pan when they've sat there too long. 

Their pot of bread is their signature, and they do that perfectly!  It's got that fresh-out-of-the-oven temperature and smell, and when you pull it apart, it reveals light, pillowy, steamy deliciousness.    

All of these dishes were had over a couple visits.  I'll definitely go back to Jamms, but I'll get something different every time to figure out what's good and what isn't.  Right now their signature items (salad, and pot of bread) are the front-runners.

The ambience is homey, but clean.  Service is very attentive, and there's free gum at the checkout stand!

Delicious, tasty and filling breakfast served by the nicest people in a warm and friendly environment.  The potted bread is OUTSTANDING and addictive (try the specials). I had the nutella with strawberry swirl and it was like eating a little piece of Heaven right there and then!  Excellent coffee, good country gravy, unique and delicious omelettes, and fresh fruit.  Jamms is one of my favorite spots in Vegas for the "Power Breakfast Meeting" with my cohorts.

Awful.  

The wait was about an hour on a Sunday - which is actually perfectly fine with me.  Why?

1. You know that a breakfast place is good when there's a line and full tables
2. I'll wait for a good meal, no problem

Problem was - the service was horrendous -- and so was the food.  It took the waitress 15 minutes to get to our table after being seated to ask us for drinks.  After we put in our drink order, it took another 10 minutes for us to actually get our drinks.  We spent so much time looking around trying to flag someone down (just with looks as I despise the whole hand waving thing that people do).  

When our drinks finally came, the waitress asked if we were ready to order.  As I ordered, she rushed me through any questions that I had.  For example, her question -- "wouldyoulikebreakfastpotatoeshashbrownsortoast"  She ran that sentence so quickly, I automatically "uhh....-ed" my reply.  When I said "breakfast pota----" she cut me off with a huff and replied, "it has onions and peppers and is stir fried."  

Anyhow, she continued on being rude, abrasive and hasty.  But enough about the ordering fiasco.

When I got my "signature" omelet - the "signature" sauce was dabbled on.  I mean, it literally looked like the cook took a teaspoon of the sauce and drizzled it over the omelet and left it be.  I asked for extra sauce.  The extra sauce arrived.  It was disgusting.  It tasted like clumpy flour boiled in egg yolk.  The omelet itself was dry and overcooked.  The steak inside of it was bland, chewy and grey.

My fiance's eggs benedict.  Disgusting as well.  No other way to put it.  

My niece ordered mac & cheese.  She said it was really dry and wanted to pour her milk in it.  Serious?

After our "meal" was over we paid our bill and walked on out.  The hostess tried to give us a discount of 15% for a future visit.  I politely told her she could keep it.

This cafe has been my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas for years. It has amazing food and a friendly staff. I only get to go about once a month, as I live far away now, but the pot of bread is worth the long drive.

Just checked this place out for the first time.  I love going to mom and pop places.  Place was hopping and I sat at the counter.  The coffee  was decent, I ordered the pancake combo with eggs and bacon.  Portion was huge and pumpkin pancakes were fluffy with good flavor.   However, the inferior pancake syrup they used, brought it down a notch for me.  Service was good and friendly.  Menu was extensive.  The omelets looked great co.  Next time I will bring my own syrup and give them 4 stars.

Feel Good Food Establishment:

Every now and again Life can you hit you with an upper-cut. Whether you took it on the chin like a champ or whether you saw stars and started bawling like a baby - There are places in the world you can go that will make you feel better about that punch to the face you just absorbed. 
-Mine is Jamms.

Friendly smiles as soon as you walk in the door and an atmosphere to match.
The menu items include Breakfast and Lunch options. I'm slowly working through them.

As of yet: French Toast: with the option of with or without crunchy cornflake topping. Additional options:  How bout Nutella French Toast, Apple Cinnamon French Toast, too name a few

You Like Waffles? Jamms like waffles too... so much they make a WAFFLE PIZZA!

Omelette anyone They have over 10 different types.  

A new item: Their breakfast burrito that will make you question all others.

This place is real a Gem.  
After a French Press coffee and Banana Fosters pancakes I always leave feeling much better than how I came in.  That is the magic of Jamms.

Don't believe me? 
Order their Pot' O Bread for the day and you too will be saying,"What Punch to the Face?"

They get busy, and rightfully so, but it is worth the short wait for the quality service and food you will experience.

Jamm On ;-)






.

If you like omelettes, this is your place. If you like old-school genuine hustling service, then this is your place. Don't expect any bells and whistles, nothing "fu-fu" about Jamms, but the "Sandy" omelette was one of the best I've ever had. If you're in Vegas, go have an omelette at Jamms, you won't be disappointed!!

I've been here a couple times. There is usually a small wait, however worth it every time. The staff is friendly and helpful.  Fair prices and great food are a delicious combo. I've had Maddy ' s country Benny and simple sausage and eggs, all of which were hearty meals that left little to no room for the free pot o bread with the Yelp check in.  The salads are top notch as well. You can't go wrong with Jamms.

Service was excellent. Food was great. The omelets were so big that the wife and MIL wished they had shared.

I got the Jamms breakfast sandwich. Wonderful and very filling. The wide had the Tomato and Avacado Omelet, which she absolutely raved about.

Wish I had this place in Dallas.

This is a classic breakfast diner! The food and staff are amazing. This was our first visit, so needless to say we couldn't decide what to get because there are so many options. The portions are large and delicious. Can't wait to come back!

I've eaten here quite a bit with my dad as he likes it but I think it's just an alright breakfast spot. If you sign up for their e-mail list you can get coupons for 10-15 percent off your bill or a free pot of bread.  Anyway I recommend ordering the Irish skillet and a pot of bread.

I still haven't been able to find a great breakfast spot in Vegas, i've been to Cracked Egg, Egg & I, Hash House A Go Go, Babycakes, The Bagel Cafe, Blueberry Hill, Pancake House, etc. I like The Bagel Cafe, Blueberry Hill and Pancake House out of all of those but those are all pretty expensive and the Pancake Houses in other states are better than the ones here for some reason. Hash House is the worst out of all of those.

This one was a recommendation from a co-worker at Century 21, yes years ago- we ordered breakfast items several times on a group order. It was very good. I never forgot it and had always wanted to go in person. We were on that side of town and since the Red Apple Grill wasn't open for lunch, this was Plan B. I had never been inside until last saturday, with my husband. It's a small but busy and popular restaurant located at a strip mall next to Albertson's on the corner of Rainbow/Charleston. There was a short wait- I gave my name. It was about five minutes or so. Not bad. My husband said it reminded him of a smaller version of The Cracked Egg. It was decorated for Halloween. We sat in a booth- I was facing their Wall of Fame- numerous "Best of Las Vegas" awards, as well as a travel site award.

The drinks were brought over to us pretty quickly (quick refills too BTW). We ordered from the lunch menu- Reuben & Jamm's Philly (with mushrooms, and onions)- and split it (our usual MO). Your choice of side- fries, sweet potato fries, potato salad. All sandwiches came with lettuce, tomato, and pickles- cut generously. Most items on the lunch side were priced at $8.50 on average. We both got the sweet potato fries- very generous helping (next time, my husband said one of us will get the fries and the other will get something else). Both sandwiches were equally very good. Not super greasy either, which can be the case with both sandwiches. (We saw a sandwich that was going to another table that was super stuffed- wonder what that was, but I don't know how that person could even open his/her mouth- would have to take out an inch of meat from it. It was that big.) My husband liked this place; he recommended it to his mom and step-dad. I'm sure we will be back again. The staff is warm and very friendly- I noticed that there were regulars here (a good sign). 

The bill was $17 and change- pay at the front counter. Free gum at the counter. On a side note, we noticed that there are omelets named after us, our nick names anyway, and they're right next to each other- how funny. Never saw that before in a menu, so we thought it was cute. Good diner on this side of town, reasonable prices, fast/friendly service, cozy atmosphere, only open until 3 pm.

So...after the servers stopped kissing all the regulars, I was able to nom on some very delicious food. 

Prices reasonable. Food delicious! Servers VERY friendly. 

On a side note, I would highly suggest that the owners expand into the vacant space next door. I would also get rid of the booths and replace them with small tables. It didn't make sense to me that two people sit in a 6-8 person booth when the restaurant is busy.
This place has a homey feel. Same waitress, same hostess. Great vibe. Must try at least once. Love the sweet potato fries and pot of bread! Can get pretty busy. Lots of regulars.

I love this place! I have been going here for years. My father introduced me to this place. Expect a wait it's that good. Thankfully it is never too long of a wait. The employees are very friendly l. My niece and nephew can get messy sometimes during meals. We order the french toast sticks. This seemed like a good idea cause it's a finger food and they could dip them in syrup. Turned into a sticky mess. The waitresses were helpful and also brought the kids stuff to color. The food is extremely good and reasonably priced.

Service: Friendly and efficient (nothing spectacular but good none the less)

Food: Near perfect breakfast (perfectly browned and crispy hash browns and not too oily, Rueben Benedict was my breakfast of choice, hollandaise was creamy although i do prefer just a touch more tang, eggs poached to perfection in all its yolky splendor, tender corned beef atop a golden English muffin that was not soggy. Winner winner chicken dinner! The famed potted bread was a bit dry probably not the freshest, but it was now noon so I'm not mad at it)

Prices: standard ($24 after tax and 10% discount for 2 and a coffee with standard American breakfast portions aka BIG)
**10% OFF when you post their food on some form of social media! (; 

All in all great experience. Thanks for breakfast Jamms!

Side note: they serve Illy coffee so that is a gold star in my book

My good friend and Muse said we were doing to Jamms. 

Jamms?  Okay...it's a cool name. I had no idea what to expect.  "Just please don't take me to any hoodrat establishments, bet?"

I've NEVER done much of anything off the strip in Vegas..and so with me now having a good friend who lives there...anyway...

She took me to Jamms and it was the funk!

I had the Signature (steak) omelet, and french toast made with CORN FLAKE BATTER. Whaaaat???

She had the Country Skillett and an order of the Pot-O-Bread. (She was sweet enough to get me one to go). GOOD STUFF.!!! It's like a little..pot..of...sweet bread (blueberry, cinnamon)...

If you're ever in Vegas, you'll have plenty of nice buffet eating (Bellagiio, MGM Grand...)...but if you wanna venture off the strip...go to Jamms.

Jamms is the funk!
Wow. Awesome breakfast, fresh hot very tasty. I think this place is better then Peppermill or hash go go. The service was outstanding.
Great savory and sweet breakfast items and awesome service. Tried the Nutella pancakes, Reuben omelet. Also got the free pot of bread! This will definitely be my new go to breakfast place. :)
Fantastic service and great food! When you need comfort food and a place that gives you that feeling of meeting friends Jamms is the place. We love Ronnie.

I love this place.  I have been here for breakfast and lunch.  However, no matter when I come in I rarely deviate from the delicious homemade biscuits and gravy.  Absolutely to die for!  I highly recommend!

Was pretty skeptical about eating here but was I wrong. The food was so delicious and the portions are so fair it's incredible. The service makes you feel so at home and the wait is never bad. I would recommend this place to everyone for breakfast. Do yourself a favor and visit Jamms!
This breakfast and lunch spot is a regular when i'm home in Vegas. The staff is fun and the food is plentiful...if your in the area make the stop and enjoy!
The food is delicious ! I had steak and eggs and they were perfectly cooked . Red velvet pancakes are huge . Great service and price .

We went on the 8th, around 10am. Not to busy, waited about 5 minutes for a table. Thought we scored. Wrong! We were seated and the buser came over and took our drink order. And that was that! 20 minutes later without a server ever coming by our table, we paid for our drinks and left. So I can't review the food. Service sucked.  Doubt will go back there again, especially since we went out of our way to go there, only to be ingored.

I plan on coming here for almost every special breakfast meal. The food is always good, the service is always good, and I haven't been here and become disappointed. It's an old fashioned little joint where their main interest is being the best service possible. I ordered the French Toast sandwich and was amazed at the quality of the Jamm's signature french toast! On top of that, I never had to ask for coffee. And the best thing about this entire place is that it's relatively the same price as Ihop or Denny's.
Great food.  Hashbrowns excellent usually I get one too crispy at other places of burnt,  not here.  Also wait staff is all over it and very nice!

Nothing bad to say. Have your group ready to be seated when you get there. Food choices are outstanding. Quality is superior, service quick and friendly. Portions great, hot, fresh. Priced RIGHT!!! Many regulars there each visit & they know all the friendly staff. Won't go anywhere else now for breakfast! Hostess Devyn is the best!
Hated The Griddle :-(
Great hole in the wall eatery. The food is good staff is really nice and attentive. Sat thru morning rush on a Friday. Tables stayed full.

Darlene and I just had great brunch at Jamms

Pumpkin pancakes
Cranberry orange bread bowl
Corned beef Benedict 
Yum -o

First time eating here and overall, very impressed.  Had the bumper omelet, which is mushrooms, broccoli, cream cheese and topped with hollandaise sauce. Although I wish the broccoli had been cooked a little more, it was delicious. The pot of bread was different and scrumptious. Parking is convenient and plentiful, since there is a grocery store a couple doors down. Decor was OK, but very clean,  booths looked a little circa 1980's. Honestly the only thing I wish they'd change is the kids menu prices, they seemed a bit high. Will definitely go back again.
Super friendly staff and a menu I look forward to continuing to explore!

I have to start by thanking my good friend John, who introduced me to Jamms.


 Jamms specialises in breakfast and lunch. It is an unassuming place well away from the strip - so most of the traditional visitors to Vegas won't know about it.


 The service is extremely friendly and welcoming as soon as you enter the restaurant.


 The type of food served is typically diner-style food. However there are a few things that raise them up to a five-star rating:


 1. The service is genuinely friendly
2. The steak and eggs (for breakfast) is great - and arrives very quickly
3. Try the chicken-fried steak. It is to die for!
4. Instead of toast, have the pot of bread. You get an individual loaf that has been freshly baked in its own ramekin. Marvellous!


 Obviously when I was there, the waitress must have noticed my enthusiasm for the homemade bread because she brought me a second one (which I dispatched with equal enthusiasm).


 Vegas can be a mad place, but it is really nice to stumble across somewhere like Jamms every so often.

I go here maybe twice a week now. One of my favorite places. I absolutely love the atmosphere. Really homey and inviting. I love when Devin is my server she's always funny and sweet. I had Shirley too.she reminds me of talking to my grandma. She is absolutely adorable. The food is always great. Whenever I take someone new there I tell them you eyes will be bigger then your stomach. And it's true. All in all you will love it

The staff is always friendly and usually very quick to help you. We eat here once a week and the food is alway delicious and delivered in a timely manner. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a new breakfast spot. The wait is usually about 30 minutes on the weekends but it is well worth it. Their food is reasonably priced and superb.

The only reason I joined yelp was to tell everyone how horrible, crapy everything about that place was. I have actually been going there for years, and have noticed how service, and the food was going down hill. Everything is greasy. I mean everything. Today was crowded I will give them that. But the service sucked. And to top it all off I ordered a sandwich to take home with me. Now I know leaving it behind on the table in a doggie bag was my fault. I had returned no more than b a few minutes later to find out that they threw it away. I could deal with that.  But the way the they handled the situation with such a no care in the world to bad so sad attitude. Will guarantee that I will never go back to that hole in the wall sleazy place. You want a good clean classy place to have some breakfast. Go to the new York beagle cafe on buffalo.  You would never want to go back to jams agian.

When you combine delicious specialty dishes with hometown hospitality and reasonable prices,  you get a flawless experience that can't be argued with.  This place is 5 stars worthy and I recommend it to anyone.
Jamms restored my faith in finding a breakfast spot which feels like home.

I'm not usually disappointed with restaurants, but after continuous rave reviews and legends of the Pot of Bread, I think I expected a little more than meh. 

I went into Jamms with an open mind and was immediately struck by the prices. Over $2 for hollandaise? $2.75 for coffee? Almost all entrees at least $10? Jamms at least makes it up to you by providing a large portion for every full size meal you order. However, on a light wallet, I decided to stick to their small plates menu, which was actually quite a good value. 

For $4, I got half of a Smores waffle, complete with honey, chocolate chips, and marshmallows. The toppings were great: it's hard to screw up chocolate and marshmallows, after all. However, the waffle was shockingly stale. Every bite I took, it seemed as if it was getting harder and harder to chew, until eventually, I was having a hard time even cutting the waffle into pieces. Luckily, the chocolate and honey masked the almost tasteless and stale waffle. Still: not a good sign.

Next, for $5, I chose the option of the Reuben Benedict, a supposed fan favorite take on the typical eggs benedict. It was your typical benedict, with an english muffin, an egg, and hollandaise. This version, however, replaced the Canadian bacon with some corned beef. (Thank god: I eventually tried the normal egg benedict, and the ham was chewy and cold.) For a signature menu item, it fell flat. The english muffin had a strange rancid taste, and the corned beef was lacking in both amount and flavor. While the Canadian bacon might have a worse taste, it at least was a better value!

My girlfriend had the Bananas Foster pancakes, and while I personally didn't try them, she commented on the poor quality bananas and insisted that the IHOP version was superior.

Finally, my ultimate disappointment was in the $1.95 Pot of Bread. This is the thing Jamms is known for. It's the thing I was excited for, and the thing I had heard so much about from my companions. And, unfortunately, it was the thing that sucked the most. I ended up with the cinnamon raisin pot, but the expanded bread on top was stale and difficult to eat. For such a small pot, I was amazed at the struggle. It simply tasted old, and I wondered how long it had been sitting in the kitchen. The only "soft" part was at the very bottom, and there surely wasn't much to go around. The cinnamon doesn't add much, but I shudder to think of how it tasted without it. I also tried some of the peppermint Pot of Bread, and while it was remarkably better, it may have been because of the outlandish amount of frosting coated on the bread. The Pot of Bread may have been the worst $2 I've spent all month, and, quite frankly, the free bread at Outback has far more flavor and is actually consumable. 

Jamms was a fun attempt at trying something new, but breakfast foods can be hard to get right, especially with such a limited menu. The service was great, but I had hoped for a bit more. Instead, I left wishing I had gone to Denny's.

Bacon was crisped perfectly.  Pancakes were delish.  Corn beef hash was made from scratch - I love it!   Great cup of Joe.  Glad my wife and I came to have a great breakfast here.  Definitely a must if you wanna have a good ole breakfast without the hustle and bustle of the Strip.

Excellent food & service, thank you Roni! First time in on a Tuesday, a medical professional came in and took a seat at the counter, "hellos" & "hi" came from the wait team and they called him by name! Like I said excellent service, my home away from home!

By far one of the best places for breakfast in Vegas. If the locas love it it has to be good. Not crowded with tourists, so crazy kids or weird people here. The food is served it very generous portions and I love the olmelt skillets with gravy. The last time I was there they started doing fresh corned beef hash, wow!

By far the best hidden gem close to the strip.

What a great place to eat. I go about once a week and the place is always busy but the service is great. I always request to sit in Shays section. She is the sweetest girl and is super professional. Never leaves and empty plate or glass and has great recommendations of things new to eat.  Will always go back for the food and smiles.

Omg so full! The food was amazing and still had food to take home! Then lastly u want to check in and show then that u post to social media and they give u a 
discount!

The food amazing the coffee even better this place is absolutely the best. Saw it on tv and it's close to the house been there about 4 times tries something new every time and everything is great. Get there early cuz most the time is a wait but it is worth it

Man I had a hard time deciding how many stars to give this place.  We actually found this place by accident.  I wanted to try a place in the same strip mall and I won't give the name because that's another review.  Let's just say they sell poultry cooked different ways.  I let you do the math.  As I was bummed out driving I see a window blasted with "Best of Vegas" stickers.  I was about to eat my foot so we decided to stop in to the breakfast/lunch establishment.  As we were walking in I noted the best of stickers were kind of old.  I figured well it can't be that bad.  

We walked in  and were immediately greeted.  If I were to base the review only on the service and how friendly the employees are, then I would give it more stars.  The waitress was friendly and the guy who was filling our drinks was even more friendly.  Our 1 year old was a little fussy because she was probably hungry too.  They noticed this and brought us some crackers.  This was great!  If you are a waiter or waitress and notice a fussy kid and you know the little things that help parents then you instantly max out your tip.  Just a little piece of advise, go ahead and write that down.  

Let's take a look at the food.  I ordered the Jamm's omelet.  It had steak in it covered with a sauce.  When I looked at the steak and keep in mind I am not expecting fillet Mignon here it looked like the steak um's meat you get in your freezer aisle.  I didn't like it at all.  I think I really didn't like it because the omelet was about $10.  I guess I was just expecting more.  I did get the pot bread and it was really good.  My wife ordered the french toast and she thought it was tasty.  My daughters just at eggs and toast.  We emerged from the restaurant paying $30 for breakfast.  Ouch!  Overall I am sure at one time this place was great but as new restaurants opened it probably took away from this place.  There are a lot better breakfast places out there. Cheers!

This place is my new Vegas breakfast spot. Although it's a ways from the east side it's well worth the drive. Corn beef hash and eggs was to die for. The Oreo pot bread is like nothing I've ever eaten.

4.5 stars!
I was there this morning. We had three different plates and they were all good. For sure i recommend to ask for their Franch toast....dilucious!!! About the staff?? Having breakfast in a place where everybody has a smile on his face is the best way to start a new day!
See you soon!

This is a LONG time family favorite of ours. My mom has been going here for 15+ years. My best friend and I take our kids in now, at least once a month.

The service is outstanding! It's always the same group of ladies, and they remember everything. Kids names, drink orders, our regular menu choices. It's impressive to say the least!

The menu is vast to say the least. My all time favorite is the Sandy omlette. Think BLT with avocado wrapped in fluffy eggs, melted cheese and sour cream. You have your choice of bread side- but I would recommend the pot of bread. It's always slightly under baked, which we have grown to love.

Make Jamm's you family favorite, and let me know what you think!
Jamm's breakfast was vey affordable and WOW is the food great!

I wish that I have discovered this hidden treasure before! A friend of mine took me to Jamms for breakfast 2 weeks ago and I've been back twice since. The food is excellent, service is friendly and courteous and I can build my own waffle! Anyway I want it!!! Woohoo!

I'm a sucker for breakfast food. If only the appropriate time for breakfast was like... you know, 4pm... I'd be great.

So on the rare occasion that I AM up early for breakfast, I kind of like to reward myself for it. And as I was driving from my bank, I see this little restaurant in the plaza, and it's been rated Best of the LVR-J for 4 years, and it's only open until 3. Well I have to try it, I thought.

Best discovery on the Westside in a long time. The atmosphere is cozy, like your mom's kitchen (if she had an industrial kitchen). Knick-knacks and country sayings adorn the walls, and the staff treats you like you're in their house. Try the Texas Omelette (with chili con carne and cheddar cheese) or if you're daring, the White Castle Omelette (with ground beef and grilled onions -- yes, like a Slider!). They're famous for their "pots of bread." It's soft and doughy, and if you order the Cinnamon Raisin pot of bread, it's like eating a cinnamon roll.

They also have lunch items, which I'm sure I'll try someday, when I can get past the breakfast pages without choosing something.

A really good, of the strip place for breakfast.  I've found there's not a lot of places to grab breakfast on the strip, unless you're talking a buffet. Too many people still asleep I guess. But if you stay off the strip and are looking for a non-cookie cutter restaurant Jamms is it.

I had the eggs Benedict, which was perfect, and my girlfriend had the steak and eggs. We split a strawberries  and cream pot of bread which is really a must if you go here. 

Service was friendly and fast. Prices were reasonable. We'll definitely come back on our next Vegas trip. Highly recommended.

We dont live over here but make the trip across town...its that good. Always amazing food, always great servers. Homey atmosphere and homey food :) get the chicken/waffle sandwich. Its AMAZING!!! And the french toast dipped in corn flakes and fried up is also a must have!!!
I have been missing out! The pot of bread is reason enough to keep coming back. My omelet & home fries were delicious! Service was quick and the waitresses were friendly. I'll definitely be back!

The service is amazing, the food is delicious, and they keep up with the cleanliness 

I always leave with a smile (:
If you want to feel like family, then come here (:
los french toast. estan buenos lo recomiendo con fresas los huevos baacon salsicha están bien el lugar esta agradable tranquilo

Just fantastic. From the host to the waiter and even the bus boys and runners, everyone and everything was great. 

When my wife and I arrived we almost shied away from eating here because it looked very busy; there was a small group of people outside even. But that group disappeared fast so we went on in. We were greeted quickly, had our name taken down by the hostess and were seated in probably less than 10 minutes. Shortly after, we were brought some water. A few minutes after that our waitress came and grabbed our orders. I mentioned we had a coupon from Yelp for a free pot of bread for checking in. I showed her my phone and she returned a minute later with the orange cranberry version, which was really good; fresh and still warm. 

For our orders, my wife got an omelette, hash browns and some toast. I got the Hungry Lion breakfast which is your standard breakfast platter of 2 eggs, 2 sausage links, 2  pieces  of bacon, 2 pancakes and a big slice of ham (bonus points for putting the butter for the pancakes in a little cup and not glopping it onto the cakes themselves). We also shared a french press of coffee which they brought out before the food. Again, everything was great. Coffee, food, everything. And it's all super inexpensive! For the two of us we spent less than $25. You can also get an extra 10% off if you show the hostess that you checked in on Yelp. 

I made sure to tip the waitress really well, she deserved it. Overall, you can't ask for better service, better food, and better prices.

C'est mon restaurant déjeuner favori à Las Vegas. C'est un espèce de Chez Cora. Beau, bon, pas cher, avec une ligne d'attente. ;-) Et comparativement aux buffets dans les hôtels, chez Jamms c'est excellent et pas dispendieux. Et la qualité des ingrédients est là. 

Petit truc, si la ligne d'attente est trop longue, le bar est une option rapide, sans besoin d'attendre.

What a great place. There weren't any recent reviews that we could find so we thought we would try it out. I am here to report that it is amazingly good food and lots of it.

In the land of all you can eat, and Feng Shue less is more, they serve you well and you leave having eaten all you can.  both my wife's and my omelettes were filled to bursting. Her bacon and avocado were more than sufficient in the omelette. It was so big she ended up having to open it up to eat the insides and then still left food behind. The hashbrowns were done perfectly, crispy and flavorful and a good-sized portion. The homemade chips are perfectly sliced and served in their own little french fry basket. The bread pots are amazing. That special of the week was the pumpkin and cream cheese glaze bread pot and it was delicious.
If you're thinking about coming, do it! This is a fantastic place for breakfast.

One of the many things I love about Vegas is all the little breakfast places they have all around town. It's nice to know that I've got options if I don't want a Grand Slam breakfast from Dennys. 

My husband and I came here for one of our Sunday breakfasts. I'm a fan of Corned Beef Hash so when I read Russ V's review on it I decided to give it a try. I liked this corn beef because it wasn't salty and I knew it was fresh because it didn't have the mushy consistency that canned corned beef has. My order came with scrambled eggs, and house fries with a side of sourdough bread. I'm a little weird when it comes to breakfast I usually will put the eggs and the corned beef hash on the toast. Once the toast runs out I save the rest and take it home. Corned beef on top of white rice is yummy! The portions are huge here so there is enough for like three small meals! I was also very full because before the meal came out we had the free Cinnamon Pot bread. Just mention Yelp and you too can get a free one! It was slightly salty on the top but once you get inside the bread it's nice and soft. It's tastes really good with coffee. 

My husband had the Sandy Omelet that comes with bacon, tomato, avocado, sour cream and cheddar cheese. I sampled the omelet and it was really good too! It reminded me of the Cracked Egg's North Shore Scramble but in a Omelet.

Duuuude this place is awesome. I've been in Vegas 6 years and had never heard of it until today. Service was phenomenal, atmosphere is charming, like comfy grandmas house. Plenty of items to choose from on the menu, so we pigged out and ordered for 6 people. There were two of us. If you like bomb ass food, good service, and fair prices, go to Jamms. French toast fries. Need I say more?

Good just got better. We've been going to Jamms for years, as we love their large selection of yummy omelettes and their pot of bread. We went a couple of months ago and learned they now have cinnamon raisin pot of bread. Yum!

I wanted a different breakfast experience than another restaurant with the word 'egg' in their name so based on Yelp reviews, my husband and I decided to try this place. 
We drove a little ways from our side of town and would do it again to come back here!

It's a cute little place in a strip mall off of Rainbow & Charleston. Upon entering, we were immediately greeted and seated. Our drink orders were taken, literally the second we sat down.
Our very cheerful and friendly server asked to take our orders very soon after our drink orders were taken. Being this was our first time here, we needed a couple of minutes.

I ordered the veggie omelet and my cute husband had bacon and eggs. I really liked that the food was NOT greasy! The omelet was huge and stuffed with perfectly sauteed veggies. I had home fries that were seasoned just right, AND I really liked the fact that they didn't drench my toast with butter! My toast had just the right, even spread of butter, which is rare.

All in all, the service was great, the food was very good, and the prices were pretty much average to most other places. I would definitely make the trek to have breakfast here again.

Great local hole-in-the-wall with a friendly diner atmosphere.  We ate breakfast there.  I had a meaty omelet and my wife had the eggs Benedict.   Both were tasty and reasonably priced.  We were headed out of Vegas going North, and it was an easy stop before getting out of town.  

They are apparently famous for their bread bowl, wish we would have gotten that.  We didn't notice it until we exited.  I had whole wheat bread with my omelet and it was amazing.  Pretty sure it was homemade.  The texture was soft yet chewy and buttery... man that was some good bread.

If you eat here, pay cash.

Someone decided after I left that I should be leaving a 40% tip.  Just found the altered charge.

Service was ok, but someone @ Jamms is definitely over valuing themselves at that amount.

I won't be going back.

How is this place getting so many great reviews.  The food was so bland and lifeless.  My wife thought it was 2 stars at best, but I guess I am a sucker for any breakfast.  We both got menu items that had a specialty star next to it even.  Service was prompt and friendly so I guess 3 stars is about right.
Bananas Foster Pancakes were awesome. We make time for breakfast at Jamms every time we are in Vegas. Good food, large portions, and friendly staff.

I am a breakfast person! It is my favorite meal so I try breakfast places all the time. I stumbled upon this place when looking for Sundays breakfast. First I went to babystacks but they had a 45 minute wait. 

Me and my boyfriend came here and there was no wait. 

I ordered the mushroom omelete which had tons of cheese :) and a bagel with cream cheese

The service was perfect and very helpful our waitress was lenore. 
Their coffee is excellent and we ended up getting a pot of bread (the nutella peanut butter one) sooo goood!!!
This place is great. We go here often, definitely my favorite breakfast place off strip in Las Vegas. Great service, great food. Can't ask for more.
Went to grab a nice breakfast with friends. Food was delicious, customer service was great and the prices were reasonable. I'd go back to try another food item.

First visit today to this restaurant and it is awesome. I cannot believe we have not been there before.  My hubby wanted breakfast and I wanted lunch.  Hubby ordered corned beef hash and said it was homemade and delicious.  I had a tuna melt which was very yummy and so filling. Hugh portions and the service is excellent.  We will definitely be back as there was so much on the menu that i want to try.
Great food and very friendly service.  Our server Staci was very attentive and nice. The food was amazing very flavorful.  Definitely recommend!

Came here with the wife on a Wednesday afternoon about 1 o'clock.  Read some great reviews on Yelp, so we thought we would try it.  We really wanted some breakfast.  

The wife ordered the rueben Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce was okay, fake tasting.  The corned beef was awesome.  You could tell that they made it in house.  They overcooked her eggs and we had to ask for new ones.  The hashbrowns were crispy and good.  I ordered their Jamms omelet.  It was stuffed with thinly sliced roast beef that was crisped on the grill with grilled mushrooms, onions and cheddar cheese.  This was all topped with a homemade bearnaise.  It was fabulous. It all went perfectly together and I loved the crispy beef.  I also ordered their pot of bread.  It had a crunchy outside and a soft inside.  Very good. 

We will return and when I do I will be ordering something with that wonderful corned beef.
My daughter and I found this little gem on our way out of town.  Outstanding service, great food & a true local atmosphere.  We will be back!

We were recommended here and it wasn't a bad choice.  I had the steak and eggs plate.  I got my eggs scrambled with American cheese, and sides of hash browns, coffee pot of bread and a plate of red velvet pancakes.  I also tried the raisin pot of bread and their cabbage soup.  Everything was good.  The eggs were cooked to my liking, the hash browns were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and the pancakes were fluffy.  I liked the coffee pot of bread better than the raisin but both were good.  The only thing wrong was the steak that I ordered medium but got well done and burnt.  The service was good and we got 10% off by making a Facebook post.  Can't beat that.

We split an Irish Skillet. HUGE. Neither of us could finish our half. Really tasty. I enjoyed the melted cheddar. The cinnamon and raisin pot of bread was like a light and fluffy cinnamon roll. A nice addition. The staff was super nice and attentive.

Coffee is very weak. Dirty water type.
Servers are so busy cause they also are tasked with making toast, english muffins, etc. They never have a free moment to check back with customers. Poor gals. You get one touch only. 
Kitchen staff is extremely fast and efficient turning out food at amazing pace.
Note, the bus 'persons' (red shirt) takes your drink order, but not your food order. You need to flag down a server (black shirt) for that.
Waffle is soft not crispy.
Hash brown is the thick kind, little crispy surface and lots of soft center.
Servers were too busy for me to contemplate ordering the 'pot o bread' as an afterthought. 
Pay at front when you leave.
Great breakfast spot. Diner style with great options and great service. The potted bread is a must have.
Every time we come to Vegas we make sure to stop in at least once. The food is delicious. Be sure to try the Pot of Bread!!! The service is friendly and efficient. We LOVE this place!
Awesome place to eat , great food,, eggs Benedict is in point. Omelets are great. Everything on menu is tasty and and service is anyways great

It's delicious! It feels like a diner that cares. TRY anything with corned beef in it (Reuben, amazing! Or the Hash).. Chicken BLT waffle sandwich was a treasure as well. Shirley was our waitress and she was attentive and friendly. The atmosphere is very comfortable and welcoming. Food came out fast and hot. Overall a great experience. Definitely coming back

I love this restaurant. Their cute decor makes it a home-y feel. We came for weekend brunch and the place was packed. My party of 4 and I had to wait about 5 minutes for a table.

In my opinion, Their breakfast is almost, if not better, than the Egg and I. Service was awesome, food tasted great...everything came out pippin hot and fresh and the prices are on point. 

Also, anybody who loves biscuits and gravy would loveeeee it here. Their gravy had chunks of meat in it. Yummy!! =)
Food is delicious and service is Fabulous!! The cinnamon raisin pot bread is amazing! If you're ever in vegas be sure to find this place...it's definitely worth the trip! !

Delicious all American breakfast diner.  That sums up Jamms in a nutshell.  First time eating here and we felt like we were treated like regulars.  We had the French toast, pancakes and bacon & eggs and everything came out fast and hot.  We've been to a couple of different breakfast/brunch places around the valley and immediately this place stands out as a gem.  We will surely come back and bring friends to try this place!

For a Saturday morning, there was only a 5 minute wait. 
The first thing that caught my eye was the French Press coffee. This was a first for me and it was so incredibly good. They even offered a to go cup for what we didn't drink.
The corn beef hash is hands down the BEST EVER!!!!!! It was what my husband had, along with the carmelized onion, bacon, cream cheese pot of bread. Dayyyyum!!!
My next trip I'll be trying the S'mores pancakes. Sounds like a little piece of heaven. 
The servers were on point with everything!!
Check it out!

Been here for lunch many times.  I don't get breakfast anymore because they don't know how to cook eggs.  The sandwiches are ok.  The cuban is edible as is the chicken salad.  The burgers are small and over priced.  The place is always kept way too cold for me and the service can be down right rude sometimes.

We love Jamms!  Take mom there every morning after sleeping in the hospital for the last few weeks next to my dad and she loves it. Fresh coffee Fresh Hot Food every time without fail and they always have a smile. My 18month old loves Shay! & we do too! Excellent Friendly service and when there is a line it goes so fast the staff have it down to a science.

I wrote a review about a month and a half ago for this restaurant. We had a disappointing experience. The Owner of the restaurant read my review and wasn't happy, so she invited us back for complimentary lunch or breakfast to try and make up for the experience I had. That is excellent customer service and really shows they care about the experience of their customers. 

We came back and the experience was better. We both ordered something different this time. I had the Wild West Burger and she had the French Toast. The burger was cooked as I liked it at. The chili that came with it was good. I tried the french toast and it was cooked great!

Here's what I've found in my two experiences here: They have a wonderful staff who are friendly and seem dedicated to customer service. The food is cooked very well. Everything is cooked exactly how it should be. But my problem is the food does not wow me. There isn't any thing unique or special about it. The food isn't bad, it's just not something worth 4 or 5 stars.

They're an okay place to go, they have some pretty nice omelettes but other than that it's a pretty average place. 

The French toast tastes more burnt than anything, you'll have to drown it in syrup to be edible. The orange juice taste synthetic and watered down. The pricing is cheap compared to other places and it's pretty cute old fashioned inside.

I just had the best omelet! It was a mushroom, brocolli and cream cheese omelet...cooked to a PERFECT fluffy consistency. It wasn't gooey like some other omelets that I typically get. They used chopped mushrooms (not canned) and yummy chunks of fresh brocolli. It also came with hashbrowns and their famous "Cup of Bread." The bread was flaky and buttery--delicious on its own or with jam. My friend ordered their Philly Cheese Steak, and she loved it too! Service was great...really friendly team.

Stopped here after a quick search before starting the drive back home. Sat at the counter and was quickly greeted and set up w coffee and water. Menu choices looked good. I tried the Denver potato pancake. Also started w the little pot o bread. Excellent! The entree was presented quickly and was very tasty indeed. This will be my new go to for breakfast away from the Strip.

Great comfort food for breakfast or lunch. Jamms restaurant is located on Rainbow and Charleston. I love this mom n' pop restaurant...quaint interior with dated decor that makes you feel at home. 

In terms of service and food, I prefer this place over other breakfast places like Egg & I, Egg Works, Original Pancake House, Cracked Egg, and so forth. It's definitely not a healthy breakfast and can be slightly heavy for some but I still like its tasty home cooking. Service can be hit-or-miss with some servers being very attentive while some completely forgetting your existence. Either way, all servers are super friendly and their uplifting spirit will help you start your day on a bright note. 

My favorite is Jamms signature omelet ($9.99) which comes with sliced steak, onion, mushroom and cheese topped with bearnaise sauce. I have no idea what bearnaise sauce is but based on Google search, it's a sauce made with butter, egg yolk and wine vinegar. I thought it was similar to gravy but it was more fragrant because of herbs. Tip is to ask for sauce on the side because they give you a lot. This omelet is meaty, cheesy and filling, easily my top favorite here. 

French dip ($9.99) is another meaty/filling dish that comes with generous slices of roast beef. These slices of beef are in stack of three to four and comes in a hero roll. Their au jus was little different from what I had expected and almost felt like it was a french onion soup. I was surprised that I actually liked the sandwich without dipping in their au jus. 

Philly cheese steak ($9.79) is nothing special here. I wouldn't order this unless you are craving philly cheese steak. 

Pot of bread is free with Yelp chek-in. You can get the original, cinnamon raisin or special of the week. On my recent visit, I redeemed my check-in offer for their peaches and cream pot of bread. Bread itself was doughy and had small chunks of peaches inside. Cream cheese was provided on the side. 

Inarguably one of the best breakfast joint in town. I hope to keep coming back here for many years ahead.
War einfach wieder super Breakfast bei Jamms. Nette Bedienung, perfekte Qualität und Sandy gehört einfach dazu . Fühle mich hier, wie zu Hause und bin beim nächsten Trip nach Vegas 100% wieder dort

We came here for breakfast on a Vegas trip, my husband likes to find local mom and pop places rather than the usual tourist traps.

My son ordered the smores pancakes which are actually chocolate chip pancakes with caramel sauce and whip cream.  I tried a bite and they were delicious.  The pancakes were light, airy and chocolatey.  I was surprised they weren't overly sweet.

I ordered the french toast with strawberries.  It was very good with fresh strawberries instead of limp soggy thawed berries and they were plentiful.  The french toast is drudged in crushed cornflakes so they had a nice bite to them and no soggy bread.

My husband ordered the corn beef  hash, this is where they lost two stars.  What arrived looked like browned sliced pieces of lunchmeat.  He told me it was so salty he couldn't even taste anything else.  To make sure he wasn't being overly dramatic, I had a small taste.  OMG it was the saltiest thing I've ever eaten and I like salt.  I drank my entire drink after that small bite.  It literally tasted like someone spilled the entire salt container in the hash and fried my taste buds, glad I was done with my french toast.  

Bottom line, don't go anywhere near that hash if you have functional taste buds and anything but perfect blood pressure.  Get the french toast.
Pot of bread is so yummy!  The Reuben omelet is also delicious!  My husband go the Denver omelet and it was chocked full of ham and veggies.

Thinking of an omelet?  This place has them ALL!  http://www.jammsrestaurant.com/
I ordered the White Castle Omelet which was stuffed with crumbled burger!  It was huge--all of their omelets are huge!  Wilson Y. was correct when he said "The Pot of Bread is tasty and soft."  In fact, I'd try it you get to visit because the only other place I know that makes it like this is a place called the Summy House located in Manheim, PA.

Jamms is located in a strip mall along Rainbow.  Inside, it beams with natural sunlight.  The decor is upbeat with a lot of personal touches.  The staff are friendly and fast.
I can always count on great food here. Service always comes with a smile. And the bread pots...We really like the reduced size plates. The regular omelets are huge.

Trying something new off of yelp recommendations never fails! This place has excellent service, number one. And the food is an even tie. We all had something different, and every dish was delicious. Our waitress was so kind to tell us the specialties to help us decide. A little wait, but SO worth it!

Wonderful service!! Food is delicious and quick, the right amount of food. Shirley was outstanding and makes you feel like you are at home. Their hollandaise sauce is wonderful, not too salty. We recommend the French press coffee, prefect size for two cups of coffee. Prices were very reasonable and the servers don't make you feel like a bother if you want substitutions!!! We will be back here again and again!

We stopped here because of the high reviews, and everything, from food to service, was 5 stars all the way. 

The small plate option is awesome. For someone like me who doesn't always eat so much for breakfast, I was able to get an omelet that was just the right size! The small plate omelet is about half the size of a regular omelet and also half the price. 

We also got their famous "pot of bread" (got a free one for checking in on Yelp!). The weekly special was jalapeño mozzarella and the classic cinnamon raisin. Both were super yummy!

Sandy was our server and she was great- very friendly and efficient with bringing our food, refilling coffee, and checking on us. I wish more places were like Jamms!
Always consistent service and food. Would recommend to anyone and we been here a couple times, of course we'll be back!

Love coming here for their pot bread but today i ate something different had one of their burritos it was huge and so filing. Our server was awesome always made sure we were ok...surprised my lil ate all her food for a big portion.

I didn't think our meal here was fantastic or terrible. It was just okay. My hubby thought the sausage gravy was a bit flat.  Other than that, it was just your standard diner breakfast. The pot of bread was probably the best thing about it.  Service was good.
We will be coming back my 4 hungry picky kids loved it.  All of our food was made fresh.  Love this plAce

While we were told the wait at 11am on a Sunday would be 15-20 minutes, I was pleasantly surprised when we sat after only about 8 or 9 minutes. They do indeed turn tables quickly, but at no time did we feel rushed. The staff hustles, our waitress was efficient and cheerful, the coffee was hot and eye-opening.

My daughter had Jamm's French Toast which is battered then encrusted with corn flakes before frying. She says I will have to make mine this way from now on. I had Jamm's Speciality Omelet which has steak, grilled onions and mushrooms and lots of mild cheddar. Guests get their choice of hash browns or home fries and a bread selection - English muffin, toast, their signature pot o'bread. I chose the home fries and the special of the day pot o'bread with cream cheese frosting. 

The long and short of it is that we both left stuffed and happy, several wait staff wished us a good day and that we'd be back soon. We don't get to Vegas very often (about every 2-3 years) but we will certainly come back to Jamm's again.

My very first yelp review. Had to do it, because if you haven't tried jamms, you're missing out. 

It's located on rainbow and charleston by the albertsons. Blends in well, I've lived in vegas my whole life and just discovered this place recently. 

My girlfriend and I have only gone for breakfast a handful of times, and each time we were impressed with the price and quality of food. I got the bumper omlette; fluffy eggs, mushrooms, broccoli, cream cheese, and topped with hollandaise sauce. I added bacon to it. AMAZING!! The service was pretty good, especially considering how busy it was. My girlfriend had a pretty customized order, and they had no problem with it. 

I would recommend Jamm's to anyone who likes breakfast food, and is tired of Dennys and ihop. Be sure to go early though, as they are only open for breakfast and lunch and close at 2pm!

P.S. You have not lived until you get a "pot of bread" from these guys!!!

Excellent breakfast foods with good company. The place was packed so we did some quick shopping nearby. Ate our free pot of gingerbread bread, eggs bene on a waffle, and a straight-up waffle with some powdered sug for the lady. No complaints!

This is a great little breakfast joint. I haven't been here for lunch or dinner, but I assume it's good as well. 

First off, they serve illy coffee which is a big plus for me. Warm and friendly, the staff is super nice and attentive. The food is good. Like home cooking. To me it is not out of this world but is better than the major chains like IHOP or Denny's.

Service is decent but definitely show up early because this place gets packed pretty fast.

Jamms is like dining at Grams. 

Top to bottom with that old school look, closed-in booths and seating areas, plus that dated decor that is at everyone's grandparent's house. But just like your gramm gramm's house, you tend to eat all the food because it's just that good. 

No fancy frills, just down home cooking that's definitely not diet friendly, especially with what I decided to eat, The Country Skillet. A heart stopping meal filled with scrambled eggs, sausage, ham, onions, mushrooms and covered in home fries with gravy. I also got the Pot of Bread, which is on the house with a Yelp check-in, free carbs!

The skillet is huge and a very heavy meal that's perfect for sharing or that horrendous hangover that just won't seem to go away. The home fries added a great crunchy texture, which is definitely what this plate of needed with so many soft food items. Gravy, gravy, gravy, it was the perfect addition to the mushrooms and eggs and brought everything together. 

Like I said a free "Pot of Bread" with a Yelp check-in, and they offer three choices; original, cinnamon raisin and a savory flavor that I believe rotates.  I went with the basic "POB" and it was amazing. Soft, pillowy, and all of that melt in your mouth goodness, trust me check-in and be happy. 

Jamms is well, the Jam!

I didn't do the review while in the restaurant  because I want to give readers an accurate review without feeling pressured to give a great review because of the ten percent discount so I skipped doing the check in on yelp and taking the discount so that I can give you guys an accurate review which is, 
the staff is friendly and the food is OK it could use more seasoning and flavor on his own without you having to put ketchup Hot sauce or A1 sauce on it. I wouldn't recommend ordering the steak because it was not tender and it's very poor choice cut of meat the little bread pots are good the eggs were just loaded with cheese with no flavor  no salt or pepper and I had to send it back the crunchy French toast is OK we did however like the orange juice
Awesome great corn beef hash . Tres Leche pot of bread amazing. Will stop by again if in Vegas ;-)

Hello deliciousness! I've heard great things about this place and was eager to try it out and I'm so glad I did! The food was great and the service was great! The reason I give it four stars is that the place is a little out of date. Also, Seating is limited so if you have a big party you're not able to sit at one table. Besides that I am now a regular customer. :)
Ham steak and eggs was a good choice. Service was very good and very fast. Glad I stopped in.

I love this place. The decor reminds me of the mom and pop restaurants back home. Recently tried the Irish Skillet. It was awesome. My wife doesn't even like hash and she liked this item. I haven't tried anything on the lunch menu yet because I am always in the mood for eggs and bacon. If you go on the weekends prepare to wait. It is a bit small and always busy.

Just had to write a review because it is very rare that from the time you walk in to the time you leave the staff was so friendly food was fabulous the bread in the pot YUMMY  they are only open for Breakfast and lunch but if you get a chance stop by you wont be disappointed
Thanks Jamms for another amazing breakfast and to our favorite server, sandy! Make sure you he a chance to try their biscuits and gravy!

Great place for breakfast. Portions were large and the food was delicious. Coffee was pretty good. Went on a Monday just before noon and there wasn't a wait.

Service was good enough, wasn't overly impressed with friendliness or anything but they weren't rude or unwelcoming.

I'll come back again :) 

PS- For those of you who like S'mores, beware of their S'mores pancake. It includes a ton of Caramel that's kinda overpowering. Tasted like a Caramello candy bar more than smores.

Been going to Jamms for years and it just get better and better.
You can't leave without having Pot Bread--different fillings every time.

Laurie Childers

I have been coming here for 10+ years and never a bad experience. Sandy is the best server, fast friendly and funny. If you want a delicious treat try their weekly pot a bread. Also I love the Erica small plates which allows for us Weightloss patients to order in small portions!!! I will always remain a loyal customer for the next 10+ years!!!

This was another pick based on good Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint.  Again coming in late I expected a delay, but we were seated within 10 minutes.  The service was prompt and the staff was polite and helpful.  I had a standard sausage and egg breakfast which isn't too exciting. But being gluten intolerant I don't have a lot of choices that aren't some combination of meat, eggs and potatoes.  Still, it was well done and the server let me make substitutions for the bread item.  My wife had the chicken fried steak and eggs, and a "Orange Creamcicle" bread pot.  I was jealous because the bread pot looked like it would be really good.  Additionally she said the entire meal was delicious.  If you don't have to pick and choose like I do, their menu has a huge variety of choices.  Since they were mostly bread items I didn't spend much time with it, but they had an insert menu that offered small portions for less money so you can sample a large variety of their offerings without ordering multiple meals or eating off someone else's plate.  For the sake of the review I should have paid more attention to exactly what they called it, but this would be a good place to go to sample a variety of breakfast offerings.

We came here over spring break. The place was packed with a ten minute wait on a Tuesday morning. We were seated quickly and the server was there right away to get our drink order. There are many interesting options on the menu, but we decided on the classics. I got the pancake special which comes with pancakes, bacon or sausage, and I eggs. When I asked, they had no problem swapping out the eggs for hash browns. The pancakes were very thick and fluffy, easily the best part of the dish. The bacon was decent sized and just the right crispness. I could have used a little more crispiness on the hash browns, but they were pretty good. My boyfriend got the more super sized version which also came with sausage and a ham steak. The ham steak was average sized, cooked nicely. We got a free pot of break with check-in. We got the weekly special which was rainbow sprinkles. It was soft, flaky, and delicious. This is a great spot for breakfast!

Great place to stop in for some solid food.  Places like this is what I love that you dont have to eat on the strip or anything.  I had the cuban panini and my wife had a sub.  So good and they tasted well.  We also had a pot of bread and it was good as well.  Staff was friendly and this is a nice little place to come eat and relax.  Good food and Good Service.

The girlfriend and I where in vegas for a small vacation, and while we where in town we wanted to get off the strip. So hit up some friends, and they said we had to try Jamms out. And so we did. Well worth it. 

In a strip mall, and perfect size. Also very popular! So recommended times to show up, try around 8:30, after 9 you have a 15 min wait. which is well worth it. The decor is fun and light. The staff is incredibly nice, which was awesome. The menu has a lot to chose from, which can be hard to chose from. LOL.. I got the chicken freid steak, which was delicious, and the girlfriend got the multi grain pancakes, which where awesome, I had a few bites and was hooked. The second time we went there I ordered the jamms french toast, which is french toast covered in con flakes, it was awesome.. The girlfriend loved the multi grain pancakes so much, she got that again. Fresh coffee, and the staff was on top of refilling the cups non stop. Bottom line, its the local spot for breakfast. So if youre looking for a pretty cheap and quick breakfast, hit up Jamms!!!

I've been coming here since it opened! Great and friendly staff. Best breakfast in town. My go to items are the waffle Benedict and the Jamms signature omelette with steak mushrooms and onions and cheese, the Pot of bread is a must!

Fantastic meal and the free pot bread for checking in on yelp is awesome. Will definitely be back to eat here soon. So many thing on the menu looked great. Today I had the biscuits and gravy with bacon. Everything was great!

A locals restaurant, for sure, but super friendly to non regulars and THE FOOD!!!! The best french toast I've ever tasted, hands down. Amazing omelets, chewy super cheesy (the way I personally like them) The bread pots are like risen pots of yeast heroin. If I think too much about the bread pot I'll be right back there tomorrow morning consuming my entire day's  calorie consumption on multiple bread pots with the addictive cream cheese topping. They keep the coffee filled and the food out fast. Been coming here for over a year while out monthly for work and has been consistently excellent!

Love eating here. Food is fresh and delicious. Staff are pleasant and courteous. Looks as if they have done some decorating. I know they have added new menu items. I like the new "tapas" plates. Can select variety without eating a lot.
Great food and service! Place is small but comfortable. As soon as we sat down we had someone come to us for drinks. I will definitely go back to try some of the other menu choices.
