This is probably the best place to eat if you are feeling for something homey. Sandy omelette brings joy to your taste buds and the corn beef hash is simple but it won't taste the same anywhere else. The coffee is freshly brewed served in great looking jamms mugs that you can purchase while checking out. The staff is very friendly and attentive giving it the feeling of small town dinner.

I wanted to love this place. The potted bread was good, but not tdf or anything. I might go back to try some kinda eggy or pancakey or waffley meal or maybe a sandwich...give them a chance to redeem themselves after the awful corned beef hash, which really was a dire salty pile of mush next to some flavor-free hash browns and perfectly cooked poached eggs. Hormel's cbh is miles better than that stuff was. In future when I want cbh, I'll either have it at home out of a can or pay a bit too much for it at Hash House A Go Go (for all that place's faults, they do know their namesake). 
I want to give them more stars as I always prefer to support local family-run places, but for now, it's just a Meh.

The greeting at the front door is warm and inviting.  I love how they change the window paintings periodically.  The wait can be long, so come a bit earlier.  The decor is greasy-spponish, but everything seems clean.  

There's so much on the menu, that you can find something you like.  Avoid the steak and eggs.  Chicken and waffles are very good.  Egg white omelettes excellent...in fact everything here is pretty solid.  Kids love the strawberry waffles, the s'mores pancakes (seriously, which kid wouldn't).  The regular coffee is good, but the coffee press is worth looking like a nouveau french pretentious wannabe intellectual.  Yep, it's that good.  

Again, a good place to start the day.

I don't get what all the fuss is about the wait is crazy for some nasty dry food I swear people on Yelp be straight trippin it couldn't be these many good reviews on some dry cracker food . like there pot bread is dry I don't get what is so exciting about it I mean it was free so that was cool but other then that I will never be back they got 2 stars cause people that work there are nice and that's about it .

We came on a rare Sunday we were actually awake. The place had a steady queue, a sign of good food. There isnt much in waiting area and I hate creating a clusterfuck in front of the hostess booth where people are trying to ojt their name and check out. it was too cold to hang outside so we left our number with them to sit in the car instead.

We decided to share

Rueben Benedict -I was expecting more like chunky pieces of corned beef but they use deli cut for this but guess that makes sense too. Overall solid Benedict as the Hollandaise was perfectly done.  We got their home froed potatoes which was pretty good flavor with peppers and onions. Only I might ask to get a bit of it crisped up next time.  

Jamms Signature Omelette - this isn't the fluffiest of omeletttes and is stiffer but still good. This has onions, mushrooms, peppers, steak and cheese in it topped with bernaise. It wasn't plentiful on the thin sliced steak (think like philly cheese or gyro), but all the components were decent. We also got home fried potatoes with this and this comes with a bread choice.  

Seeing as they are famous for potted bread we chose that.  They always have plain or cinnamon and rotate a flavor of the week. Vanilla caramel was this weeks which soinds like everything we liked. It is similar to brioche crisp on the top and fluffy inside and theu fave us a whipped butter frosting like spread.  Yeah,  Im a fan of the bread.  

Service was always friendly, and definitely on top of things. They are quite speedy here, our food was out in no time and drinks refilled stat. 

I can see why people like this place.  Its solid, no frills American hearty portioned breakfast with good service. I'll be back if I ever wake up early enough again.

This is a gem in the Vegas locals breakfast/brunch circuit. I've been meaning to try it out and when I did, I could easily see why. The staff is very attentive and friendly, you have that family friendly diner atmosphere and the coffee is just eye opening, literally!

I enjoyed a tasty breakfast burrito with their homemade salsa. It definitely didn't disappoint and I'll be sure to return to try some more of their other items in their very extensive menu.

One of the best restaurants we have been to in Las Vegas.   Food was excellent, staff was awesome and very friendly.  Our waitress,  Jasmine was wonderful.   Prices are very reasonable. 

Would highly recommend to anyoneq looking for a great breakfast.   Can wait to come back and try lunch menu.  Looked great.

I'm the type of person that once I find a dish I love; I never really try anything else. And at Jamms, the Irish skillet is my favorite! Potatoes, corned beef, onions, and smothered in cheese... yummy! It's a lot of food (can't possibly finish it) and at $10, not overly priced.  Today I tried the pumpkin spice pot of bread and it was alright. Not too bad.  

I really like this place. The service is always good and they always give you gum on the way out. LOL

The interior is very worn down. I felt a bit like being in an old bowling alley, but without the ambiance.  The floor was so dirty it's probably criminal, and needs new carpets badly. Outside on the window they proudly present themselves as "best of Vegas", but  not since 2006, and those 9 years show...

The 'thing' I ate was featured on a TV show, and was interesting, but poorly executed. It had almost no taste, just a lot of "meh". The fries were dusted with powdered sugar, which made no sense, and mostly made a mess. It needs spices, herbs, crunch, and more to salvage.

Price would have been OK, if the food had been OK. Service was fine, although there was some ruckus in the kitchen that was rather noisy. I had to ask for a refill, it wasn't offered, and I got it just before I left. 

In a couple of years, unless they get their act together, this will be on Restaurant Impossible...

If you want to get off the Strip and go explore the outskirts of Vegas, take a few minutes to drive down to Jamms. They have a ton of different food creations and it's a locals favorite. Great food! Excellent prices and fun to go to!
Great food and service! We live right around the corner and go here regularly. My husband always gets the Reuben Benedict and I love the French toast. Biscuits and gravy are really good too.

Love this place! We have been there a few times now when we head to Vegas. It might even beat our previous favorite breakfast spot in Hash House. The portions are more reasonable than Hash House delivers, which we appreciate and the price tag is less than hash house too. This mom and pop place has more of a truck stop feel and the fair is unique and special. Things you won't experience anywhere else. I love the little bread bowls with fun flavors of the week to choose from. The bread melts in your mouth. The hot chocolate is wonderful. And I haven't had a bad breakfast item yet. They have some really nice variations on how eggs are done. The flavors are homemade and wonderful. I haven't tried lunch or dinner here yet but breakfast is always the bomb! We will be back again and again!

Can't disagree more with this overall yelp rating!   Strike 1: coffee was served in a dirty mug with lip smudge marks still on it.                Strike 2: I order jams French toast and got waffles instead. I read it off the menu to the waitress . She argued with me when the wrong dish came out and said "are you ok " as though I am crazy.                           Strike3: the waffle was baaad , it was grainy and tasted like it was never mixed.The worst waffle that I ever ate. The bacon was cheap buffet quality . My bill was $17 with tax and tip. It was $16.99 too much. Keep away from Jamms, go to the omlet house or original pancake instead.

Classic and reliable breakfast food provided by friendly and responsive staff. The pot of bread is a fun diversion from the usual-usual. The Country Skillet was delicious and well balanced. There was a good amount of meat/egg/potato mixed together (some skillets at other places are 70% potato and few ingredients). The scrambled eggs were fresh and fluffy. Their omelets are also hefty. The Sandy Omelet packs in a lot of flavor and should satisfy your hunger.

All in all, an easy and pleasant experience.

I lived in Vegas for 6+ years but actually had never been to Jamm's so was excited to try it while visiting after reading all the positive reviews. Nice place, comfortable setting, good service but very average food at best. The free bread was the best thing they served my friend and I but it was really nothing that special. The eggs, hash browns and pancakes were very blah and average taste wise. I must say I was surprised by the lackluster flavor and experience after reading the plethora of complimentary reviews. It's definitely a head scratcher.

What do three Yelpers do after a double hike at Mount Charleston?  We look for a place to refill our depleted nutritional content.  We first went to a restaurant that had a 35 minute wait.  We opted not to wait and started Yelping on our smart phones to find somewhere else.  On the way to a 2nd suggested place, Warren P. found Jamms and since it was nearby, I piloted the car to Jamms.  What a nice stop for idea #3.

The three of us started out with a free pot of bread, just for mentioning Yelp.  They have plain, cinnamon, and the flavor of the day was green chili and cheese which is what I got.  It comes with a cup of softened butter and was tasty.

I had the S'mores pancake.  That's pancake batter with marshmallow and chocolate chips in the batter.  It's topped with some extra chocolate chips--for good measure-- that soften from the hot pancake.  There is also a drizzle of caramel sauce on the pancake.  I got the single pancale and it was a perfect ending to a great hike.

Service was excellent.  I'll be back here for sure!

So, if you have visiting European tourists and want to introduce them to an authentic, tasty, FILLING American breakfast, THIS IS THE PLACE. They're big enough to share. So, if you order the ham and eggs and your friend orders a shortstack it would be plenty. That's not what we did however. We had the corned beef hash and eggs, ham and eggs and a shortstack. The hash was as people claim one of the best restaurant hashes...not as good as my own, though. :P The ONLY thing that was pretty terrible was the coffee....or dishwater.

The sweet, creamy goo is the perfect compliment to any warm muffin, but smear it on a fresh pot of Jamm's bread and OMG! It's like a party in your mouth. This fresh little pot of bread is like nothing I've experienced anywhere other than Jamm's. The cream cheese icing is the best. The goodness doesn't stop with the bread and icing, though. We were greeted with a plate of fresh fruit while we browsed the menu and sipped our fresh coffee. This time I opted for the signature omlette and it was awesome. Sliced steak and béarnaise sauce with crispy hash browns and another little loaf of heaven. The service was great, as always. We had a couple of first timers with us and they were both impressed with the service and quality. One of them ordered a bowl of grits, which looked like a meal unto itself. Pretty thick and tasty as well. Ask for a cup of coffee to go and continue to enjoy Jamm's on the way home or back to the office.

I have been to jamms quite a few times and this time particularly rubbed me the wrong way. The food was great and amazing I give the chef a 8/10. It was well prepared and delicious. Why I am giving this visit a 3 star is because the customer service provided today. The associates were very  and seemed irritable because it took longer than usual to go through the menu of great options. I witnessed my server speaking to other associates about our table and kept getting eyes from the associates she would speak to about the table. My server asked the drink provider to give us more water and he displayed an action of not wanting to do it. I get that it is a job but the people eating should not feel in easy or insecure while waiting for their food. In addition all of the staring eyes as we were sitting here did not make jamms to feel like the homey vibe I am used to. Customer service is my number one priority. I can eat anywhere it is the workers that make this experience and it was not a great customer service experience. I felt singled out and the center of their work gossip. We did speak with the manager about it and she made it more comfortable. So I thank the manager for doing a great job. I will highly recommend this place it has amazing food! I will go again maybe at a different time to have a different set of workers.

I've eaten here many time, but have only tried 1 menu item. I get the 
N.J. Sloppy Joe every time I go. It has three layers of rye bread filled with roast beef, turkey, corned beef, coleslaw and 1000 island dressing. Awesome!

This pace is the bomb for breakfast. We eat here every time we come to Vegas. The homemade corned beef hash is so freaking good I could eat a couple pounds of it. Omelets are huge and the pot of bread is also very good. Wait staff is superb, watch for Shirley - she's a hoot.
My mom had bacon and eggs and I ate  the French toast it was a great dining experience

Great service, really good food. Can't decide which omelet you want? Get a couple different ones on the small plate menu for a reduced price. Ingenious and delicious. You have to experience the "pot of bread".

The absolute best place in town for a hardy breakfeat! You have to try to pot of bread when visiting. The TEC sandwhich and waffle chicken blt is also a favorite. The service is always fantastic :) if you come on a weekend do expect a wait, however rest assured that it is worth it!

I'm a big fan of the breakfast place. I'm especially fond of off-the-beaten-track, magnet for the odd-bird-local breakfast place. This place fits the bill. Not long ago, I was yearnin' for somethin' different than my regular rotation and decided to check out this place. There was a steady stream of people heading in at 9am, which is a smidge earlier than a typical rush - a good sign.
The decor is... well.... Bridges of Madison County meets sponge paint meets truck stop.  Once you get over the momentary shock of that, you know you're at a place that feels like home.
The menu has a lengthy omelette menu which includes the likes of a White Castle omelette. Being from Chicago, I was filled with warm fuzzies.  I settled on the house special omelette, which was steak, onions, sauteed mushrooms and provolone cheese.  The omelettes are done just like I happen to like them, with thin egg wrapped around sauteed yummies in the middle.  The bread in a pot was a nifty surprise as well.  Home baked white bread in a little white ramikin served with softened butter.  
All in all, it was a hit. Go to Jamm's and find yourself in breakfast heaven.
Tasty breakfasts, really good coffee, and a surprise treat that you have to try...pot bread! The staff is very helpful and fun too.
Jamm's is the absolute best restaurant in the world to enjoy the very best service and the greatest chefs ever!! You come as strangers and leave as family!

I finally experienced the big build up of Jamm's, but Ronnie wasn't there!! I ordered the White Castle Burrito, against my cardiologists advice, of which I could only eat half of it, while my sister ordered a very large, very delicious Garbage(?) salad. I later had the burrito for a snack. A big menu of breakfast and lunch choices anyone would appreciate. Certainly worth the ride from The Strip, if you're visiting.

Stopped in for breakfast because of the reviews on trip advisor and wow, I was blown out the water.  Had the jamminator it was legit. My cuzzo had the French toast, man that was amazing get the French toast!
Great times will be back.
I ordered the chicken waffle Blt - delicious. Great food, great service. Will definitely be back.
Incredible food not too far from the strip. Amazing staff and just down right delicious

This was our last day in Vegas and after we checked out of hotel we decided to grab some breakfast. My wife looked online and found the top 10 breakfast places in Vegas. We were on our way to jamms. I didn't expect much but when we came it the place was packed but we were seated within 10 minutes. Great menu with great prices. I got the hungry lion breakfast. 2 eggs 2 bacon 2 sausage and ham 2 pancakes.  It was amazing. Best pancakes ever.  Also the potted bread it out of this world good.  So if you're looking for s place away from the strip for breakfast I would highly recommend Jamms

I just don't have anything to rave about or to recommend. The food was below average, it is just a locals regular breakfast spot. The advertised pot of bread was under-cooked and tasteless. The veggie omelette was watery. The coffee was bitter and watered down. Not what I had in mind after reading the reviews.

The waitress was very sweet but her service did not continue to the front of the restaurant. The cashier was not polite. She refused to give me a receipt that showed paid for my cash transaction. I do not think this is standard practice of restaurant sales. Why would she not be able to give me a receipt showing paid in cash? Is there a reason why this specific restaurant cannot provide a customer with a paid receipt? I was not content with their overall experience.

For the price and the reviews ... I expected more.

Will not return nor recommend.

My husband and I came here because of seeing the Man finds food episode in vegas. The Jamminator sounded too good to be true!!: French toast fried brioche bun, pastrami, sauerkraut, cheese, omelette patty! The result was something that I don't think was made with any love. The meat was skimpy and so was the sauerkraut. I was very underwhelmed.

Everyone is raving about the pot of bread, which I got for free for checkin in, it was good but not amazing. Should've been served warm, ours was cold.

Our service was good, the waitress was fast and attentive. 

I don't see myself coming back but it was worth a try!

I love this place!!! I first got to know about this little piece of breakfast heaven from my co-worker. We had breakfast here before heading to the desert to go off-roading.

So let's start with the location.. It's located on Rainbow and Charleston. It's way off the Strip. But it sure is a local favorite. Finding a parking spot close enough is not always easy but it can only mean one thing.. Jamms is packed! They do get really busy and you might have to wait a few minutes to be seated but I'm telling you it is worth your while.

About the service. Nothing but the most jolly and caring people. It's like coming to breakfast at grandma's or your aunt. The servers always have a big smile on their faces and you are always greeted warmly. Nothing can beat that to start your day!

Then there's the food.. Big generous servings. Since I checked-in on Yelp on our 3rd. visit (this morning) we got a FREE pot of bread.. You can choose either plain, cinnamon & raisin, or the special. I chose the special which for today was Peanut Butter & Spice. It was served with what I believe is a cream cheese butter spread. Oh, it's to die for!!!

We also got half a serving of their biscuits & gravy and OMG! It was delicious. I ordered Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs cooked over-medium (that's how I always have my eggs).  It came with hash browns and another pot of bread. This time I asked for it to be plain. And of course it did not disappoint. I finished my whole plate!!! I was so full.

My fiancé ordered a Panini Bread with a side of Steak Fries and he said on his first bite, "Oh my God! This is a great Panini!" And he doesn't always pay much compliments about sandwiches.. Only the well deserving ones.

All in all, our dining experience at Jamms is great as always! We shall come back again sometime soon.. I strongly recommend them for people looking for a good straight-forward and unpretentious breakfast/brunch for cheap with awesome service.
Here is the place great breakfast joint any day, great service, great people, great place that closer to my house.
good place to eat breakfast. love the ot bread- freshly baked. portions are huge and tastes delicious.

I love this place for breakfast! Nothing fancy. Just a good neighborhood joint that never lets you down. Super friendly staff, great service, excellent food. They only do breakfast and lunch. Haven't tried lunch here yet, but it's sure to happen.

With its homey atmosphere and tasty selection of breakfast favorites, Jamms Restaurant comes out to a respectable 4 star rating.

Service: 5/5
Our servers were polite and helpful when it came to selecting drinks and foods from the menu.  The food came out very quickly even though the restaurant was at full capacity, and the coffee was also given to us nice and hot.  We received a free pot of bread for checking in on Yelp!

Food: 4/5
Our main dishes were on our table less than 10 mins after we ordered it.  Somewhere before it came, we received our pots of bread.  I've had better, but it wasn't too bad.  It was just tad heavier and drier than what I personally prefer.  The food was decent.  I'd say its a tier above a typical Denny's or IHOP for sure.

Location: 4/5
The atmosphere of the place has an early 80's late 70's breakfast diner sort of feel to it.  Very warm with some character.  It pairs nicely with their breakfast selection, and I could see this place being a regular breakfast joint for people to go to and start their mornings in.

Overall: 4/5

Excellent food, I really loved the corned beef hash. Very well spiced and cooked crispy on the griddle just before serving.  The waitress was friendly and had a folksy attitude which seemed appropriate. 

Coffee was a bit weak, but better than you would expect for a diner.

Disappointing change in attitude by management. We've been coming to Jamms for years. They have always been accommodating to my celiac spouse. Today he ordered his usual skillet and mentioned that he was gluten intolerant. The server screwed up her face and told us that none of them including the chefs had been trained to handle allergens. She acted like she wanted us to leave. What the heck???

There are three possible explanations for this change. 
1. The server isn't willing or able to deal with allergies.
2. Management has had a change of heart and is no longer willing to deal with dietary restrictions.
3. The chefs really haven't been trained to handle allergies.

All of these options are disturbing.
Signature omelet and Sandy omelet.  Comparable to Black Bear Diner.

Pot thingies...yummy and free if u mention yelp...but I have to say as someone that is not really a breakfast person the egg salad club is the best egg salad other than mine I have EVER had....I mean insanely good...and the Irish scramble...omg...the corned beef soooo soft.  The hostess barks at you but eh...it's Vegas right?  Lol.  YUM!

Jamm's is the absolute best breakfast restaurant in all of Las Vegas. The staff is wonderful, impeccable service. The food is always perfect and I have tried all sorts of items on the menu. I highly recommend the Hungry Lion and the pot of bread  is amazing. They also have great lunches. If you are in the area of Rainbow and Charleston look no further.... go eat at Jamm;s.

4.5 stars.  The extra .5 is just for our waitress, Shirley, who is awesome with her contagious laugh! (If they served freshly squeezed OJ, then this would be 5 star status). 

I am so excited that we finally found a local breakfast/ brunch location that we can be proud to call our breakfast home.  We must have come at the right time for Sunday brunch because we were seated with no problem.  But, after a few minutes- the waiting area was filled to the brim with hungry patrons.  

I ordered the Eggs Florentine and after a number of misses with the hollandaise sauce at other breakfast joints- I finally found one that was perfect.  Of course, I mentioned yelp- and even got a free pot of freshly baked bread- and I selected the flavor of the day: apricot.  Yummo! My husband ordered his usual- chicken fried steak with a side of country potatoes and devoured it.  My cousin ordered an omelet and another ordered a sandwich with steak fries which were so delicious.  We also shared a plate of peach french toast and not a crumb was left.  Yes- we were quite the hungry bunch. 

Awesome service, awesome food and I love the fact that it is family owned.  We even left with some "Jamms coffee mugs" because we are such fans.  As their motto says, we did "enter as strangers, left as friends".  See you soon, new friend!
Nice place to grab breakfast.  Of couse got the pot of bread at it was good.  Eggs Benedict hit the spot. Will try this place again when I'm in the LV
The breakfast was excellent!!! Their omelet was so full of bacon, it was great!! Came here to try the pot of bread & it didn't disappoint!!!! Great place, amazing service! Very friendly!!!

We went to Jamm's for a late morning breakfast. Never having been there before, and new to the state, we didn't know what to expect. We were greeted by a very pleasant lady and seated at a booth. Immediately we were served our coffee. A very nice waitress came to take our order as soon as we got the coffee. After she answered some questions she put our order in. They have seasoned home fries, and sweet potato fries.i had the sweet potato fries. They sprinkle them with powdered sugar, they were yummy. They serve them in a little fryer basket. They also have the original bread bowl. It's bread made in a little muffin cup, the bowl. They have white, wheat, and cinnamon raisin. I loved the cinnamon raisin. They didn't keep my coffee cup full, but did give me a second cup before I left. Over all, the food was great,very original presentation, very pleasant ambiance, service was good with hardly any wait. It's a place you want to return to. Oh, they serve breakfast any time of day. Price for 2 breakfasts for us was $22.00, but you could spend more if you want. Great place to take friends.  I will be a regular.  Dan

This place was worth the wait! Super good service and really good breakfast! We had the Irish skillet, French toast, country fried steak and biscuits and gravy! Their bread is super soft and fluffy! Melts in your mouth! Would definitely come back!

Rudest hostesses...ever. Waitress was great, but the food was pretty standard diner fare. We tried one of the pot o' bread, two different benedict dishes and the kiddos split the french toast. Overall disappointing and not at all worth the wait.

The fact that Jamms is so close to my house is really just the cherry on top of the cake that is this lovely breakfast joint in Las Vegas. 

We tend to visit here at least twice a month, usually on Sunday mornings (which is kind of a mistake because that's when after church crowd tends to swarm it) so there's always a wait, but believe me it is worth it. 

The omelettes are nice, big and fluffy and the home fries are just right. The orange juice is delicious (I'm not sure if they claim its fresh-squeezed, but I have my doubts). The coffee isn't spectacular, but definitely passable. 

One of the things that set Jamms apart: a rotating variety of "pots o' bread" (Management: If you're reading this, PLEASE make the cheddar jalapeño pot o' bread a permanent menu item!) - ranging from season flavors to standard fare. 

But what I love more than anything is the service. From the hostesses, to the bus people, waitresses and waiters, everyone is friendly and treats you like family. There are seriously staff members who are genuinely happy to see you week after week. 

That's what keeps this place going strong; nothing fancy or fussy, good food and great service.

We found Jamms on a fluke and absolutely love this little restaurant... It has a family feel to it and while not fancy- the food is amazing! I recommend the signature omelet- unlike many breakfast food chains, it delivers on not only the steak, but the mushrooms as well! I've also tried other items on the menu and they never fail to impress!

*military discount in uniform only*
*free pot o' bread with yelp check-in* 
Went on Saturday 11-28-15 at 10am and there was a bit of a wait.  This restaurant is located on Rainbow in the same shopping center as Home Depot and Strip N' Dip Chicken Strips. 
$28.77 got us a pancake combo, a white castle omelet, and grits. 
The white castle omelet has ground beef, cheese, and onions inside and comes with home fries, which are sliced potatoes cooked with onions and peppers.  I thought it tasted a lot like a white castle. 
The pancake combo comes with your choice of sausage or bacon and then eggs cooked however you like them.  The pancakes were ridiculously fluffy-they had to have been an inch thick!  They were so tasty and the eggs and sausage were perfect.  They brought out two containers of butter without me asking, which I really appreciated.  There's nothing worse than getting big pancakes and they hand you one packet of butter.  
The grits were cooked well but lacked salt.  I liked that they brought butter with the grits without asking. Paula Deen would be proud of my obsession with butter today.

Loved this place for breakfast and definitely want to go back and try their lunch. I went with a healthier option omelette but had a few bites of their pancakes and fresh baked bread and they were such a treat. Loved that they gave us a discount for checking In.
Absolutely BEST! Biscuits & gravy in town!! Highly recommend for breakfast, brunch or lunch.
I love the food here however if you don't come with your entire party they would not seat you, they make you wait even if you are dying to have a cup of coffee.

I've been coming to this place for years they have an amazing breakfast with a price that is very reasonable I recommend this place to anybody that wants to sit down and have a good time with their family

The Little Foodie and me were finally up early enough to eat Breakfast!  

When we arrived, I figured I would go with the tried and true breakfast classics, but I was told about the brand new Chicken & Waffles!  Seriously, the day I went I was told they were added to the menu...so how could I pass that up??

Well I should have done that...passed them up.

Chicken and Waffles ($10). This was very disappointing! The waffle was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. There were only two pieces of what seemed like frozen chicken fingers, overcooked and bland. Pass! 

Yes, I know they aren't a Soul Food kind of place, so my expectations weren't too high, but looking at all the other positive reviews, as well as all the personal recommendations (the reason I was there in the first place), I was underwhelmed.

I'm sure I will be back to try the traditional breakfast items, and I foresee a much more positive visit than the last.

First time here, and totally coming back! Thank you to my Yelp flock for never leading me astray! I read your reviews, I heard you loud and clear! 

We came here 10 am on a Sunday morning. The wait turned out to not be bad since a lot of people in line before us had given up. Sad for them, awesome for us!

We were promptly seated, brought menus and coffee, and greeted by our enthusiastic server, Sandy (Hi, Sandy!). I told her I was checking in on Yelp and she was thrilled to tell me that I got a free pot of bread. 

We ordered:
- White Castle omelette
- $5 small plate egg white/no cheese omelette
- Pot of bread - flavor of the week was strawberries and cream

HOLY POT OF BREAD! These are amazing. It's like angels from heaven came down and manifested themselves into a gooey, fluffy, warm pocket of bread. 

$5 egg white omelette was the perfect size! I try to eat a healthy breakfast, but when portions are gigantic, it's impossible. The veggies inside were nicely cooked. It is a great small bite to order.

THEY HAVE SUPER HUMAN BUST BOYS! Twice we watched bust boys catch dropped plates in mid-air. It was really quite impressive. 

I had such a great dining experience here, and will be back!!!!
Food is consistent, hot, tasty, and filling. Be sure to have the pumpkin pancakes.....a classic

This place is a fantastic breakfast joint. My boyfriend and I usually share the chicken fried steak. It's quite a large portion, and we get the ordered split in the back so you get your money's worth because you get 4 eggs and plenty of homefries. Shirley is a great waitress. She remembers our order and treats us like family. One of the biggest perks of this place is the pots of bread. They have a regular one and then a special one daily.  The blueberry lemon and cinnamon are my favorites.

FYI: stay clear of the biscuits. The gravy is to die for but the biscuits taste like frozen hockey pucks. Lol I asked a waiter if they were homemade and she confirmed they were not.

Well this used to be our every sunday breakfast  spot.  We stopped coming for awhile due to the quality of food we felt was slipping. Today we wanted to give it another try. Service was a little slow and the food came out cold. Staff is always friendly

This place is my favorite restaurant for breakfast! I love this place. My wife and I have been coming here for about 8 years. The menu has a lot of choices and everything is made fresh every day. Yummmmmm

This was my first time dining at Jamms and I was very impressed! My party and I came on a Saturday morning. The wait time was about 20 minutes, which we expected for a weekend. We were seated in less than 20 minutes. 

The menu is huge! There was a ton of options and you can try many different items, which made it easier to decide. The 1st server came to our table and took our drink order. The drinks were brought back promptly. The 2nd server took a while to take our order. I could see that the server was busy, but an acknowledgement from the server would have been appropriate. The server took around order after about 10-15 minutes.

We ordered our meals and the famous pot of bread. That was absolutely delicious! It was fresh, warm, and tasteful. Our food arrived a little erratically. Myself and 3 others received our food while the 4th person had to wait another 5 minutes for his meal. We dug right in when we got our food, but felt bad that the other person had to wait.

The servers were very attentive with drink refills and pre-bussing our table. We received our check quickly and got cashed out fast.

Overall, I will definitely dine here again. The 1 star deduction is for the small wait time for our order to be taken and the wait time for our friend's food.

This was my second time at Jamms and both were excellent.  Pleasant service and great food.  Highly recommend the Jamms French toast and don't leave without a pot of bread.  I prefer the raisin and cinnamon one.  I just wish it opened just a bit earlier since I'm always there for work and have to start too early to go all the time.

Awful awful awful service and food!
What a waste!!!!!!! We will never return to this place that we fell in love with not too long ago. This is my 5th visit here and it was so awful that I do NOT want to ever return! First off we saw our food sitting in the window for a long time and of course it was COLD! My friend didn't even eat her entree and when the awful waitress picked up a full plate of food she didn't even ask if there was anything wrong! We ended up paying that entire bill and because my friends are waitresses they believe in karma and still left that lazy no good waitress a $5 tip! 
Our Irish skillet was so awful I only ate a few bites. The pot o bread was doughy and not fully baked! Even the hot water to the hot tea was warm! Really?!?!?! 
AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!! 
Never again!!!!!!

I'm not a big fan of breakfast but Jamms turns me into a maniac. The service, the old school feel and best of all the  yummy food. One of my favorite places to eat and my only breakfast joint. Highly recommend!!

I'm going to say one thing to you yelpers pot of Bread.  yes you read it right pot of bread. They always have cinnamon raisin and they have a daily special when I went it was chocolate caramel now I have to tell you that was a little over-the-top for me you could only taste the chocolate not even the caramel but the cinnamon raisin... amazing and the pot of bread is just what it sounds like.  don't be fooled by the butter on the side no no no no it's not just  butter it's actually cream cheese icing. That's right cream cheese icing on the side of your pot of bread. I don't think I need to say anything else. I do remember ordering other things but I don't remember them not like I remember the pot of bread

I live in the Dallas area but have family in Las Vegas so I'm here several times a year. No visit is complete without a visit to Jamms! Everything I've ever ordered is fantastic and the service is fast and friendly. What more could you ask for?

Very solid diner spot at the corner of Rainbow and Charleston. We tried their notorious pot of bread a few choice omelettes, and their waffle. Portion size was quite good. Many of the diners here in Vegas either give you a small omelette/skimp on the ingredients or give you an enormous omelette which no normal person can stomach. Jamms gives you a good portion size with quality ingredients for a great price. They also offer tapas plates which is an awesome idea for a brunch to try many breakfast dishes as this meal is by far the hardest to decide in the morning. I very much enjoyed my meal here from the waitstaff to the meal to the 10% yelp check in coupon to the fact that my meal came in at $20 for a solid morning starter. One of the best of its kind in local Las Vegas.
Great food and service! If you can't make up your mind, try the "Red Plate" selections. A little of a lot of different flavors. I have come here for years and never have had a disappointing meal!

I was in there Sunday who is sandy?
She was yelling and being so mean to the employees good God who runs this place?
Who ever you are you need to check on her if I worked there no way in hell would I be talked to in such a matter.
I am a person who has been in a few times but never again she was so rude and mean I couldn't  hear that again 
You have such good people why are you allowing her to be so mean

Good breakfast. Sometimes a long wait and it's not soooo good that I would wait in that line again. But the pancakes were fluffy and the eggs were done the way I like. The waitress was attentive and pleasant. The price was fair.

A good friend who lives around the area recommended this place and I'm glad we did come to this place. The food was really good and tasty and filled us up with the right amount of food. The service was good and fast. I would definitely come to this place for a quick bite when I visit. It gets pretty busy as well but we didn't wait too long.

My family and I have eaten there several times now and have never had a bad meal.  Make sure you go when you're hungry because the portions will fill you up for sure.  Be prepared to wait in line on the weekends, especially Sunday.  The line does move pretty quickly though and it is worth the wait.  It is pretty small inside so it does get a bit noisy, not a huge deal for us.  The staff is always warm and friendly and makes you feel welcome.

Don't be afraid of the wait.  This place turns tables fast.  

Hash and eggs are homemade.  Don't forget the freshly made pot of bread.  Always great food.

Jamms has won the RJ readers poll for the best breakfast in Vegas basically every year since the beginning of time, but then again, the RJ readers voted Taco Bell as the best Mexican food in town last year, so screw those people.  The Fat Man knows what he's talking about when it comes to food.

You want the skinny on this place from the Fat Man?  I live off of Boulder Hwy in Henderson.  This place is at Rainbow and Charleston.  (About 35 minutes from my house.)  I don't do mornings, and I'm not generally a breakfast eater...But at least once a month, my wife and I get up early and trek across town just to eat at Jamms.  

Over the years I've had a few things on their lunch menu, and I'll be honest...I'm not a fan.  But their breakfast....oh baby, their breakfast.  Their omelets are light and fluffy and PACKED with toppings.  They have about 30 omelets to choose from, so you have plenty of options (The White Castle is by far my favorite.)  Their corn flake french toast is AMAZING.  I have often wished for their signature pina colada french toast as a dessert after dinner at night.  (When I start thinking about that is usually when we go to Jamms the next morning)       

Their fresh baked pot-o-bread is some of the best bread I've ever had.  It's like a poofy dinner roll baked like a muffin, only airier and fluffier and full of wonderousness. (And yes, that's a word.  I just made it up.) I usually get the original, but they also offer cinnamon raisin and the "flavor of the day".

Ladies and Gents, as I said before, I don't do mornings.  As I often say, "they call it mourning for a reason".  Anything that can make me EXCITED about getting up early is something special.  Jamms is one of those rare things. 

The only thing better than the food at Jamms is the atmosphere.  The staff is friendly, helpful, and courteous.  They are always smiling and chatting with the customers.  They are excellent about refilling drinks and making sure you are enjoying your meal, but they also find that perfect line between being helpful and not hovering.  Ronnie (the owner) has great taste in employees, and has almost no turnover.  Almost all of the wait staff has been there since I started going there nearly 10 years ago.  

My only caution about this place is to be careful.  Once you have eaten here a few times, it can become an addiction.  I'm pretty sure they put crack in their food to make you crave it more.  :)

I eat here mainly out of convenience. The pot of bread is very good. They do offer a wide range of menu items. I can't say anything bad but I can't say a whole lot of good. I'm a flavor person and the food is kinda bland. I don't believe they make their soups from scratch and they tend to be over salty. Good in a quick JAM but not to go out of the way.

Jamms is definitely one of my favorite breakfast places.  I love the menu's variety.  There's always something that catches my attention, even when I'm not really hungry.  My go to item is the "Denver potato pancakes".  They're less like pancakes, and more like shredded hash browns mixed with diced ham, and vegetables, but they are absolutely amazing.  The portions here are huge, too.  You can get two meals out of most of the entrées here.
I'm not in love with the country kitsch grandma's kitchen decor, but considering the fact that a lot of their customers ARE grandmas, I can't complain too much.  Especially when the food is that good.

Went there for a late breakfast with the family.  Place was "Jamming", but only had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated.  Service was friendly as always.  I had the Jamms Special, with a cinnamon raison pot of bread and it was devine.  The pot of bread was mouthwatering and the omelet was huge.  They have some the best house coffee in town.  Will be going back again.

Pretty good for breakfast! The pot o breads is what I mostly came for and they are pretty darn good! Service is very good and they also have healthy options .. They have a pumpkin marshmallow pot o bread sometimes as well!!

I was not impressed with this place at all today. First we get there around 12:30 and they say 15 minute wait. No problem. We wander over to the vape shop next door. I go back about ten mins later and our table is ready, but they won't seat me as my whole party is not there. Whole party??? It's just me and my boyfriend. I tell them he's right next door and will be back in a minute but they still refuse to seat me. I guess that is just their policy, but it put a bad taste in my mouth and everything got worse from there. 

Our server while nice, messed up our order. I wanted to try the weekly pot O bread, which was strawberry almond, but she brought me out cinnamon raisin. Womp womp. I ended up just eating it, because I don't like to complain. It was pretty good though. Boyfriend ordered a Philly with no mushrooms, and it came out with shrooms. She admitted that was her mistake and offered to correct his sandwich, but he decided to order something else instead. He chose a chili burger. This was the smallest burger ever and you could tell the chili came from a can. I ordered the eggs benedict with home fries. I got about 2oz of home fries, which are potatoes with bell pepper and onions. They were good, but I had two bites and they were gone. The hollandaise on my eggs did not have much flavor, so the whole dish suffered. 

I paid just about $30 including tax and tip which is wayyyyy too much for just an ok meal. I probably won't be back.

Great food, awesome service. Perfect place for breakfast. No reservations and nowhere to really sit inside. And everybody must know it's good because we waited outside for 30min for a table. But it was worth it.
Always great get try something new every time .Today it Calif eggs Benedict with turkey and avocado..  pot of cheddar cheese and jalapeño bread so good
Great service! Great food! Had the pot of bread, sweet potato fries, and an amazing omelet!!! Recommend for brunch!!! Worth it

So far the best breakfast we've had in Vegas! So many omelettes to choose from! I had the sandy omelette (bacon & avocado) with the cinnamon raisin pot of bread.  Crispy bacon, perfect amount of avocado. A healthy portion, I was Almost able to finish it.  My company had the spinach florentine, beautifully poached eggs.  And their coffee cups are BIG.  Made me wonder why all restaurants don't use big cups?
Staff here moves fast, tables turn quick and food flies out of the kitchen.  I never had to ask for a refill someone was constantly filling our coffees and waters. Glad we got here early a line started quickly but I can't imagine anyone waited more than 10 minutes. 
I was so satisfied with my meal but when I saw a waitress carrying some French toast covered in glazed apples I almost wanted to sit down and eat again!  And then I heard there was a chocolate caramel pot of bread.. So much more I want to try! We will definitely be back again during our stay here. Also, There was a 10% discount for posting on social media! Great place.

I have been to this hole in the wall several times now and I am always pleased and satisfied with what I choose. First let me mention there are a ton of options so it may take you awhile to choose. Also the portions are large-size so come with an appetite or be prepared to take leftovers. I was please to find they added tapas portions, smaller plate styles at half the cost.
     This particular time I got the Rueben omelette (corned beef,sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese.) The tender corned beef really went well with the tangy sweetness of the sauerkraut. Also I got the pot of bread (cinnamon and raisin with side of cream cheese icing) yummy! They did come out with a pistachio pot of bread I'm dieing to try. When you check in on yelp they give you a free pot of bread but they said they were out of pistachio which is odd because they offered it to the table next to us so I don't know. Nonetheless my meal was great.
    Now my boyfriend ordered the steak and eggs. I warned him about ordering steak at a place that doesn't really specialize in that bc you can't expect much from a small breakfast joint but he took the risk lol. Of course I was right the steak looked like a chewed up oversized piece of bacon. He said it was tough, chewey, and tasted kind of like an old belt. However the scrambled eggs were plain and to be expected. The pancakes were really good and fluffy.
    Overall everything was great on my behalf and you cant beat the cost we spent under $30. Word of advice stick with breakfast it's what they are known for and don't order the steak.....obviously.

I love this place!! The servers are always on the fly and they've never messed up my order. The sandwich selection is phenomenal, anything you want, they'll get it made.  The food is so awesome, I end up there at least once a week, if not for any other reason than to try the weekly pot of bread.
Good reliable breakfast joint.

This is my favorite place to eat breakfast! I always order the same thing. Just can't seem to try anything else on the menu because I love Joe's omelet with ham so much! The pot of bread is always delish and a surprise flavor is offered each day in addition to the regular one. Come check this place out!

I always enjoy having a great breakfast with the whole family when it's possible. Though I wish it was an every day thing, but that's not the case. So in those times where we can a few times a month we enjoy trying different spots, but since the first week tried this place over a year ago we knew we'd be back again and again. 

    With all the different choices and every which delicious and we'll priced I was already satisfied. The service is just as good really making you feel at home I recommend this to anyone looking for a great breakfast experience.

The first time it was here it was awesome. I had Jamms French toast and shared a side of chicken fried steak. It was good, the service was friendly and fast.
The second time I went here, there was an estimated wait of 20 minutes. If you're going here for breakfast, make sure you have at least two hours. The staff was friendly, and we were seated in 20 minutes. After we were seated, however, it took probably another 20 minutes for us to have our order taken. This time I got one of their specialty French toasts-- a word of advice, don't bother with the specialty French toasts. Just go with Jamms French Toast. I made the mistake of coming here with only an hour and a half before I had to go to work, and I got my food about two minutes before I had to leave. Immediately I asked for a to go box and left. The food was still good, friendly staff but it took too long. Don't come here during the breakfast rush. It will take an hour and a half to get your food.
The pot of bread is delicious, so is the chicken fried steak and Jamms French Toast. It's fried in corn flakes. Classic soul food.

Went in on a Saturday around noon. We were seated immediately. Waitress was great. Food was great. Very casual atmosphere. Not for the snooty. Overall a great place to bring the family to breakfast. Will definately be back!!
Their great bottom line! I left one star off cause it needs its own parking lot. But the service is wonderful. Our waiter was super cool, she had us laughing the hole time. And the food is bomb.

Loved the little Pot of Bread!  We tried the Cinnamon Raison and the Plain.  Both were delicious!!  Husband had the Hash, ordered an extra egg and I have him two of mine, then it was perfect (he likes lots of egg cut up in it)  I had the Chicken Fried Steak and it was very tender, not enough gravy and the gravy needed flavor.  Will most likely go back, there are a few other menu items we want to try!

Excellent service EVERY time!
Margie, Sandy, Stacy, and José really go the extra mile for us
Food is consistently delicious and we never have to wait long no matter how busy they get.
What else can we want for? Highly recommended!
Great customer service and you also get 10% off when you check in on social media. Great food.

James is the best breakfast place in Vegas!  Their pots of bread are amazing and every single time we come here the food and service are spot on!!! If you feel like lunch their burgers and sandwiches are always great!
Solid experience, a mom and pop style breakfast place. Not the best breakfast I've ever had but also not the worst, everything was good, friendly staff as well.

Was going to try another place but it was not quite open so sad this on Yelp and so glad I stopped it. The Pot of Bread special was a yummy Peach, I devoured it. Also had the Corned Beef Eggs Benedict which was so tasty,  I had to take 1/3 of this dish home since I was so full (rich delicious coffee too) and it was even better the next day.  Very friendly and attentive servers also

Had a great lunch at Jamms and the rest of the family all enjoyed their meals. The menu is diverse for both lunch and breakfast..so plenty of options depending on your taste for the day. I had the Arthur sandwich and ate every last bite (highly suggest). My only knock on the place is slow service and booth space is quite uncomfortable.

Another great breakfast find in the Vegas area!

Well, it wasn't necessarily a 'find' considering we attempted to roll through during a prior LV trip and the line was out the door. This time, we walked right in and found a seat without a problem.  

To share, we ordered French toast sticks and our Yelp check-in came with a free order of 'pot' bread. Who knew Vegas could consistently dish out amazing pieces of breaded sweetness!? The French toast sticks were a crisp golden brown, doused with cinnamon & powdered sugar, buttered and came with a side of good ol' fashioned syrup. The pot bread was truly a surprising delight. Scratch that, the NUTELLA PEANUT BUTTER it came with was truly the surprising delight. Sooo rich, so sugary.. *Sweats profusely* I actually don't like sugar rushes. I triggered one here and don't plan on having another one anytime soon.

I grabbed the chicken fried steak in country gravy with eggs over easy and home fries. I feel like I say this every time I eat this meal at a new location, but easily one of the best chicken fried steaks I've had in awhile. HUGE portion size that could easily feed two; Breaded with seasons that tickle the senses, a milky / creamy chicken gravy, moist insides and packed with a crunch. The gravy wasn't slopped all over the plate either. Right down the center of the steak with the ends just sticking out - you know it's the real deal when you subtract the gravy and have the steak bare.. if it's good without the gravy, then you have yourself a winner. In this case it was a complete winner.. The home fries were up to par too - with caramelized onions, bell peppers, crisp edges and just enough salt.  But really, I can't believe I wasted stomach space on the sweet stuff. I was relatively upset when I realized I was already full just about halfway through.. So, I unbuckled my pants and let the button go. We were finishing this off no matter what. Every bite was savored, and not forgotten. 

Our service was great, from hostess, to waitress, to the busser who rolled through and took plates not being used as well as various staff members giving the complimentary coffee / water refill here and there. Nothing weird happened, everyone was smiling, the prices were low and my stomach was appreciative.

I would always see a line out the door for this place, so decided that it must be good! I had asked my friends about it and they warned me about how dirty it was. I figured that it couldn't be THAT bad, so I thought I'd give it a try. Such a bad idea!!! I ordered French toast, pretty hard to mess up. I couldn't even finish it. Our waitress ignored us completely and kept taking forever at her other tables, talking and laughing with them. 
Later that night I was so incredibly sick and throwing up. I will never go again.

So I honestly never write reviews about anything unless they piss me off but I had to write one about this little place! The food was delicious! We got greeted right away with sincere kindness and our waitress (and waiter) yes we had two were both on top of everything. Had to wait a little while to be seated but it was worth it! The food however was served very quickly and efficiently! Definitely will be back next time we are in Vegas! Thank you for the great food!

If you are contemplating eating here, just do it! You won't be disappointed! The pot of bread is so flavorful and their omelettes are stuffed to the brim with deliciousness!  Service is outstanding and the atmosphere really feels like home. I highly recommend!

Food was great. Server was ok...she was friendly, but it took her awhile to come to our table. I waited tables for years and even though it's busy, "I'll be right with you" is always appreciated. However, the bus boy was on top of everything, including keeping our coffees filled. He deserves recognition for his hard work!
Good basic breakfast joint.  I ordered "tapas" style breakfast.   I had a classic egg Benedict and the Babalama omlette.  Great concept

Items ordered:

Coffee
Nutella Almond Pot of Bread
Red Velvet Pancake
S'mores Pancake
McBeth - French Toast, Ham, Turkey, Swiss
Grits

Another long-term fixture of the local food scene, and one I'd unknowingly been driving by twice daily every Thursday and Friday since relocating to Las Vegas, Jamms Restaurant quickly earned a spot on the 'to-visit' list when my server at Mary's Hash House mentioned the quaint local eatery as another "great place" serving up home-style breakfasts at a fair price - a 7am opening perfect for another Saturday of dining.  Nondescript from the exterior but cozy and kitsch inside as a friendly staff bounced between tables with endless refills of coffee from Illy at a mere $2.75 it was to a diverse menu and a hot, yeasty 'pot of bread' slathered with Nutella and toasted almonds that I arrived and after perusing the menu at length an order was placed, a server named Shirley warning me that it would be "a lot of food," but failing to inform me of noted upcharges of $2 for a single Red Velvet Pancake and $1.25 for grits in place of potatoes.  Jovial in spirit with tunes ranging from Sinatra to Madonna playing overhead it was perhaps a ten minute wait after the bread that the rest of my meal arrived and with each item larger than expected in size it was indeed a substantial breakfast with only the cocoa-less Red Velvet failing to impress...the flavor merely that of a decent buttermilk pancake gussied up with $2 in dye.  Speaking to the rest, suffice it to say that it would be hard to mess up something as decadent as the signature "S'Mores" with ample chocolate chips and chocolate syrup finding balance in bold buttermilk, marshmallows, plus a dollop of whipped cream and yet as good as the pancake was, the un-fried riff on the Monte Cristo easily stole the show as golden Texas Toast dipped in custard housed Ham, Turkey, and Swiss of good quality and quantity, all just waiting for a sweet gilding of maple syrup to make flavors pop.  Never one to quibble prices but a firm believer that upcharges should always be disclosed Jamms strikes me as a good-enough place in a city with plenty of similar options; a bit better than some and a bit worse than others...the sort of place I'm sure to revisit at some point for the Waffle Sundae or the Stuffed French Toast, but not before investigating other family owned spots or before second visits to Blueberry Hill, Hash House, Egg & I, or Baby Stacks.

One of the best breakfast places I've been to in Vegas. There was a long wait but it was totally worth it.  There's a reason places like this get packed. Their signature item, the Pot Bread, was just ok. We head the cinnamon raisin and it was good but nothing really special.  My husband had the meat lovers omelet and OMG meat.  I had the reuben benedict, the English muffin was nice and crispy, eggs well cooked, hollandaise was missing a bit of bite and the whole thing was a little under salted but most things are for me. The coffee cups are huge for a diner and they have great coffee.  Great service and pricing is on par with larger breakfast chains like IHOP. Overall great experience, will definitely be back.
Deliciously friendly food! Strong coffee and large amount of food! Will definitely be back THIS WEEK!

This is a comfortable homey restaurant. Everything is great. The potted bread option can be a meal in itself but you won't want to pass up one of the great omelets. The southwest hamburger is a real treat. Friendly staff does whatever you need to enjoy your meal. Prices are very reasonable.

Had the corned beef hash and eggs over medium.  Eggs were cooked perfectly and were delicious.  No complaints there.  
But the corned beef hash wasn't flavorful.  Just salted heavily but none of the delicious flavor you expect from a good corned beef.  Just tasted like salt.
Had the pot of bread...I like that it's hot and such but it wasn't very flavorful either.  Just seemed like plain white bread.  Didn't get the yeasty flavor other people liked.
Service was great and the staff super friendly.

Best Breakfast by far in Las Vegas! Been coming for years to Las Vegas and decide to trust my YELPERS. Once again, they have not failed me. I'm from San Diego and wish we could have a Jamms restaurant down here! Till next time! Highly recommend the breakfast! Service was awesome, friendly and quick!

Heard about this place from a friend. Love the service from the front door on in. Coffee in big mugs and delish. Many options and they actually offer substitutions-you don't have to ask. Best egg- white veggie omelet!
Not good at all.  I was excited about the pot of bread because of the reviews, but it was plain and dry.

Jamms is one of the first restaurants our family found when we officially moved to Vegas. OMG this place is amazing. Their pot breads are absolutely to die for, and their service is the BEST! They are busy, busy, busy but they can keep up with it; the servers are absolutely on top of it and sweet to boot. Our food has always been fresh and delicious and we have loved everything we've tried. Our two year old loves coming here too; they give her a bucket of crayons and coloring pages and she's set. Great family atmosphere! We love this place!!

A- OK.
Huge portions of good, well prepared food. I ordered a low calorie breakfast of avocado, egg, and bacon /w cottage cheese and it was good, and when I left
I was not hungry.
The wait staff is friendly and attentive. Most dishes appear to come in at around $10, you won't feel burned.
Nothing fancy or pretentious, which is exactly what they seem to want. Just good food, reasonably priced, and friendly attentive service. If you're looking for more then that, go to the Strip

It is our first visit here and I have to say that the pot of bread is sooooo good, you can pretty much have it any time of the day  we were looking for some place near us for breakfast and came across Jamms, love the setting, it's very homely and old fashioned like, love it!

In my quest to find a new breakfast spot as I was growing tired of my usual places I found Jamms Restaurant. I wish I could say that I believe Jamms Restaurant is jammin' or had some delicious  and wondrous homemade jam, however I cannot but that is alright just like how the restaurant is alright.

Mostly certainly it was a miscommunication between myself and the name of the restaurant as I thought that perhaps the restaurant would serve some awesome jam, but to my dismay only the pre-packaged Knott's jam is available.. darn.

The menu consist of your typical breakfast items, omelets, sandwiches, corn beef hash, pancakes, but you don't need something extraordinary as long as the ordinary is consistently delicious. Although during my visits I was not particularly impressed by my dishes. Reason being is that I felt that my Jamm's signature omelet which was composed of steak, bearnaise sauce, murshrooms and cheese was somewhat bland and my steak was difficult to chew. I also had a piece of my friend's Jamm's french toast which was battered and covered in corn flakes, my impressions are that I will probably stick with the normal french toast as the specialty is a little mushy for me. 

The service was jammin' though, the waitress were friendly, helpful, and refilled my water often. My dining companions went MIA after ordering but the waitress was very understanding and patient with that, always monitoring when my friends would come back to the table. However I would like to mention that the waitress had no clue what I was talking about when I mentioned the Yelp special nor did the cashier, which made things a little embarrassing for myself as I had to explain their special promo to receive my free pot of bread.. the jammin' stopped there unfortunately.

Maybe in the future when I am tired of my usual breakfast places again I will give Jamms another try or perhaps for lunch I could jam with the California Club

After reading the reviews, I had to try it.  Overall, a great little diner in amidst a strip mall.  It's quaint, with great diner service and solid good food.  They are well known for their popover bread, and you must get one when you eat there.  

Great mom and pop joint away from the strip, and well worth the drive.  I eat here at least once a week because I love their omelets.
Best breakfast ever!!  Shirley made us laugh and had great recommendations. If you're close, don't miss this little gem.

Had the Bishop Wrap with veggie burger - it was deeeeelish and Sandy is the greatest server. The boyfriend had the Smores french toast and he loved it. Definitely the place to be for breakfast or lunch!

I just licked my plate clean. I am not ashamed. 

Got to donate to three square, have endless mugs of diner coffee, and try the "Reuben BreakfastRito"... Which was from the first bite insanely delicious. I had it w the hollandaise. My god. 

Ran me 9.99 and they gave me 10% for three square donation. Shay was sweet... On it... And gone when she wasn't needed. I really recommend bringing a family member or someone you love and just relaxing like it's Sunday morning. 

12:30pm on a Thursday and got a seat right away, but it was busy. Good was fast and atomically hot. Lots of love.
Ya, this place Jamms and the food is good. Make sure you get the French press coffee, delicious.

This is the best brunch spot on Charleston. I'm very happy to have found this place and will definitely be back. The place is constantly busy. If you want breakfast on the weekend, you better get here early. This place rocks. If you have the opportunity, stop by Jamm's because it's pretty sweet

I've been going to Jamms for YEARS. It's been my favorite breakfast place since I was in high school.  A lot of the staff has been working there since I've started going there as well, which I think is amazing. I've never had a bad experience here and I've never found anything as delicious as pot of bread anywhere else.. Ever. I love Jamms so much!!

Amazing had the sandys omelette, french press coffee, and sweet potato fries. Friendly great service and delicious food...large servings at a reasonable price.
Definitely will return!

This is our second time here and the food is great so we came back for seconds. However this time a girl in a red shirt greeted our table, brought drinks and we sat for about 5 to 10min in an empty restaurant. We flagged the girl in the red shirt from across the room (signaling we would like some kind of service) she just pointed to the front of the restaurant at our server. She could have easily walked over and let her know. Such a rude way to carrying on business especially since she was just standing there.

We came in on a Tuesday morning around 11 and the place was already hoppin'. We waited for a few minutes by the counter - they have a couple benches there and it's a quick turnaround. 

Shannon (Shay) was our server, she was incredibly nice and very attentive. I ordered the corned beef hash ($6 side, $2.75 coffee) and loved both - 5 stars. I mixed the seasoned salt and mild Tabasco together (both on the tables) and had the saltiest, corned beefiest, hashiest breakfast ever. So good, and so unassuming of a menu item. The omelettes get much more play.

My bf ordered an omelette, and I thought the steak was pretty dry (losing a star), but it had a ton of cheddar on it. The hash browns are definitely made in-house and are delicious - I recommend pairing them with the hash. :-)

 Very cozy atmosphere that gets busy, but is an excellent spot for families. I also like that they give out free gum at the counter. I saw a lot of grandmas today, and they all looked pretty stoked. 

Free "Pot of Bread" with check-in. Give em' a try!

I've been coming here for 10 years now. I'm not the biggest fan of breakfast but Jamms is the place to be. They always have  great service and great food. They are small and always have a line but it goes by fast and it's worth the wait !
Everything is delicious and the service is great! Friendly neighborhood diner. The variety of pot o breads is to die for!!

I thoroughly enjoyed the great good and huge portions at this great breakfast restaurant.  The omelets are large with a lot of different varieties, as well as the pancakes and French toast.  The Jamms French toast was good, but also not as flavorful as I would have liked.  But I would come back several more times to try all of the other types of pancakes and French toast they have on the menu.

Breakfast past noon? YUP! I had it here. 
Good service, friendly staff. I had the eggs and hashbrowns. The hashbrown was nice and crunch on the outside, just the way I like it. The toast was very buttery but my bad for forgetting to ask for dry. Prices are comparable to other average breakfast places. Would go back again.

First off, they are not a chain and I LOVE that!!

You must try the blueberry pot of bread. It is amazing. It is a special, so you have to catch them on the right week. Their plain pot of bread is just as good though.They have the best ham around.They grill it perfect! The owner is always there to greet you when you walk in.The waitresses are always friendly. I have never had a bad meal here. They are known for their pot of bread, so make sure to order one when you stop in!  Also, I think it is a cute touch that they offer you gum, instead of those red and white mints everybody gives you on the way out.
Great food. (Not so much for veggies). Recommend having the tapas style to try all as the portions are massive and yummy.

We went here for breakfast. It is a Mom and Pop place. It is a ways off the strip, but the food is worth it. It has good food and the service is quick here. Got a omelet that had a lot of bacon and cheese. My husband got a scramble and it really filled him up. Everyone is very friendly and recommend great things to try. We will be back here again.

I am amazed that this place has won the Best of Las Vegas multiple times and is currently ranked as one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas...

The service just met my expectations, not bad but nothing special. 

The ambiance reminded me of an old fashioned diner. The decor was very dated and to be honest the place felt dirty to me.

My husband and I both ordered omelets, the Jamm's specialty omelet and the Ruben omelet both notated as favorite items on the menu. Maybe we just ordered the wrong meals as both left a lot to be desired. The home potatoes were inedible. It's a shame I was given such a large portion. The meals do however come with a "pot o' bread'. You can choose cinnamon raisin or white bread. These reminded me of bread my grandmother used to make at Thanksgiving, just plain ol yeasty bread. This trip down memory lane gave Jamm's the extra star. 

To be a good breakfast spot, the coffee needs to be spot on. This was another failing aspect of Jamm's. They use Illy coffee which I find to lack the robustness I love about coffee, almost watered down. I know many people love Illy though so this might just be a matter of preference.

Overall, I will probably never return to Jamm's. I typically give places two chances to win me over but on a good day Jamm's could probably only muster one additional star out of me.
The bread is phenomenal they have a short bit of jelly that are awesome and my belly is full

A great place to get classic American food. Simple prepared well comfort food. The pot o bread is light and fluffy and very tasty. They offer a la carte smaller portions of entrées which is really great for lighter eaters. The staff is friendly and always accommodating. If you check in on fb yelp or trip advisor you get 10% off your bill.

Service is great and a cute mom and pop eatery indeed.  There popover bread is why we come here occasionally.  It was served in a ceramic pot before but now in a tin cup which seems to get the popover bread out quicker.

We have tried their Sandy burrito, eggs benedict, and pancakes. All good. 

They have a $5 small plates menu, which I love and allows for you to sample a few choices. 

Expect a wait over the weekend and definitely try their popover bread, they have seasonal ones and original which is my favorite.   I am not sure why they are called Jams, but if I were to guess without asking I would think they are known for their homemade jams which unfortunately I have not experienced here, only the typical packets of Smuckers

I love breakfast food!  This place is amazing and looks to have been around for a long time!  I think it's a hidden jem!  Took family here to eat breakfast once and now everytime they visit, we have to go to Jamm's at least once...even their friends came here on a recommendation!  

The omelettes are huge and so the the pancakes.  They both taste great also!  They are even able to do egg subsitute upon request!  They offer sides with the main breakfast items and I recommend the "pot-of-Bread".  It's soooooo good!  They always have cinnamon raisin and plain...but they also have their "special" which ranges from jalapeno chedder to s'mores!  All of it is great!


Price is reasonable, wait is reasonable, wait staff and hostess are always happy and helpful!

Give it a try if you're ever on that side of town!
Delicious food every time I go! Love the variety, so there is something for everyone. Large portions, which allows for leftovers. Very friendly staff. Go early, as there is usually a wait.

Erika's small plates is the greatest thing ever for a breakfast restaurant. There are so many wonderful menu options this gives you the opportunity to try multiple omelets without the sides getting you full. Sandy is a great waitress and always friendly.

First and foremost, the staff here is just delightful! They have a regular crowd, everybody knows each others names, it's really welcoming. They're always very friendly, even when busy, and they take care of you as if you were family.

I've been here a handful of times as it's close to campus and I focus better in class when I'm happily stuffed. I've gotten breakfast all but one time in which I ordered the French Onion Soup and a salad and it was a total miss!

The French Onion Soup has a light broth with way too much thyme in it. The bread was a cheap generic white bread, so it got sort of slimy once it soaked up the broth. The onions were a thick slice and were not meltingly soft.
The salad which was Jamms House Salad was a cabbage salad with an "Asian" dressing. By cabbage salad, I mean, chopped green cabbage. That's it. The dressing itself was alright with some sesame oil and rice wine vinegar, but it was too heavy on the sugar.

That being said, the only thing I've eaten here for breakfast is omelets! The reason? Simple: The cheese. Oh my goodness, the cheese!! The omelets here are delicious but they definitely cheat by adding A LOT of cheese, which I'm a total sucker for. I usually eat healthy breakfasts, but the cheesy omelets here do me in every time. So much cheese you have to chew it well. It's glorious!
The Margie is my favorite omelet they have. It comes stuffed with mushrooms, tomatoes and artichoke hearts. Sometimes I add green peppers, sometimes I add spinach, but I always get egg whites which is a slight up charge ($1). They saute the vegetables before putting them in the omelets, so the tomato gets a little cooked which I love. It comes with your choice of potato (fries, hashbrowns, home fries) and bread.

Their bread selection is unique in that they offer a "pot of bread." If you like dinner rolls, you'll love this. Their pots of bread are really soft, pillowy, yeasty white breads. They offer seasonal flavors (I once had a divine raspberry and lemon), white, and cinnamon. Or you can get toast of course. I usually get fruit instead of potatoes and no toast or bread (at an up charge $3). The fruit here is always a medley of melon.

Great service, and amaaaazing gooey cheesy omelets! Coffee is decent.. just decent.

I tried the Chicken Fried Steak with Biscuit and Gravy.  I thought this was the best CFS I had in Vegas.  The steak is a deep fried variety.  The batter is thicker than others and has a good crispy crunch while being soaked with gravy.  It's not easy having that last bite still crunchy.  The hash browns were not over cooked or undercooked.  They were golden brown with a nice crisp exterior and nice soft interior.  The biscuit was very soft.  Melts in your mouth.  Coffee was good too.
Jamms is one of the best breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas---always friendly service and lots of choices of delicious food.
Family and I loved this place. Feels like eating at Grandmothers house. The cranberry potted bread was amazing and warm, hit the spot on that cold morning.
Love this place , great staff thats friendly with personality and lastly the Jamminator & pot of bread are to die for
Food came out in 10 mins, nothing was fresh. Bread is cold & stale. VERY disappointing.

If you are a person who loves crispy hashbrowns like my husband and me, this is the place to come. Just tell them what you want and they will deliver every time!  If we ever go out for breakfast, this is where we go.

Great price, good food. A little off the strip but well worth the drive if you have a car. Its a local place. Only problem is many people know how good it is so it stays pretty busy. Our wait wasn't that long though for me and my three kids.
Decent food at a decent price. Friendly staff who remember you is always a plus.

Famous for their pot of bread, it resembles a bread in a muffin tin with different flavors. I. Think that it could be more elaborate in looks and taste, like maybe being more browned and crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. Somewhat like a croissant. My friend and I shared the pumpkin cinnamon pot of bread. There is a weekly special. The service was nice, but as soon as I asked for the free pot of bread for my yelp check in, I was told it was for Dine In only. I didn't know, it's not documented anywhere. Anyway, I got a hard time for it. Just sayin.. the lady put it in a to go bag and said I we gonna do it anyway. Thanks. It want that big of a deal! Other wise, the breakfast omelet I had was a big portion and tasted  so so. I'm glad I was able to try this place.

Love this place. I started with the specialty pot of bread, which was red velvet and it was great. I had the corned beef hash and it was the best I ever had, made with real corned beef. My other dining companion had the French toast, egg and sausage combo. Portions are large, service is great. Very busy place, expect to wait, but it is so worth it. Please open another location in the northwest, I will be back.

Had the Texas chili omelet and the smores waffle.
The chili had great flavor and combined well with the omelet, very good and have never had shutting like it.
Can't really go wing with a smores waffle! The chocolate part of the smores were chocolate chips that weren't melted and that was a little weird, probably would have been better if they were.
