The potatoes or home fries served with the omelet were better than most.
The lemonade was delicious, no minute maid here!
The service was fast and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy like grandma's house:)

Strange a place called jamms only had the little Welch's packets of jelly!

Check it out, it's worth it:)
My life was saved by Jamms. A little off the strip, but so so worth the little drive. Omelettes on fleek, Shirley knows her shit, and the meal was very affordable.

Thankfully there are still some old school breakfast houses still left that are not chains. Jamms is one of these, and is my favorite place to get breakfast in between class or whenever I have a craving for a pot of bread.

They have a great menu, and decent prices (averaging 20$ for two people). It can get busy depending on the times, and it does close early for Vegas time. I have never had slow service or a bad server, in fact, they get me in and out very quickly so I never worry. 

They have a great selection of omelettes and pancakes (Smores are the best) and they have a special Pot of Bread every now and then. So far I have tried the Pumpkin with cream cheese and the chocolate brownie with marshmallow, both were amazing but the brownie one was the best.
Great breakfast with friends and family. It's a must-try place makes you feel like you're at home
I had the smores pancakes they were great. The orange juice tasted like orange juice from the stor

I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I have been there several times.  The food is great and the service is excellent.  I love getting the pot o' bread and they know how to make an omelette (which most places just mix it all together)!!!  I highly recommend this place because it's not over-priced and I love that I have never had a bad breakfast there!!!!

The food was OK, service OK (she never smiled once), prices abit high for the product. Then while paying.....our bill was 44 and change and they wouldn't accept our $50.00 bill. Told us to go break it at the store next store. There was no sign posted either. I'll never go back there when there are so many better places in this city to go.
Super yummy. Excellent portions, fabulous customer service. . Hidden gem, totally amazing!

Jamms French Toast was a nice little twist on my favorite breakfast food. A little crunchy, and you can somewhat taste the flakes. The corn beef hash was to die for. A side, however, is a bigger portion than an actual meal order, so prepare for that if you try to order sides as taste testers. Overall, the food was satisfting.
The service was completely alright. Our food took about 20+ minutes to get to our table and there seemed to be confusion every time drinks were discussed. But, they were pretty busy, so I'll blame it on that.
Overall, i liked it. I'll bring people here for some hearty and tasty food. Can't complain too much about the service, especially if they are so busy.

We found this restaurant on Google Maps when shopping on rainbow.  We were so hungry and a Pot of Bread sounded perfect.  We were not disappointed. The serving sizes were perfect and the prices are reasonable.  The pot of bread is great. This will be somewhere we visit again.
I don't even like breakfast foods but I come here at least twice a week! It's so good and they have the option to do small plates so the portions are perfect. The bread pots are my favorite!

The three of us are 4 pots of bread. Why? Because it was delicious! We had the cherry, cinnamon raisin and plain. In addition we tried three different omelets. The portions are generous and everything is fresh. Really enjoyed breakfast here and will plan to return the next time we are in Vegas and need a solid breakfast without breaking the bank.

Also, service was perfect! Super fast and my coffee was always full. I gave it five stars because Jamms does classic diner food really well.
We gave this place a try in place of our regular restaurant for breakfast: Hash House A Go Go. Its a great hole in the wall. Very friendly staff and the food is fantastic.

Was looking for a great breakfast spot and we heard about Jamm's and decided to stop in. The place was packed! That's always a good sign. Waited no more than the quoted time (5 minutes) for a table. Was greeted right away. The waitress recommended the chipotle mozzarella bun. It's was wildly flavorful! There was a lot to choose from on the menu. I will have to go back and try them all. We were happy with the food and the service.

I am not easily impressed but if you want brunch in Las Vegas Jamms was 5 stars in every category. We had spinach, avocado, bacon, omelet with crispy potatoes. Order was split in half with complementary pot of bread (we chose pistachio and cream) which was great for no added fee. Place is clean with good portions and well priced. Food came fast even though they were very busy.
You HAVE to come here when you visit Vegas. Old school decor, sweet waitresses.

Average at best.

We were "welcomed" in by the hostess whose only words were "For two?" ...yes. Seats us at our table, sets the menus down and walks away. So much for that welcome.

Our server was the best part of our experience. I believe her name was Sandy. She, unlike the hostess, was very welcoming, friendly and answered all of our questions as first time guests. Our food (including gratis Pots of Bread) was brought out promptly, so we appreciated that.

My Waffle Benedict meal was a 3/5.  Pepper flavor of the home fries was a little overpowering. Waffle was light and fluffy, Hollandaise was creamy and flavorful. But the Canadian bacon was way too thick for a Benedict. It was like chewing on a piece of leather. In my humble opinion, Kailyn's Kitchen still wins for best Benny in town.
In addition, I have to add that I was not offered a refill of coffee until our check came. Big deal. They would've scored those points back had they provided a restaurant-style thermos with more coffee at the table, if they're too busy to check up on us...come on, even IHOP does that. Yes, I went there.

We were passed with the check and thanked by Sandy. No message to pay at the register, so we sat awkwardly with our payment for several minutes before having to figure it out ourselves. We get to see the lovely hostess again, who says nothing as we give her our card and check. "Would you like your receipt?" Is this McDonald's? Yes we would. Handed our check without so much as have a nice day.

Perhaps it was an off day for these people. Unfortunately not a great impression was left for us as first timers. Consistency is the key to the success of a small business, and if you can't master that art, you will miss out on a lot of opportunity.

So good! My friend and I both got the Bamalama omelette. His was traditional, and I substituted tomato for the bacon. Both were winners. Even better, the pot of bread! He tried the cinnamon raisin, and I went for the cranberry coconut. Absolutely wonderful alone, but add the cream cheese spread for pure heaven.
Food was decent and adequately priced. I could take it or leave it. The people were very nice but the food took longer than expected.

Looking for a place to eat breakfast at and stumble upon this hidden gem off the strip.  

The tinted window hides the beauty of the inside.  Once you go inside its bright and modern.  

Greater and was seated immediately and handed a menu.  A guy with coffee pot goes around asking if you want coffee or some other beverages.  The service was fast!!! 

We ordered:

Corn beef hash and eggs with hash brown - it was so tasty and delicious.  Along with a day special of pot of bread - strawberry coconut fluff - it's to die for! 

Ruben eggs Benedict - fiancé said it was yummy and delish!! It's genuine.  

Also ordered French toast sticks-- they were very filling and heavy.  I only ate one stick.  

The food comes in good portions.  Our tummy are full and satisfied!! Oh and when you check in on yelp, you get  pot of bread for free and they have a promo when you show the server that you Instagram your food and tag them, they take 10% off your bill! 

Definitely will come back to try the other favorites on their menu next time I'm in Vegas!! 

By the way, I came in at 8:10 and was driving away at 8:40, that's how fast the service was.

I honestly wasn't impressed.  The man who seated us was very unfriendly he grabbed menues and followed with "Come On" and walked off. I hesitated because I wasn't sure if he said "hold on" but then he looked back at me and my kids impatiently so that cleared things up. 

On to the food- well let's just say two orders of French toast fries and the pot of bread we ordered was not very impressive. I didn't order food but my 7 and 8 year old did. The French toast came with out powdered sugar (which was a selling point for my children when pictured on the menu) and so we had to wait for the waitress to come back to ask for it bc my daughter wouldn't touch it with out it. End result- I nibbled at it and I not my kids were impressed. Burger King had better French toast sticks... And well the pot of bread... YUCK. 

30 dollars to feed my 7 and 8 year old sub par food with moody service?... I didn't even order food... Nah I'll pass. Won't be back.

After having dined here multiple times over the year (2013) I was recently shown my previous review, which was a two liner and felt ashamed I have not updated my pathetic first review.

JR is always a front runner in any Friday "where are we going to breakfast" discussion.  The reasons being you are always going to get a great breakfast, happy service and great coffee.

The omelets are a group favorite and I seem to focus on the Jamms Signature Omelet.  
It consists of pieces of sliced tender steak, onions, mushrooms, cheese.  All covered with a wonderful béarnaise sauce.

JR is known for their pots of bread, which is FREE when you check-in on yelp.  The benefit  has yet to expire because every time I check-in.....there it is.  CHECK-IN!

ON my most recent visit some ordered the grits.  Now I can take or leave grits.  But I would kiss these grits all damn day until I died of a heart attack.  Heart attack?  YES!  the are covered in cheese and comes with butter! You can get the LARGE or you can get a "monkey size" which dials down you cholesterol a tad.

Be sure to grab a stick of Juicy Fruit at the counter when you settle up the bill.

Be sure to add this to your list of breaking the fast spots!

I really enjoyed Jamm's! We used a yelp check in offer for some delicious free bread too! Ate a fantastic breakfast after a 15 minute wait on a Saturday morning that left everyone stuffed to the gills, whether was waffles, pancakes or eggs. Portions are enormous and service was friendly and relatively quick!
Hanging out at Jann's with my favorite girl and glad we made the choice to hang because we were greeted by our beautiful friend Kim who is always the hostess with the mostess!!!

Food was good- didn't like the pot bread... service was fast but buser was pushing us to leave...
When I got to the register I was trying to find my free pot bread coupon here on Yelp and the cashier just ignored me and ran my credit card through anyway I guess you must have to know the people to get the actual friendly service... instead of come in and sit eat give me your money and get out now
So good you have to try the bread it's to die for and the breakfast Omelette Coke with bread and my favorite powder sweet potato fries

Dang, are they busy. I shouldn't be surprised though since it was a sat morning. Wasn't too long of a wait considering we have six people in our group. Ten minutes maybe? 

Checked in and received my free pot of bread. Pretty cool. I love free items. The cream cheese frosting isn't too sweet and I tried the new chocolate chip cinnamon raisin bread.

We all were starving so I only got a few pictures in. I will talk about the food I did try.

The Belgium waffle is large and tasty. Actually, all the plates are huge, so come with a huge appetite, or expect to take food home. Apple cinnamon French toast is ridiculously big and sweet. Too sweet for my liking but it might just hit the spot for those of you with a huge sweet tooth. Large enough for two or three people to share. I got the biscuits and gravy, which were delicious. I practically had to lick the plate clean. If it weren't for the biscuits and gravy this probably would have been a. Three star review. 

Everyone else loved their items, but I didn't get to try them. Next time, I say!

Waitress was great at constantly topping off our coffee and bringing more creamer too. Considering how busy they were I would have never known considering how often she visited out able. Great!

For a good, home cooked, large portioned, home type feeling restaurant this is your place to eat.
Love it here , pot of bread is best. Staff is awesome, 5 stars all across. I really enjoy hearing Shirley 's laugh, it can be heard across the restaurant

Saw the reviews and was staying down the road, thought why not, better than going to a chain.  Glad i did

Wait staff is friendly and responds quickly, checks on me often. People and the atmosphere, feels like a hometown diner.  

Food is pretty good and good sized portions.  

Had the meat lovers omelete with cheese and home fries.  Tasted great!

I was not familiar with Pot of Bread.  Its kinda soft fluffy breakfast roll that they flavor and serve with light icing.  Today i tried the cinnamin raisin.  Great!  They also gave me a reeces cup one to go.  Excited to eat it on the plane.  No cinnabun for me!

Give them a try if youre in the area.  Good break from the strip and right on the way to Red Rock.  Off Rainbow and Charleston.

I forgot, also the coffee is pretty good, and im a coffee snob

I have been going to Jamms for many many years and consider it my home away from home.  Due to some physical conditions I am unable to do much cooking at home because I can't stand in one place very long, hence the reason I eat at Jamms a few times a week.  
It distresses me that a review from a Janice on 6-18-2016 was so distasteful (pun intended) because she claims to have found a hair in her French fries and was sad that they only took the price of the fries off of her bill when she clearly was looking for a free meal.  
I know everyone at Jamms and my 6 g-kids are regulars as well as g-ma.  we have never found anything, that didn't belong, in our food but if we had they would have either replaced the item or taken it off our bill.  to expect a free meal for that is stupid and reminds me when people used to PUT things in their food in order to get out of paying for it. 
Jamms is, without a doubt, THE BEST RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS and if you haven't been there yet, you should check it out.
Reuben Benedict and Chicken Fried Steak! Free Pot of Bread offer redeemed! Lovely people and place!

Excellent breakfast spot. Pot of breads are awesome (they are really just breads baked in cupcake size). Had an omelette, customized however you like. Huge portions, friendly service, and quality food!

Great breakfast spot! 

Excellent pot-o-bread, yumm. The flavor of the week was Oreo and it was devine. 

Great pricing for fresh and hearty egg dishes. 

Would definitely go to Jamms again and reccomend it to friends and fam.
BEST BREAKFAST WE HAVE HAD IN VEGAS! This includes Monte Carlo and Bellagio! Plus got a free pot of bread! Service was excellent and our server Staci was top notch!
Service was good, food was nothing like I expected. Yet again the great reviews on Yelp failed me. Not worth going back to.
This place is great. The people who work there are super sweet and the food is awesome! Defiantly try the pot of bread it delicious.
The food was very good! Loved the Pot of Bread and Sandy Omelet!! The coffee was a bit of a bummer, watered down. The service was fabulous and prices were reasonable. We will definitely go back!
Excellent gem found here in heart of Vegas. This place is your one-stop for great food!

Home of the pot of bread. Well that was good and the food is good but the service is horrible. Had to wait for a table, but that's typical. After waiting for @ 20 min just to have our order taken it was proof then why the wait to sit takes a long time. I think we had more interaction w the bus boy than out waitress. Had to ask for refills which should never happen. Stay on top of your customers please!!! Finally food has been eaten and plates removed and again another long long wait for the check. Over all the service alone will keep us from coming back. No one wants to waste half a day at this. Your staff can be friendly as our waitress was, but when you fail to attend to your customers you fail to get returning ones.

I like jamms.  It is good, they have a great little thing called a pot of bread.  The regular pot of bread is good, but I tend to like there special one for the week.  They have really good pancakes, and decent burgers. The staff is friendly, but they really do get crowded on the weekends. Especially on Sunday morning. The staff is friendly, and the prices are okay.  I do love the smores pancakes, and the cornflaked French toast.  You should give it a try you will love the home kitchen feeling and friendly staff

We searched YELP for a good neighborhood breakfast spot and decided to try JAMMS which is about a 15 drive from the Strip but worth the drive. If you don't have access to a car consider renting one to drive to this gem. The "pot of bread"  (preferably flavored) with the honey butter is mandatory eating. My wife and I both had the make your own omelette ($9.99) which comes with a "pot of bread" and choice of potatoes. (Consider a little basket of sweet potato fries if you want something different than hash browns.) I planned on attaching pics of the food, but after one taste it was gone before I remembered that I wanted to take pics. Don't tell anyone about this place otherwise it will likely he too crowded as more people venture to this prized breakfast location.

After yesterdays encounter we wanted to revisit a friendly place that we know we can get a nice meal and great service.  Jamms once again provided us with top notch service, very generous portion sizes.  We joined them early in the morning for breakfast to which we were promptly seated and drink orders were taken immediately and brought out right away.  Other than my wife getting a bagel instead of an english muffin, which she didn't mind getting, it was great!  My drink never dropped below half full.  Great staff and great food.  Waiters and waitresses in Vegas could learn something from a small ma & pop place like this about customer service and attitude.
This is a place I'd recommend to anyone.  They are friendly, polite, and best of all make you feel welcome. The food is great. The specialty items make the experience, definitely worth the trip!!
Breakfast always the bomb at Jamms with the family. Fast service, friendly service and reasonable prices. Sandy is awesome!!!!!

This is a great place for Breakfast! The decor is ho-hum but the food makes up for it, as does the great service and friendly staff. The omelets are huge! And come with choice of potatoes and pot bread ( super yummy ) or English muffin or toast for around 9 bucks! I went there with my husband daughter brother and dad. For all of us with drinks and coffee was about 56 bucks...a bargain if you ask me =) We left happy and full. I suggest the pot bread french toast...mmm.
Service is wonderful the food is the best thing I have ever tasted. U need to visit u won't go away hungry
Cant go wrong with this place, very creative menu and super delicious.

I love Jamms! My mom and I usually split the Irish Skillet. The portions here are super generous so I find half sufficient. It's absolutely delicious! We also share the french press coffee, which is also delicious! I do wish they would bring pots of cream to the table instead of the mini creams, it seems wasteful to me. 

The staff is really friendly and nice, and they are very accommodating. The service tends to be pretty quick as well! Plus they have a Yelp deal if you check in! 10% off your entree with drink purchase!

Seriously soooo good! Has a small diner feel with delicious and creative dishes, but without the pretentiousness or price of alot of brunch places. It's honestly my favorite breakfast place in Las Vegas.  Feels like a hidden gem.
A+++ for customer service, taste of food, and value. Definitely felt welcome and will return!

Excellent food! Our waitress Staci was genuine and funny, also knowledgable and gave great recommendations. We had the French toast, breakfast burrito, Belgian waffle, and Reuben eggs Benedict....all was amazing! What a cool hole in the wall breakfast spot. Less than 10 minute wait on a Saturday morning. Will be back next time we're in Vegas.
Cute place.  Plenty of food and plenty of choices.  Sandy is an excellent waitress.  Very efficient and friendly. Pots of bread a nice touch.
A bit of a wait, but worth it! My food came crazy fast. Staff is very friendly. My server Shirley was so sweet:) only a 5 min. drive from my house, I'll definitely be back soon

Great down-home diner. We stopped by here before our car ride back to LA. I had the Sandy (?) omelette which had a avocado in it. Very tasty. I think the sweet part of breakfast was also really really good. Service was friendly and the wait was not very long.

I no longer see bread the same way. Their pot of bread, mmmm how I love thee. It's so delicious!!! I ordered their plain and cinnamon/raisin pot of bread. Seriously, you can't order just one... gotta  try them all!!! 

FYI I would recommend to get in before 9am. If not, enjoy the wait.  It is WORTH IT!!!!
After eating here for more than 10 years I thought I had tried all the breakfast potatoes but the home fries was a real treat.

In the summerlin area and was tired of all the stuff we tried before.  We frequent bagel cafe, egg works, cracked egg, and the alike, so we wanted to try something different.  We found Jamms on yelp, so wet gave it a shot. Firstly this place has a great "breakfast" feel, friendly staff, and the traditional specials dry erase board.  My gf had the jamms breakfast sandwich w home fries, and I had the corned beef hash, and we shared their special cinnamon "pot bread", everything was flavorful (not too seasoned) and most importantly fresh. Everything you would want in a breakfast spot. We will def be coming back.
LOVE Jamms! They have THE BEST Eggs Benedict! And the fresh baked cup o bread...so good!
The home pot of bread is so delicious!!!  The service was great and everyone so super friendly!  We had a variety of breakfasts and everyone thought theirs was the best!

I use to go to Jamm's a lot before I moved out of Las Vegas. I was in town with some friends, one local and one from the Midwest. I remember how good it was and how much I liked it. So I recommend that we go here for breakfast. 
I asked the waitress if I could order of the child's menu because I have gone through oral cancer and do not eat that much. She goes yes you can, we also have all our omelets at a senior size. (Which is half the size) I told her that would be great. So I order the omelette with sun dried tomatoes, green onions and cream cheese. It came out half the size of a full order, the sun dried tomatoes was super dried out. I have had them there before and they have been soft and easy to eat. 

Then here comes the ticket shock, you would think that you get a senior size the price would be less for half the size. WRONG IT STILL CHARGE FULL PRICE. I brought this up and was told it a smaller size but you still charge full price. We brought this up with the cashier, she was like oh well. 

If this how they treat people that is not right. They have lost me has a customer and I will not be back. I will tell all my Vegas friends not to eat here.
Excellent food!  You will only need to eat one meal that day.  Pots of bread are delicious!

Visited this place during a recent stay at Vegas. We wanted to try something off the strip and found Jamms. The menu has alot of choices and everything looks good. I got waffle benedict which was excellent. Also tried the bread in pot which was awesome.

Excellent breakfast! We finally found a spot that has a Taylor ham sandwich that we approve of. The only thing that could have been better in our opinion was the roll it came on. But that's more of a preference thing on our part. Service was a tiny bit slow but it looks like it was due to a backup in the kitchen. We got the free pot of bread with the yelp check in and it was great! Will be back soon.
This place was great, my brother brought us there for breakfast and it was excellent!

I really wasn't impressed. My husband and I stopped in on a Wednesday morning on a recent trip to Vegas, we were seated immediately by a friendly hostess. I was really excited to try it due to the great reviews, it's a way off the strip and wasn't worth the drive. 

I had the Breakfast Combo thing with eggs, ham, sausage, bacon, and pancakes. The pancakes were doughy and not cooked through, the eggs were a spongy egg-replacement, and the rest was average. 

My hubby had the Corned Beef Hash Eggs Benedict at the waiter's recommendation and it was really slimy and the English muffin basically drowned and dissolved in all of the sauce. His hashbrowns were greasy and left a lot to be desired. 

We ordered the S'mores pancake to try it and it was just a pancake with chocolate chips and marshmallows sprinkled on top, it was gross. Our waiter didn't take it off our tab or bring us the cinnamon raisin pot of bread we ordered. 

Not worth coming back, and no clue why it is so highly rated. Cost us $25+ so not cheap diner food either...
Nice place to get breakfast away from the strip. Great pancakes and eggs. Although, I thought the coffee was a bit watery and weak. Would like to go back and try the french toast.

we've been to Jamms twice in the last 2 weeks. they are right by our house and perfect for our "lazy Mondays" when we don't feel like cooking. they present themselves with a Paris-cafe-esque feel. its cozy & comfortable.
my hubby & i have plant-based diets, and although the vegan-options are few, we still love enjoying a vegetarian meal here. their bread-pots are delicious and we've enjoyed all food items we've ordered. the waitresses seem to commit to the Jamms claim "enter as strangers, leave as friends". we've had great servers & all great interactions w/ the staff. we always feel welcome and valued.
Awesome.food, good staff, good service, enjoyed the meal, the wait for a table wasnt the best, but other than tnat not too bad

Let me start this review by stating that the service at Jamms gets a 5+ rating.  Never was my glass empty or my table dirty.  They were attentive and did an awesome job at making sure we had everything we needed.  This rating is based on my meal.  I had a French toast combo and decided to go with the Jamms French Toast.  It was very tasteless and needed something sweet to give it a wake up call.  Had the chef done that, I would be giving this a 5 star.  Otherwise, the rest of our breakfast was good and my wife really enjoyed the pot of bread!!  I just recommend asking them to sweeten up the Jamms French Toast because I lost my appetite after eating it.

This place can get super busy, and there's a reason why. Everything I've tried here is great. To the point where I had a friend come in from out of town and she loved it. The next time she was in town, the only thing from her last trip she insisted we repeat- Jamms. Any time a tourist wants to go to the same place twice, you know it's awesome. And the people working here are always super friendly. They treat you like family. And yum goes the food. Try the bread bowl! It's their little specialty.

Great food ! Great Service! = Will be returning soon ! The help is always friendly and efficient. The pot of bread is always the way to go. Every week they have a special flavor pot of bread. They will not seat you unless your entire party is present. This is due to the fact it's a small place. You can order French toast coated in corn flakes. Wow. It's unique.
The food was really good but it was so stuffy and hot in the restaurant. Burnt toast smell got a bit noxious.
My favorite place for breakfast. Bring all my friends food always good.service friendly and prompt

Worht seeking out for sure.
Eggs benedicts if really good.
Service is fast and friendy.
Make the drive from the stip you wont be sorry.

Over the past year Jamms has won me over and become one of my favorite breakfast spots here. A big big part of the upgraded rating is because of the staff. Lots of friendly and just nice people, which goes a long way when they're some of the first people you see in the morning. Lots of regulars too that you'll start noticing if you spend more time here. Just kind of a pleasant way to start the morning. The food has been consistently good. The pots of bread have become something I look forward to, especially with the new special flavors every week. And that free stick of gum on the way out. Those details have really paid off over time.

My wife and I enjoy finding local places when we travel, especially for a great breakfast.  We found that Jamms easily lived up to its five star rating on Yelp.  The bread in a pot was extraordinary and clicking on Yelp made this complimentary.  The day's special was banana chocolate which was delicious as was the cinnamon raisin. We shared a veggie omelet.  It was fluffy and delicious.  My wife is a connoisseur of breakfast potatoes.  She said the Jamms was among the best she has ever had.  Our waitress told us that she had worked there for 14 years.  That says alot about the quality and management of the restaurant.  One suggestion we offered was to provide real maple syrup at an optional upcharge for the pancakes which were terrific but loss some quality with the imitation syrup offered.

All in all, Jamms is worth the few minutes drive from the Strip for a great a reasonably priced breakfast.

6/20 just had breakfast here Veggie Omelet was tasty. Ham and Cheese Omelet was ok. Server and cook did a fine job pretty speedy.. We will be back for more because Im happy... I approve this message J K KUHL...
Food was ok but was a bit too pricey Denny's is better you get more for your money and much tastier  also we ordered a side of pancakes which the waitress forgot to bring :(

Checked in here yesterday for some good home style food.  At least that's what all the reviews say, right?  Let's just start off by saying that they truly do treat you like family.  Service was very warm and they're genuinely glad to see you there.  I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs.  Great flavor and I absolutely loved the texture of all the caramelized onions and crispy corned beef hash.  Very good.  I also was curious to see what all the hype was about the Pots of bread.  Meh, it was ok, but to me, nothing to write home about.
The pancakes and pot muffin are really good.  The bacon was crisp, coffee was margina and the service was decent.

This is where you have Sunday breakfast if you're an old Jewish couple, or a non-old Jewish couple who happens to want some kick ass breakfast for a pretty reasonable price.  I've been here a few times over the years and it's always busy, but consistently good service.  The menu is what you'd expect:  pancakes, waffles, french toast and a bunch of egg-based platters, salads and the usual sandwiches such as the Club; point is, it's all good.  Most menu items can be ordered small, if you're watching your weight. Don't forget about the free pot of bread with Yelp checkin!

Since Jamms is right across the street from where I live it is my go to weekend breakfast treat. I can always get a seat at the counter no matter how long of a wait it is for a table.  Jamms has illi coffee from Italy and you have the option of the little creamers in the plastic cups or milk served in a mini glass container. The also have a different flavor of their pot of bread weekly. I usually get something off of the breakfast menu but they have great soups and sandwiches too!

Nuh not impressed with this place. Wait was to long service was ok. Food? Oh well I have had better food at other places.
Their favorite pot of bread they say its so delicious was just meh. Weekly choice was cherry cream cheese, nothing to rave about to be honest.
Coffee was just normal cup of coffee. (Free refill) 
The portions are big sizes but I dont care about the size I rather have small portion but tasty instead of huge size but no taste.
Waitress was nice, front people were nice, but wont be going back.

Great service! Our waitress was so nice and friendly. No problems getting a Benedict exactly how I like it... I basically made up my own favorite toppings and it came out PERFECT! So glad we came here on vacation. Thank you!!!

I wanted to love here, I really did . Upon entering we were greeted by the woman standing at the counter. We didn't see my boyfriends family that we were meeting and we weren't sure if his little brother would make it, so we asked for a table of 4 to 5. She told us she couldn't seat us unless our whole party was there. I understand places that have this policy, but usually they tend to explain it nicer than they did here. The woman's tone was very unfriendly. We asked if it was possible just to put us at a table for 5 just incase the little brother snuck in a little late, not even order and her response was "well it depends if I seat you at a table for 4 or 5" ... Ok so please make it 5? Thankfully right then the little brother walked in and we didn't have to deal with her anymore. We were seated and quickly taken care of by a really spunky and nice waitress, she was seriously great. Big personality! 
I ordered the small plate omelet and their pot bread (cinnamon raisin). The omelet was average, I really wasn't blown away by it. The saving grace of the meal was the pot bread which was warm and delicious! 
Food was ok, front desk customer service was bad, and waitress was great! Probably won't go out of my way to eat here again when I visit Vegas.

Good food and pretty good service. 

I was in Las Vegas for vacation and came to Yelp to find a non-touristy breakfast location. This seemed to be the best choice. We made the 8 mile trek from the strip and found Jams.

The first visit I had the Steak and Eggs. The steak was nothing fancy, just a typical cheap diner steak. It was cooked well but it was just okay. The "breadpot" was pretty damn tasty. I had cinnamon raisin and added lots of whipped butter. VERY tasty =D

The second visit (not my idea.... families idea...) I had the Texas Chili Omelet. This visit proved to be much tastier! The chili was meaty and flavorful. They were more than willing to add onions and jalapenos, per my request. I had the pumpkin and marshmallow breadpot with sweeeeet sugary frosting =D. 

Overall it's a great local place. The staff was quick and friendly. Refills were pretty quick. 

Only thing that bothers be is the gramatically incorrect wording on the front page of the menu.

My wife and I ate at Jamms this past weekend for breakfast, and let me tell you, this is somewhere we will be coming back to all the time because it was amazing.  We had one of their pot breads to start (cinnamon raisin), which was awesome and free with yelp checkin! The sweetened butter was fabulous too.  For our mains, I had the breakfast burrito which was a perfectly prepared burrito filled with eggs, onions, and cheese and some delicious hash browns.  It was excellent.  But as good as that was, my wife's Jamms breakfast sandwich was better.  It was easily the best breakfast sandwich I've had.  Ham, cheese, eggs, thick Texas toast.  It was fabulous.  The home fries were delicious as well.

With that said, I also have to comment on the outstanding service provides by the employees at this establishment.  From the moment we came in and the hostess took our name to the end of our meal, service was friendly and outstanding.  We were greated promptly, sat at a perfectly clean table as soon as it was ready (there was a line when we arrived, as the place is deservedly popular), and our drinks (coffee and water) never reached empty.  Orders were taken quickly, food was brought promptly, it was a tour de force of outstanding service. And, to top it all off, this place is a great value.  Prices were extremely reasonable!

Overall I cannot recomment this place enough.  Go here and enjoy.  You will love it!

This breakfast spot is awesome I live in California but visit family frequently and always try to come here . The food is delicious and service is great definitely a family tradition coming here now to put one by me would be great :).
Love the pot of bread. They have Strawberry coconut fluff pot of bread this week. The service is always excellent & friendly.

Staff is awesome mostly there at least 7-8 years though 2 newer females in front were less than pleasant- if we weren't regulars since 2003 & these 2 were my first impression we would have walked. 
A pathetic attitude from the cashier like she's hot shit does not match the great service the waitstaff provides. 
The food is fast & consistent- a bit over priced but we obviously haven't stopped driving 20min to get there for a reason
Try any omelette (or red velvet pancakes my sister in-law got today)
we are here and loving it.  great food and friendly service.  the top breakfsst restaurant on my list.

Great food, great staff, great atmosphere.  The cornedbeef hash and eggs was great, loved the pot of bread, especially since it was free.  I could probably give this place 5 starts, but I'm going to have to eat there a few more times to make sure it's earned.  The staff seem to know and love there regulars which is kind of a nice change.

I never let the fact a restaurant in Vegas is in a strip mall bother me, because inevitably they wind up being great and Jamm's is no exception. We came based on the Yelp reviews and had to leave one for others.

The free pot of bread you get with a Yelp check-in is awesome, we had the cinnamon raisin variety and were pleasantly surprised at how much lighter and fluffier it was than your regular cinnamon roll. We had omelets with home fries and it was very filling.

Service was friendly and fast, good value.
Best breakfast I've had in forever! Had an omelet with a side of biscuit and home made potato chips that were amazing  also customer service was great!
This is our favorite Breakfast place!! We love the great food and personalized service! I'd recommend it highly.
I highly recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegad, the food is very good, and the customer service is awesome.

A - OK pretty much sums it up.  I had a grilled cheese so it wasn't too hard to mess up.  Service at our table was good, but the hostess seemed a little rude.  We called ahead and they said there was no line, when we arrived 5 minutes later there were probably 5 or 6 parties waiting.  Could it have been bad timing and all of us arrived at once?  Possible, but unlikely.  

We got a free pot of bread with our Yelp checkin but I wasn't too impressed with that either...  it's bread.  Am I missing why this is such a novel thing?
This was my first time here. Most friendly staff. The food was excellent. The best breakfast place in Las Vegas. We will definitely be back!!

Tried to get in here before, but lines out the door on weekend mornings.  Glad we tried again!  BF very happy with his Sandy Omelet, filled with thick sliced bacon, what looks like a whole avocado almost, and a hint of sour cream. He topped if off with their salsa and was mightily pleased.  I had the corned beef hash, the genuine stuff, along with the cinnamon raisin pot of bread and walked away full and happy.  BF had the day's special pot of cinnamon apple butter bread--homestyle delish!  All-in-all, great service, yummy food, ohhellyah we will be back!  Also, had a promo going that if you post something on social media and show cashier your post, they discount 10% off your bill.

I went here for the first time today and the food was incredible. Had a Denver omelet with hash browns and home made cinnimon roll. It was a little pricey but the food was worth it to me. I would definitely go again and try the flavored pancakes, they looked amazing

Worse than the 1st time! This time service was even more terrible and the food was Bleh. They really don't have a kids menu worth ordering from. We stopped at black bears and baby cakes and both had long waits so we ended up here.....crap! We ordered corn beef hash,
Lumber jacks kids meals and the biscuits and gravy. Came with the pot of bread which was under done :(
Waitress was not nice and patient she just rushed us and seemed to like chit chatting with the other customers leaving us to feel really like we were a bother to her. We will not be returning.  This place seems to cater to certain kinds of clientele (if you know what I mean).  Again--baby cakes is preferred but be prepared to wait long.

There's always a wait, with good reason. Delightful, home style breakfast in a divey little strip mall. Get the pot of bread; you won't regret it. Great French toast, hash browns, and pancakes. Good service, good prices.

A favorite go to for breakfast and lunch!! Amazing omlettes and the signature french toast is to die for!! Of and if you love a great ruben sandwich...this is the place. Server, SHIRLEY is such a sweetheart and always has a smile on her face!!

I was a bit disappointed when I ate at this establishment. I've a huge breakfast fan, and am always looking to try new places. 

It was pretty packed when I got there, and so I had high hopes. Busy places usually mean good food. 

Service itself was just bad. We were seated and given our menus, but no one came around after that for at least seven minutes. And when our waitress finally did come around, she had a very snide attitude.

I ordered the chicken fried steak. The steak was good and flavorful, and not the least bit dry. The gravy however, which was put on heavy handed, was disappointing. It had no flavor and added nothing to the dish. The scrambled eggs I ordered with it, were very dry. Which is a big pet peeve of mine. Scrambled eggs are probably my favorite thing to eat, and ruined eggs just ruin my meal. 

The Sandy omelet was ordered by a couple others that I was eating with. Both of which said their omelets were dried out as well. And that it was just disgustingly full of bacon. 

The Cinnamon raisin pot of bread was probably the best thing that was served to us. 

I definitely don't see myself going back to this establishment.

Been going to Jamms for almost a year now, and I love it more every time we go.
Friendly staff, great service even when they're packed. Food is really good.
Omelets are gigantic and tasty, and Eggs-florentine is really good.
I love, love their pots of bread. They always have regular and cinnamon-raisin and they feature a different 3rd option weekly, today was lemon-lime. Last week was orange-cream. Delicious. And they always have a consistently great cup of coffee.
It's a comfortable, family-feeling environment, great people and great food.
They have wonderful service everyone is very nice and have a positive attitude.the food is delicious some of the best ive had from a restaurant

Break away from boring strip breakfast and come over here.  This place is an absolute gem. You must try the Jamms French Toast.  I do not even like French Toast that much and this is good.  Sandy is among the best servers I have had.  I had not been there in 4 months and she remembered our names.  I promise I am not just saying that because Sandy's omelette is the best egg on the menu.  Cannot say enough about the pot of bread.  Try whatever the special is.  I have never gone wrong.  Worth the wait, but if you avoid weekends from 9:30-noon you should be fine.

The only reason I gave then 4 instead of 5 is because sometimes you have to wait more than 30 minutes, outside. Tough w a baby in arms!
Food is great, staff are wonderful including the bus boys.

I will have the French toast and a cavity. 

How have I just discovered this place of nearly three years living in Vegas?  I checked into Yelp, and got a free Pot of Bread. Score. Um...yeah it's scrumdillicious. 

I got the Jamm's French Toast.  It was really good. It really would have been hit out of the ball park with real maple syrup, but no one around here serves anything other than Aunt Jemima or Mrs. Butterworth and being from upstate NY where they serve nothing but the real stuff, I am a bit of a spoiled brat...I can dream about it being smothered in real maple syrup...it was still very satisfying with knock off syrup.

I got home fries with a side of sour cream. At first it looked a little unappetizing but looks can be deceiving. Best home fries I have had and that is saying a lot since the competition around these parts is stiff.

The coffee is strong.  Like STRONG! I needed sugar and more than I normally use...I asked for more sugar and they don't mess around... 

So basically the next time I come here while everyone's food-seeing the omelettes almost made me want to change my mind and one of those, looked amazing I am seriously coming here just to engorge myself on pot of breads and potatoes. 

Yes, come here, do it.

One of my favorite breakfast spots. My favorite waitress is Shirley...she's full of life, very friendly, happy and a great waitress. 
I'm a regular here :)

Went here for breakfast.  I had to find out what a pot o bread was.  Took a very expensive Uber from the strip to this place.  Reminds of you of any greasy spoon diner that you find across this country.  The Pot O Bread was very good and you should try it, if you go.

My brother and I were both up at 8am and wanted some breakfast.  He found this place online and wanted to try it due to some awards they received from Best of Vegas.  I then looked it up on here and read about the special offer for a free pot of bread.  I love bread and was excited to find out what it was exactly and to try it.  After our waitress took our orders I mentioned Yelp and asked about the pot of bread.  She didn't seem familiar with the offer, but didn't question it at all and brought me one.  In case you're wondering, it's a personal sized piece of bread that comes in a little round bowl and resembles a large cupcake.  I got the cinnamon-raisin one and it was definitely the best part of my dining experience.  The top was just a little toasted and the middle was soft and chewy.  If that were all I ate I'd have given them 5 stars, but sadly it went downhill from there.    
I ordered an omelet with avocado, bacon, and cheddar and it was a big disappointment.  There was quite a bit of bacon inside, but it was all way overcooked and a little thick, so it was rock hard.  The avocado was good but it was all on one side, so I had to open it up and spread it out.  Also, the only cheddar I found was a few shredded pieces on top.  Like I said, very disappointing.  In hindsight I should have sent it back and either gotten something else or had them remake it.
They give a choice of hash browns or home fries and I had the latter.  They were good and had bits of onion and bell pepper mixed in.  Overall, I can see how this place could be good, but my experience wasn't the best.  I'd give 'em a mulligan tho.

Hello! First time to Vegas and I find this place! What a gem! They have huge portions and very reasonable prices. In the 4 days I was in Vegas I went there twice. That's how good it was. And the waitress remembered us. That's how a diner should be. Their French toast is deep fried and covered in corn flakes!!! Not to mention they have what is called pot'o bread. Brilliant! I got the special for that morning which was strawberry s'mores. Yes that's right. STRAWBERRY S'MORES! Together in perfect harmony. Why haven't we combined these favors years ago?!? I could never live in Vegas but if I had to, Jamms would make it a little less unbearable.

Just tried out their night menu - they have an awesome selection of unique hamburgers, some other sandwiches and wraps, a few salads and a short list of appetizers.  The choices of sides are many - seasoned fries, skinny fries, sweet potato fries, potato salad, coleslaw, cabbage salad and a regular side salad.  The drink selection left something to be desired, but they do carry the essentials. (Coke products for sodas)  While the items are definitely not standard, it *is* a smaller overall menu than most places.

A recent addition (I don't remember seeing it on their lunch menu) is "The Jamminator" - a whopping 24 oz burger with your choice of toppings.  If you take the challenge and can eat it all in one sitting, they give you a free t-shirt.  After seeing how big their regular burgers are... that thing has to be monstrous.

I had the Egg Salad Burger.  (Yup - a 10 oz burger with a scoop of egg salad on top, plus the normal fixins.)  It was fantastic, but super big.  Definitely something to cut in half and take part home for later.  For my side I chose the sweet potato fries; they came spinkled with powdered sugar.  I think I could've just eaten a plate of those by itself and been satisfied.  Super delicious, and a nice sweet change-up from normal fries.

The waitstaff is super friendly, almost to a fault.  Great group of people, though.

Comparing what you get for the money you spend, this is easily one of my favorite diner-style restaurants in town.  Expect to spend about $15-$20 per person if you go all out with drinks and dessert.  It's definitely worth it.

Had breakfast here during our latest venture into town.  What lead us here was reading about their pot of bread, which I had to try out.

The resto is a typical family diner, but not quite that of a greasy spoon.  Menu offerings were fairly standard as they had a nice variety of omelets, skillets, eggs and such, french toast, waffles and pancakes.  I ordered their Corned Beef Hash and Eggs, which was definitely none of that can stuff, it was housemade and cooked to perfection!  It was one of the better offerings of CBH I've ever had; you can trust me on that, I've been eating CBH since I was a kid.  The pot of bread it came with was served piping hot and was yummy.  I added butter and jelly and it was a nice treat.  Definitely skip the toast and go for the good stuff!

Service was very friendly, they kept our glasses full and most importantly my coffee cup filled with hot caffeine goodness.  Which by the way, their coffee was pretty good!

Overall, Jamms is a nice spot for breakfast, we'd come back again!

First time here for my wife and I and I was cheerfully insulted on the way in!  All in fun, just the way I like it!  Had to try the Pot of Bread, the special was Oreo!  Wow!  Very tasty!  Had the Jamms' signature omelette stuffed with steak, mushrooms and cheese with a side of hash browns!  It was all gooooood!  Have to come back at least for another Pot of Bread!

Was really  looking forward to my usual Irish skillet but about broke a tooth on a rock or pit the size of a small pea.  Luckily tooth was ok but did sent it back for a new skillet.  The waitress was very apologetic and told the manger what happened.

The one star rating was not for the hard pit in my skillet but for not even a visit from the manager or an offer to give a discount.  This was totally unacceptable service in my opinion.  I didnt expect to get a free meal but I did expect the manager to at least come over and apologize, but NADA.

Won't be coming back for awhile, too many other good breakfast places around town.

The Jamm's French Toast was some of the best french toast I've had in my life, and the ham steak was half the size of an entire plate! Pot-o-bread is similar to Alton Brown's Popovers, poofy, soft, and flavorful bread in a little muffin tin. Service was friendly and overall the food was excellent. Will definitely be back many times!

Got a free pot of bread through check in.  There is a reason why this place is constantly crowded.  The food is delicious, a service is speedy, and waiters are nice.  I've got nothing to complain about this wonderful establishment.

Great food, price, and service!

FOOD:
Four of us went to Jamm's based on one of the guys recommendation. I'm glad we listened to him. We all thoroughly enjoyed our meals. It was my first time having french press coffee, and it was awesome. We each ordered the Pot of Bread - one guy had the cinnamon raisin, and the rest of us got the special Oreo version. It was so good. The taste and texture of the bread reminded of a soft dinner roll, but the Oreo added a really nice sweetness, and it came with a side of sweet cream frosting/glaze. For our main breakfast dishes we ordered the Cornflake-crusted french toast, and the Irish Scramble, which is corned beef hash with peppers, onion, eggs, topped with cheddar cheese. Sounds yummy, right? Well, it was!

SERVICE:
We went on a Tuesday morning just before 8am. We were seated immediately, and had great service throughout. The waitress and busboy were friendly and attentive.

I'm rarely in Vegas, but next time I visit I will definitely try to come back to Jamm's.
Very courteous and prompt service.. Food was exceptional. Will return! Chicken and waffle is so good

Shay was my server and she was friendly and helpful. Tim, the server assistant I think,  was great and quick on the refills. Food was outstanding, and I'm a vegetarian, if that helps anyone. Their veggie omelet and veggie breakfast burritos are top notch. I'm stuffed because I just had to finish that huge burrito. Time for a nap. =)

First time here and have determined it was a pretty good decision.   There was maybe a 10 to 15 minute wait (0900 on Saturday morning) but we'll worth it.  The staff was very friendly,  the food was quick,  hot,  and plenty.  They have PLENTY of great items on the menu but I went with the basic eggs and bacon with hashbrowns and toast.  Great start to my day.

I love Jamms! Great service.  Great food. Great breakfast spot. It is our place on the weekend to go when we don't want to hassle with breakfast at home. Great prices.  The staff cares about its guests and the weekly Pot O Breads are delicious
Had a omelet with artichokes, tomatoes, onions and lots of cheese. Place is a very nice place for breakfast. Great potted bread

It's either Jamm's or I-Hop or Denny's.  Until recently Jamm's was the choice.  I haven't had a bad meal there in at least a dozen visits for breakfast.

If only I'm lucky enough to visit when that cackling waitress has the day off. She's a great gal, don't get me wrong, but wow that laugh is tough to take early in the morning.

One time I had a "fluffy" omelet.  Well, it wasn't fluffy.  It was a regular omelet like any other.  I mentioned it to the lady at the cash register when I paid.  "I don't think that was a fluffy omelet," I said.  Just a harmless comment, not a complaint.

Of course she got huffy.  I think she was the owner.  She looked at me like, Who are you the galloping gourmet?  "All of our omelets are fluffy," she insisted in a crabby tone.  

OK fine, calm down.  It left me with such a negative feeling I haven't been back. It's not that I'm holding a grudge but an experience like that cuts my enthusiasm for a place.  I don't feel welcome there anymore. Now I go to Red Rock casino or Denny's. Jamm's is so busy that one customer more or less is no big deal. They won't have that annoying fluffy omelet guy to deal with anymore.  

Good for kids:  Don't encourage people with "good for kids" votes.  Let 'em invade Denny's or I-Hop with their screaming whining little hellions. This is a small restaurant.  A tantrum will disrupt the whole place.

Coffee and pot of bread great....service is bad!!! Breakfast took 2 hours!!  Food was just ok. Had to ask for to go box twice and then it was thrown on table! Our bus person Jose was the nicest person there! Probably won't go back.

My wife asked me, "Do you think you can adequately describe the nirvana you just reached?"

The short answer? No. 

I ordered a liberally cheesed dish called the Irish Skillet. I've been to Ireland, but I don't remember having anything this good. 

The pot full of bread is an awesome idea and the Cinnamon Raisin is very good. 

Service is incredible and though the atmosphere is a little lacking (what do you expect for a homey feel?), the sum of all parts more than makes up for it.

Short story - go here. Home cookin' never tasted this good.
I've been coming here for at least 10 years. Always excellent service and the food is amazing. Get the pot of bread every single time. It is soooo good.

What a great little diner. This place makes you feel at home with the newspaper,and the great waitresses. Reminds me of better days.

There are so many good things on the menu it is always hard to decided. This time I wanted to do lunch and the NJ Sloppy Joe-a triple decker sandwich with pastrami,corned beef,and turkey w/cole slaw & 1000 island sounded good. BUT....

so did the French Dip sandwich with steak fries and au jus.

I got the latter and it was damn huge I knew right away I was at best gonna make it through Half.

The beef was tender & tasty. The Roll was soft and buttery but firm enough to hold up to being dipped.

The fries were seasoned and very tasty.

As expected I barely made it through half but there was no way I was leaving this one behind!

If you like that small town feeling when you go out to eat. THIS IS THE PLACE!

This place can rival Babystacks, and they are just as busy as Babystacks!  While Babystacks has their red velvet pancakes, Jamms has their pot bread!  Not only in plain but you can choose from cinnamon raisin and the special of the week.  And this week was Spice and More...which I will not disclose the detail of it but all I will say is, you must head on over there and try it!

I ended up ordering the ordering Babalama omelet instead of the Sandy omelet, as there was there was the  SOUR CREAM in the Sandy's omelet.  But the rest same, loaded with bacon, avocado, tomatoes, and melted Cheddar cheese.  OMG, it was so delish!  I ate so fast that  I ate so fast my tummy was telling me to slow down!  Pot bread comes with pot bread already and your choice of potato fries or hash-browns.  I choice the hash-browns.  

The rest of my part choose the chicken fried steak with three eggs, your choice how preparation, and a Provencal Cheese omelet with fresh diced tomatoes, spinach and provolone cheese.  

This is definitely a place worth trying and repeating all over again!  Great staff and your coffee is always full!  CAUGHT'CHA READING!!!

This place has gone downhill. The first couple of times I went here, the food was great. So was the service. But my last couple of times eating here, the food was lackluster. The service is still good, but there 'pot of bread' was cold & bland when brought to me. Boyfriend ordered the chiliquiles & the chips were all soggy.

I've been to Jamm's twice and both times I was impressed. I found out on the second occasion that I could check in and get a free pot of bread. Not feeling adventurous I chose the white bread over the orange creamsicle flavor of the day. The bread was super fresh, tasty and hot out of the oven. I loved it.

As for breakfast the three of us ordered biscuits and gravy, an order of the French toast sticks and a New York strip with eggs. All of the items were cooked perfectly including the medium rare strip steak. I will remember not to attempt to eat an entire order of biscuits and gravy again. The portion was huge. 

I find their coffee mugs sizable and the staff is always available for a quick refill. This is a great spot for breakfast without a huge wait time. We hit them on Mother's Day weekend and the place was packed but there wasn't a line out the door or anything so we were promptly seated.

The food was great ...once we sat down. Make sure your whole party is there when you request a table. If you say a table you better have 3 present or you have to wait until they get there before you get seated. 
Frenchtoast was perfect, the best I had in a while. Eggs cooked to perfection and huge fluffy pancakes. The country fried steak was reminiscent of that served in my school cafeteria, terrible. Biscuits were perfect and the gravy was pretty good. I would go back but never have the country fried steak again. 
Our waitress was great

Always great service with a smile & amazing fresh cooked food. Got my favorite, the Irish Skillet, delicious & filling with home made corned beef hash. I highly recommend! 

(Different day) We come here often because it's always great. Not super happy with the corned beef hash today, it was mushy & had too much garlic. I'll still be back
Very slow, poor service. Out of party of 5, 2 had issues with order. Hair in a BLT and tuna that tasted as if it was out for a week. To their credit they did try to fix things.

I left my hotel at the Wynn Encore (awesome hotel) and all of the splendors of the adult "bathing pool" because I had seen this place with Corn Flake french toast on the Food Network and had to try it (I make this at home). I took a surprisingly lengthy (twss) and expensive round trip cab ride way out on Rainbow rd where you could still kinda see the strip but it was still $30 away. Anyway, after passing the strip mall where this place sits a few times, cabbie found it and I settled up to the counter in a surprisingly empty restaurant (well it was about 3pm on a weekday). A very friendly waitress greeted me and the french toast I ordered was well worth the journey. If you haven't had corn flake french toast before, this is a good place to try it. Perfectly cooked on some good bread and quite tasty. The corn flakey crunch adds so much to the french toast experience, you may never make french toast the same again. Awesome.
Got the individual tapas items for breakfast. Had the Reuben eggs benedict very good. Great service too.

We went over the weekend with my extended family hoping to get some yummy breakfast, but were very disappointed. We called ahead to make reservations since we had quite a few people and were told the wait was 15 minutes. We got there and the wait was 20 minutes, but we waited over 30 minutes before we went in and asked for an update. There was a large empty booth that we requested, but they said they would not allow us to use it since they didn't think we would fit. They didn't even let us try, and the majority of our party was small children, so we would have fit. They then told us the only way to let us eat was to put us at two tables at opposite sides of the restaurant. It was very frustrating. By that time we had been there about 40 minutes and everyone was getting very hangry. We ended up having to just go somewhere else. We wish they would have just told us they didn't have room for that many people when we originally called so we didn't waste our time. None of us will be going back after the horrible service we received.
Amazing!!! Food is great, they were busy but food came out fast and was delicious!!! Donna was our server she was amazing!!! So helpful and always checking on us drinks were never empty!

One of my favorite places for breakfast.

One house special is the "Eggs Benedict" - of which there are several varieties (including one that is served with a waffle rather than with an English muffin). They are all good.

The house coffee is Illy brand, which is an awesome way to start the day.

Prices are fair for what you get. The food is delicious.
Do not miss the "Pot of Bread" - fresh, hot white bread served in ... a pot ... what else?

Also, it is just a few steps away from the Dead Poet Bookstore - Vegas'  largest and best used book emporium. Plan on spending the rest of your morning there.

Our new bfast hangout ..great pancakes and waffles selection and even greater lunch menu ! We had Eggs and pancakes with Nutella ..Its pancakes with Nutella topping ..I should have tried pumpkin pancakes ..French pressed coffee was a nice option ..chicken club sandwich was great ..we saw a lot of tables ordered waffles and chicken ..so must be their thing ? Oh..if u check in on Yelp and showed it to your server you get a free pot of bread ..we got the blueberry one super yummy  ..if u like the additional 10% off your bill, post of Facebook or Twitter too

Jamm's is a great breakfast/lunch option tucked in a shopping plaza on the corner of Charleston and Rainbow. Although there are a lot of options for this type of fare, Jamm's remains one of my favorites for a simple, but well prepared breakfast.

I have a couple of criterium for an acceptable breakfast restaurant, those including good coffee, has waffles, and offers crispy, shredded hash browns as a potato option.  Jamm's offers all of
these (although I wish they had thinner waffles as well as Belgian).  They do; however, serve their coffee in a nice large mug and are somewhat known for their pots of bread (a sweet yeast roll marbled with different flavors).   My favorite order is the waffle with a side of their bacon. It's always served perfectly crisp. Although I do not eat eggs, the other half loves their omelets and always has a cinnamon raisin pot of bread. 

Jamm's remains one of my go-to breakfast spots in Vegas because of their traditional menu, good service, and easy location. It does get very busy on the weekends, but it's easy to figure out when the wait will be the most manageable and try them... I'm sure it won't be your list visit!
Great locals place. The service is outstanding. The food is great. I had the biscuits and gravy, wow... The best I have had in a while. French Toast was just as good.

This was my first visit.  I went with my son who's been there before.

A slight delay but nothing to ruin the experience.  Plus you have to expect some of that for such a popular restaurant.  

We were seated in a comfortable booth and approached immediately by staff for our drink order.  The coffee was so-so but good.

I ordered Jamm's Signature Omelet and it was very tasty.  Totally forgot to get a pic of it as it looked just like the pic in the menu.  Medium to large omelet and very good tasting.

I also ordered the Pot of Bread and it was very good.

Prices were comparable to IHOP and Denny's but the quality and flavor was way better.
Love this place their pumpkin pot-o bread with cream cheese spread is amazing. Everything is great even the service!!

What can I say! Well, to start off, Jamm's feels like home. I come from Northern California and so you can say that im spoiled with tasty and fufilling food with a very homemade touch. I feel that restaurants lack the "at home" type of feeling, Jamm's is definetely one of those establishments. As soon as you walk in your greeted with a huge smile and welcome. I waited less than 2 minutes for a seat. Right away we were asked what would we love to drink. Service right away! 

The waitress with an absolute contagious smile, was very sweet and helpful. We did not wait for our food no longer than 15 minutes! Awesome, because I get so anxious when it comes to food. I ordered the Sandy Omelette (which I reccomend), DELICIOUS! Goodness, it was GOOD, hey did not skim on the portions of bacon,avacado, cheese and tomatoes. 

I strongly reccomend this restaurant!

Rounding up for Jamms since I really had a nice experience there getting breakfast. Crispy bacon in the omlette was key and you got a lot of avocado too - no skimping here!  Service was prompt and I would say I like Jamms more than Mr Mamas where I've been to a lot.  It's a bit further out from the Strip if you are a visitor to Vegas (as I frequently am) but worth it!

I've dined here four times.....

The first time:
I ordered the turkey, swiss and pear wrap........WTF?  Flavor explosions with every bite.  So good, I knew that it could easily become a "go to" item when decisions had to be made on the fly.  Also, on the side, I order their famous bread in a pot.  If you LOVE fresh bread and carbs as much as I, you'll flip for this warm, doughy goodness!  (sigh)

The second time:
I ordered the Jamms breakfast sandwich; scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, Texas toast.............typical flavors for a typical breakfast sandwich.  Yet again, I ordered the bread in the pot and it melted in my mouth!  It is the business!!!

The third time:
I was craving good 'ole steak and eggs so I made my way to the closest breakfast joint.  No, I'm lying, I wanted the bread in the pot!!!  =)  I'm a medium-rare, over medium kinda girl, and when the steak came out chewy and well done and the eggs, over-hard, I was terribly disappointed.  The only thing that was eaten that meal were the hash browns (you can't mess up potatoes, can you?) and the POT OF BREAD (of course)!

On my most recent visit to Jamms, I decided to order my "GO TO" turkey, swiss and pear wrap........decision well made, THANK GOD!  As usual, I ordered the POT OF BREAD, and LOVED every moment of it!
=)

~The service is wish-y wash-y at best.  One time I'll have over the top exceptional attention, and other times I'll be flagging the server down because I've gone 20 minutes (literally) without any sort of look my way.
~The menu is large........nearly 20 omelets alone!
~The POT OF BREAD is what keeps me coming back!!!  I dream about that bread!  Every time I drive past Jamms (which is often) I think about that bread!  UGH...........I want some NOW just writing about it!!!   =)
~I'll continue to give this place a shot......they can thank the POT OF BREAD for that! 
=)
Had lunch today with my Wife and Mother N Law it was great. The food was delicious and Jasmine our server was Awesome!

Mediocre in nearly every way. The food is bland and unmemorable, the pricing is a little high for what you get. The service is generally pretty good. There are better breakfast options not too far away.

Service was great- food was great - wife got the corn flake french toast & is probably the best i've ever had- I got the steak omelet & it was good as well- the icing for the bread bowl was great not to sweet - We will be back

Pleasantly surprised! There isn't an overwhelming abundance of breakfast places around here, and diners can be pretty hit or miss- but this one knocks it out of the park! Menu has about ten different omelets, in addition to skillets, benedicts, and the usual waffles, pancakes, etc. along with lunch options: sandwiches, burgers, soups, and salads.

BF and I started with coffee and OJ, then opted for different omelets: the Jamm's signature omelet for me  (béarnaise sauce on the side, I never used it), Joe's omelet for my guy. Each omelet is about $10, and includes your bread of choice (I opted for the plain pot bread, BF had the special: walnut brownie) as well as an additional side (wedge fries for me, cottage cheese for the dude).
Good portion sizes for the price, both with the variety of sides and the sizes of individual items.

Omelets were both cooked perfectly: others have said they are drowning in cheese, which is not entirely true. Mine had a good amount, but the Joe's omelet was a little lighter. Both had good amounts of meat and veggies. 
The fries are tasty and seasoned, served in a cute little individual fryer basket container (cute!), cottage cheese is standard. The pot bread was a delightful surprise! Preferred the plain flavor: reminded me of slightly-sweet biscuits with dinner, growing up with homestyle country meals. The walnut brownie pot bread was sweet, but no overwhelmingly chocolatey or nutty- the name had made me expect more of a dessert on the table, but it wasn't overkill.

Service, as others have said, rocks. Attentive and polite, not overbearing or annoying.
Will be returning to try the benedicts and perhaps a lunch one of these days. And the featured pot bread, of course!

Not exactly sure what all the hype about...or maybe these people have just been breakfast deprived...but this place was just OK. I have had a lot better elsewhere and was kind of disappointed. The pot of bread (that everyone raved about) wasnt that great..and no one in our group of 12 really liked it. 
I got the corned beef benedict. It was alright. I think there was some kind of skillet that was the only thing everyone actually liked. 

However, the Service was great though

I would go back.

Reminds me of a mom n pop stop.  People were friendly, service was pretty good.  The food wasn't anything to write home about but I did enjoy my meal.  I liked the casual setting and it's in a convenient complex with plenty of parking.

I want to go back to Vegas NOW!
There are ways to tell if I'm having a good meal. One of them being is that I will moan a la Meg Ryan Sleepless in Seattle. I met up here with a woman who I consider to be a second mother. It had been more than 15 years since I had seen her and this is where she chose to eat. Thank you mama Cheryl!!

The place is small, but what it lacks in size it makes up for in great service and food. Our waitress was a sweetheart! I ordered the cinnamon pot of bread and the corned beef hash breakfast. My hubby ordered the French Toast breakfast.

DELICIOUS. 
ORGASMIC even.

I need to go back to Vegas, nao!
Come hungry and you'll go home happy. Worth the wait. Good service. Bring the whole family.
This is the place to go.   Very fast and VERY friendly service.   Come here often from across town (mainly for breakfast.   If you've never been here, you HAVE to try the pot bread

At first it's deceiving when you drive up but once you get inside it has a small diner feel to it. Expect to wait at least 15 to 20 minutes  for a table then 10 minutes more once you sit down to order because it is that popular and busy.  They have very tasty food and they are humongous portions. We ordered chicken fingers for the kids and the flavoring was really good and they we very crispy.  My husband ordered a bowl of their homemade chicken noodle soup and it was really good and the serving is over 2 cups. I ordered the French dip and it was super yummy, normal size but still yummy. This place has 2 very unique things you can do for a discount and a free item. If you check in on yelp, you can get their pot of bread and if you do get the cinnamon raisin bread, you won't regret it. To score a discount all you have to do is clean your plate. Sounds easy but it can be a challenge because of the huge portions. I highly recommend this place. A must eat in Las Vegas.

Good traditional breakfast.  Fast service and good coffee.  Cornbeef was tasty but a little too salty.  Hubby's french toast was good. 

We'll be back...

After 26 years in Vegas, I've eaten a lot of breakfasts at a lot of places at all hours of the day and night. Jamm's remains my all-time favorite. Coffee is always hot and strong, food is always delicious, and the service is always excellent. Toast schmoast...get the famous Pot of Bread!!

My husband and I decided to try this out since it's down the street from where we live, we went in there around 11:00 am and the place was pretty packed already. We didn't wait too long so that was cool was a good thing.

Once we had sat down, someone had come over to take our drinks right away. And if you're a big coffee person, this place is for you. They make sure that your coffee is never low or out during your whole dining experience.

My Husband ordered the Corn Beef Hash with a side of toast, which tasted really good. It wasn't too salty like most placed that we have tried. And the hash browns were a good sized portion and very crispy.

I had ordered the Country Fried Steak with the famous Pot Bread on the side, and the Steak was good, but the gravy tasted like packaged gravy to me. It was also a little bland and it's sad to say I had add a little salt and pepper on top to add some flavor. But everything else was delicious. My Hash Brown were just as crispy and delicious as the one my husband had. Oh and the pot bread... I've never tried anything like that before and it was super tasty, I got the cinnamon raisin pot bread and OH MY GOODNESS, DELICIOUS. it came out warm and it wasn't too sweet even when I added the icing on top. Yum.

Overall I had a good dining experience here at Jamms except when My husband and I received our food it wasn't as hot as I expected to be. I felt that they were so slammed that they might have forgotten about our food because the table besides us got sat 15-20 minutes after we did and got their food the same time. But we will be back though, because everyone was so sweet and we love Mom and Pop Shops

I really enjoyed eating here. Cute decor, warm and friendly wait staff, and great food. The only thing is that I wish my breakfast had a little less salt, but I have to give them props for using FRESH CORNED BEEF for their corned beef hash! Their Cinnamon Raisin pot of bread was excellent and it was enough for us to take back to our room and heat up for the next day! :) YUM!!!
Always the Best breakfast in town!!!!  We are never disappointed with the great service and friendly faces!  Thanks for a great start to our Mother's Day weekend!

All the yelp, trip adviser and various social media stickers on the door made me feel like I was going to enjoy an amazing breakfast and that was not what I got!  The restaurant is located in a strip mall location and looks like a good find when you search for it.  There was a long line for a wait and the locals told me I would not be disappointed when I questioned the 20 min wait before a flight so I stayed with my friends who are locals.  The wait wasn't too long ..our server took a bit of time getting to us because they were busy ...my fresh cup of coffee (there's a portion on the menu that says that we all deserve it to be fresh) was never refilled ...after I asked for it it came as I was almost done with my meal.  My gauge of a good breakfast is always a Benedict ...I've had multiple variations of it and it's my go to ...must be the sauce ....the menu talked about how you should get turkey if you want it but I guess it only applies to sausage and not bacon ..no beef or pork for me.  I opted for the Benedict with spinach ..egg was ok ..I asked for over medium and it came out over easy ..don't like it when the egg white is still liquid ...the hollandaise was average - nothing extra added to it and the spinach fairly bland.  I did order the bread in a tin and that was decent - I got to sample the plain, raisin and finally red velvet - the cook on each was different and I did finish the bread the only part of my meal that I polished along with the coffee.  I'm pretty limited in some of the things I can eat so when there's an item on the menu that excites me and its executed well I am pleased.  Social media is definitely something this restaurant does well and I think it contributes to their awards and recognition because the food is ok just like any other standard breakfast place out there.
Truly a hidden jamm! If you're seeking a truly local breakfast shop, make sure to stop in. They have a fantastic menu with constantly changing specials. Love it, wish I found this place sooner!!

This is hands down my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas. The portions are huge and the food is delicious. The Babalama Omelette is my favorite but their breakfast and lunch selections are all fantastic. Get the pot of bread and enjoy a warm, fluffy slice of heaven.
I enjoy this little place.  I think a lot of other people are too!! Packed this morning.
Great food! Cuban panini was great. French toast is amazing!! Cannot wait to come back next weekend and try more!
