Outside of the place being freezing, the staff was nice enough and the food was good. The Cuban sandwich was excellent and the French dip was just okay. The pot of bread is a good signature appetizer. We would go back if we are in that part of town.

Long overdue. I stopped by with my husband on September 4th. We were in Las Vegas celebrating our first Anniversary, traveling from Sacramento, Ca.  The food here is amazing. I had the homemade Chicken Soup and a turkey sausage burrito. My husband tried their pot bread and the crunchy french toast. The food was perfectly prepped and seasoned.  The atmosphere was loud but we knew it was because it was busy. Must be because its popular. Certainly interested in coming back if ever I am in the area again!

I thought Jamms was a nice restaurant. I would suggest ordering their in house items. I got the pancakes and eggs, they were good, but nothing superb, but my boyfriend ordered the french toast and bacon which was incredibly yummy! The service was quick and friendly and I would definitely recommend it!

I love the comfort food, illy coffee, servers, & my fave- Shirley's unique laugh across the room!

I more come to hear SHIRLEY's uplifting laugh.  I am not laughing at her, I love how she loves her job!

I was looking for a restaurant that had good corned beef hash and this place popped up. It's located in a strip mall and it's actually bigger on the inside than it appears. Total hole in the wall diner feel with booths. 

Ordered the corned beef hash that comes with 2 eggs, hash browns and their famous pot of bread. I got the lemon and blueberry, which was their flavor of the week and it came out piping hot with sweet butter cream. They also have plain and cinnamon raisin daily. Everything was great! Did not disappoint and it was a good size portion. My pot of bread wasn't quite ready with the rest of the order, so she gave me a complimentary cinnamon raisin also. 

Next time I'm going to order the home fries instead. It's not the typical diced potatoes, but they were sliced and looked almost like hash. Tasted hubby's and it was good. He ordered the Reuben omelet, my son had a made to order omelet and my other son had the steak and eggs. Everyone enjoyed their meals and said the restaurant was a good choice. Will definitely be back!
As visitors to Las Vegas, we find Great food and really good service here. For us it's worth driving off the strip. They're friendly and flexible. The little pots of bread are so cute

Literally my go to place for breakfast. Everything is always cooked to perfection & served with a smile. The place is so down to earth & relaxing which is pretty surprising for a small restaurant. It's cozy in a great way (:
This place is Amazing!  I love to find great restaurants that are not a chain and this one is awesome!  Over the pot of bread and the breakfast burrito!

I love breakfast food and I must admit, its hard to find a really good breakfast place. I came here with the bfriend and we ordered:

*Matty's Country Benedict:
 2 biscuits at the bottom with 2 sausages and 2 perfectly poached eggs on top, covered with creamy light yummy gravy!  Also came with a choice of hash browns or fries.
*Country Skillet:
fluffy scrambled eggs with sausage pieces, diced sweet onions, shredded hams, sliced mushrooms, diced potatoes.. covered with their creamy gravy on top.

The service is two thumbs up-- quick and friendly. The waitress came back several times to ask if we needed anything and if everything was okay. I really enjoyed their breakfast and the gravy topped off everything perfectly. Loved it!!
Came here for the 2nd time today. Still impressed with the service and food. Generous portions and lovely waitresses too. Nutella pancakes with banana are a must!
Breakfast was average. The pot of bread is just a dinner roll in a tin...people were nice. Comfortable.

We tried the Reeces and Cinnamon Raisin pots of bread. Both were delicious! Ham steak amd eggs was good. Ham steak filled half of my plate. Canadian bacon and eggs is 3 small pieces of canadian bacon. Small, quaint little home town type of restraunt. Nice to go to a place that isnt near the strip for some good food. Would come back again.

if this place didnt close at 3pm everyday i would come more often. i've had the sausage breakfast and its consistently delicious! i've tried their buffalo chicken strips and fries.. sweet potato fries!!! so tasty. i like their buffalo strips cuz they're flat and juicy. not super drenched in sauce so they're not soggy! so.. 1 star off for closing so damn early and another for... slow service. ppl at work usually call in their order so they dont have to wait around. service has always been friendly here.. shoot.. i would be too if i got off at 3 everyday! its right around the corner from my work so i always see ppl from work with leftovers from jamm's and everyone drools. hmm.. i think i shall stop by before work tmrw cuz this review is making me hungry!

My second visit to Jamms and I might be hooked! As an east coast girl, I grew up on diner breakfast and have been scouring the country for that homestyle familiarity. The LAST place on earth I thought I'd find it is Vegas. 

Bringing my visiting PA native parents here at an off peak time (very important to avoid a long wait at this popular spot) we were seated immediately by friendly staff. Our waitress came over promptly and took our drink order. Consummate coffee drinkers, my family complimented Jamms regular brew. I've had their French press prior, and that was just as delicious. 

Mom and Pop took forever to decide but two words on the menu immediately decided for me: taylor ham. This Jersey breakfast staple is impossible to find outside of the Mid-Atlantic!! The Taylor Ham breakfast sandwich with (gasp!) REAL griddled potatoes was my choice. One bite and I was transported back to college and better days. Listen, I'm not an asshole that waxes poetic about food for no reason, but I'm not kidding--the sandwich was bomb. 

Mom got the 2 egg breakfast with bacon and hashbrowns because she's boring and a picky eater. It was as good as it gets with eggs over medium cooked perfectly. Dad got Joes omelet which was big enough to make him think twice about finishing the whole thing (he did though, because he is a machine). 

The pot o bread--a fluffy roll baked in a muffin tin--was phenomenal. Do yourself a favor and get the flavored ones. Cinnamon raisin is a delicious choice!!

Our food was served almost immediately after ordering, and server Jasmine was perfectly attentive without being overbearing--a hard balance to master. This place is popular for a reason so be prepared to wait but trust me, it's worth it.

This is my favorite place for breakfast and all of the staff is pleasant and friendly. Shirley is one of the best waitresses we have had and love her energy and attitude. She makes the place feel like home.

I had heard great things about this place and was excited to try it. I had the chicken fried steak and my girl friend tried the waffles. It was ok...it's hard to screw up breakfast but it's even harder to make a great breakfast. 

This wasn't great my plate seemed a little dry.

I read up about this breakfast place online and decided to take a break from the very busy Las Vegas Strip for breakfast. We had a great experience here. The service was good, the food was tasty and there was a line out the door when we got there. That was a sign that the locals like going there as it was so off the beaten track. We would go there again, nice family owned and operated restaurant.
I love Jamms. These usually a wait, but the food is worth it. And the French press coffee is to die for!  Everything in the menu is delicious.

This place was amazing. The staff was friendly and cheerful. They were efficient and energetic. They checked on us frequently and when my order wasn't to my liking even took it off my tab because I don't eat eggs and didn't know eggs were in what I ordered. Shirley is amazing! We will be back there for sure, food is great for sure but the staff is definitely top notch!
I just want to say if u eat here they will put u to sleep for two hours afterwards! Food coma!
Omg this place is Bomb.com you definitely have to try it when in vegasand out waitress Shirley is awesome
Jamms is like a trip to grandmas house. Yelping never tasted so good. I'm going with the corn beef hash and free pot of bread for every yelped eat it up yum!

My husband and I came in this morning around 11 am for breakfast. We sat at the bar so we didn't have to wait. Our server had the greatest laugh! She was personable and funny. A real "at home" feel. He had the corned beef hash meal and I had the stuffed French toast meal... They were both SO GOOD! I never finish my plate but I did today. His was massive! Even took home a small box! The home fries are excellent. Similar to cowboy potatoes. We live no where near here and drove quit a distance. Totally worth it!

Excellent food. Good size portions. Friendly staff. Gotta love it! They remember my husband and I each time we come in and always know just how to help us make the difficult decision of what to eat each time cause everything is so good.

This place was referred to is by a local. I wanted really good food and not just the stuff everyone is eating that is commercialized. This place did not disappoint. The service was impeccable and the food was outstanding. I had the corned beef hash (instead of sliced corned beef) Benedict and pot of bread. The bread was delicious except that the condensation in the pan it was served in made the bottom soggy. Oh we'll. the hash browns were crispy and their homemade hash was simply amazing. Coffee was on point as well. Husband had steak and eggs and was happy with portion and taste. I want to come back and have more before we leave. I also have to thank the waiter at another restaurant for the recommendation.

I've been coming here since 2012 and the food is not consistent. I expect some great food for the price but that doesn't happen!

Oh and depending on what waitress you get will depend on the price you pay.

Temperature of restaurant is always freezing.

How is this place rated so high?  Meatlovers omelet. .does not come with cheese???  What holds it together??  Nothing!!!  Very bland.  Jamms French Toast is cereal coated bread dipped in egg milk and fried..no flavor at all.  Home Fries were potato mush with peppers and onions. Coffee --no flavor.  The Bacon was the only thing that was enjoyable.  Off The List!

Went here on a Monday morning and the place was pretty busy, still lots of seating available, but a good first impression. I sat down and my drink order was taken immediately. I looked over the menu, knowing of course I was getting the pancakes!! My waitress came and took my order and asked what I was drinking. She came back with another diet soda and a caraf!! Scored some major points there cause I guzzle soda!! I ordered the home fries as well bc the pics looked sooo yummy!! I was dissapointed that they came out as little chopped up bits of seasoned potatoes with peppers and onions...did I order the wrong thing? I'm confused on what the potatoes are in the yelp review pics that look like they are super crispy on top, almost looked like a mound if mashed- are they the breakfast potatotes? The guy next to me had a dif style but they still looked shredded. Either way the pancakes were amazing, little crispy on the side and barely needed any syrup they were so tasty. They are def the buttery version as opposed to a dryer type like at maple tree, cracked egg and weiss deli. I will def be back to try and get those potatoes. Very friendly atmosphere....would have been 5 stars had I gotten the right homefries!

On Fathers Day I simply looked up "breakfast restaurants" + my zip code. Wanted to find someplace a little different from where we normally go for family breakfast. Jamm's was absolutely amazing! Every review was spot on, even when they tell you it's well worth the wait. Our waitress was funny and courteous, the food was absolutely outstanding and their signature POT OF BREAD was out of this world!!! I will definitely frequent this place many times over!
Try the mini pot with the raisins and cinnamon , it's delicious.   This restaurant is to die for. We come here weekly with my clients and we all love it.

The corned beef hash with egg whites and the pot o' bread are my go-to selections at Jamms.  A neighborhood breakfast/lunch eatery, the staff is always friendly, albeit a little slow on the service at times.  I think I've only been here on Fridays, so it's not too crazy busy and we've rarely had to wait for a table.  The pot o' bread is Jamms signature, basically a big yeasty dinner roll that comes with most of the breakfast platters, as well as getting a free one with your Yelp check-in.  Customers can choose the standard plain, cinnamon raisin, or the pot o'bread of the week; today's choice was triple chocolate brownie.  I had that pot o' bread plus the cinnamon raisin one that came with my corned beef hash breakfast--carb loading indeed!  If you haven't been here and love bread and breakfast like I do, give Jamms a try.
Drove out of my way to eat breakfast here based on friend's recommendation. Glad I did. Service was outstanding - fast and extremely friendly and attentive. Great coffee, very good food.

If you are staying in Las Vegas I would highly recommend leaving the strip and driving to this restaurant. The service is excellent. The French Toast tastes great. Coffee was good. They do bring milk for cream so it you want the classic cream taste ask for the half and half. The server asked me if I want a fresh cup of coffee with the cream. I noticed a lot of regulars and locals coming in. The hostess was very polite and cheerful. She also wondered on how we found the place. It looks like positive reviews are bringing people in. On the way out I noticed all of the social network ratings including Foursquare, Yelp, and Trip Advisor. Google needs to advertise Places.
I wasn't too impressed. The eggs didn't seem to be scrambled fresh. Likely bladder eggs. We went to Mr. Mama's the day before it was excellent. Highly recommend there instead.

After a long day of traveling we wound up in Vegas hungry for a good breakfast. We found Jamms to be all that we wanted and more.  Friendly service, great food And the bread bowls were delicious and innovative.  I like their menu that has classics and creative dishes for all the "Foodies" out there.  We'll be back!

1st time here with friends. The service was good, i ordered the chicken and waffle sandwich. Hubby ordered the corn beef hash. He liked it alot, mine was so so. Chicken was dry but waffle had good flavor. May try & come back and try lunch.
A welcoming environment! Food was good  service was great. A menu full of good  food choices .

Great breakfast. Everything tasted pretty good and we all left feeling full. The corned beef hash was noteworthy as it was made from scratch. I would definitely eat here again. You also get a 10% discount if you show them that you did a Yelp review.

Love their fat fries with a side of ranch! I usually get their jamms american breakfast sandwich or their BBQ chicken sandwich or their amazing Denver potato pancakes. Love this place. Definitely me and my husband's go to place for brunch!

Brought the kids in for a weekend breakfast.  They were pretty busy but we were seated quickly.  I ordered the Reuben Benedict and the kids all got the Lumberjack Jr's.  My benedict was nothing special.  The corned beef being the only thing making it somewhat like a Reuben.  I love eggs benedict.  I guess I just expected more.  Another element or two of the Reuben would have improved it.  The kids were happy with their meals.  Service was ok.  They were busy so I don't really fault them for that.  Overall I would give them another try if I was in the area.  

They don't take Discover.

I came here last week when I was on my road trip. I wanted to stop and see Las Vegas for a bit, even though it was so hot. I decided to find a local place to eat. Jamms Restaurant was on the top of the recommended lists on various websites. I definitely do not regret my decision to come here... The service was very good, even though the waitress accidentally forgot my honey mustard, but she apologized for it and still did a good job otherwise. I ordered an omelet with home potatoes, along with the plain flavor for the pot of the bread. It was a good experience. I will stop by the next time I come to Las Vegas. It'd definitely be a good hangover breakfast for those who choose to party and gamble at the night.

My favorite place to eat breakfast has ALWAYS been BLUEBERRY HILL. I don't like anyone else's french toast. I ordered a omelet here and was really surprised by the size of the omelet, the amount of vegetables, and best of all the perfect amount of cheese. The omelet was fluffy and didn't have a overcooked patch of burnt on it at all. It was very beautiful. I was there at 8:30 am on Monday and I was so happy that there weren't loud mulitple crowds. It was consistently busy but not overwhelming and annoying. My friend and I sat there for quite a while catching up and best of all the server didn't harrass constantly. They let us talk for quite awhile without interrupting. 
The only bad thing I had to say was the hashbrowns were TOO crispy for me. They were overcooked and crunchy and had that burnt potato flavor. Other than that---this is one of my new favorite spots for breakfast.
One of the best places to eat when I come home to Vegas! The staff and owners always show lots of love !!!! #lovethisplace

Everything here is delicious from there pot of bread, french toast sticks, pancakes, sweet potato fries, COFFEE as you can tell I've been here alot and its good every time, also helps that the staff is friendly... always worth the wait
Got the Jamms breakfast sandwich and red velvet pancakes for the first time and it was to die for! Busy on sundays but always a great place to eat!
Try their piña colada pot o' bread. It's a nice craving quencher if you want something sweet without having to eat pancakes drenched in syrup.
I had the best omelet (the babalama - bacon, tomato, avocado, and cheddar) of my life here.

The staff is friendly.  Service was excellent had the corner beef hash one of the better ones I've had in awhile. Recommend getting the hash well done extra crispy. Pop over thing was excellent decent cup of joe

Repeat Jamms, and I think the secret is in the pot of bread. However, I did not get a pot of bread because we've been sticking to wheat. The highlight is the "everybody knows your name" service. The place is packed with regulars, and everyone knows everyone, which is super charming. For the food, my omelet was filled generously, but the overall flavor and stiffness factor weren't my ideal. I think I need to try something other than an omelet next time. Note: They serve Illy coffee, and you can even have it in a French press.

But, what I really wanted to let you know is that on Fridays they have fish and chips, and my husband went googley-eyed and inhaled the giant pieces of fish filet with boyish delight. Our waitress said they usually sell out before the end of the day, so get there early!
OMG - this place is hands down one of the best breakfast places.  They have chiliqueles on the menu, not something offered just anywhere.  The bene's are fantastic!  100% worth the wait!

I'm one of these locals you'll see at Jamm's almost weekly!  I love this place.  The people are SO nice here, and the service is great.  The food is EXCELLENT.  Their bacon is perfect (in MY opinion)-I like it thick and crispy, and they deliver on this!  Their eggs are always perfect, and I love their pot of bread.  They have breakfast and lunch, and they have something for everyone.  Best of all, it's not far from my house!  :)
They charged me for my supposed" free pot of bread" that you get by checking in on yelp.

This place is amazing.  The food was fantastic, the prices fair, our server was friendly and was patient with our questions. We tried the white and cinnamon raisin pot breads. I prefered the white. to my surprise it was a yeast roll. I can't think of another place that gives you the option of hash browns or home fries.

This is THE go to place in Las Vegas

I just tried this place last Sunday with a friend and I loved it! The workers were very pleasant and welcoming, and the food was very good. What I liked the most is that they bake their own bread! I'd definitely come back to this place.

This place is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. I really like how they make you feel very welcome and at home. Ive never been disappointed here. The foods is always what i expect and the staff are very friendly. Most of the time there is about a 10-20 min wait but it's more then worth it. If looking for a great breakfast/lunch spot then this is for you. If you are just visiting or live locally you don't want to pad this special place up.

Fun, local place!
LOVE the french press coffee and the pot o' bread!
We had to wait a bit for a table - we knew that was a good sign!
I don't live far from this place and WILL be back.

Great place to bring the family .friendly service great food .great price .as I am visiting las Vegas from another state it feels really good to get away from the strip for a while feels like home in here

Went in for their well-known omelets, but ended up with the french toast...and absolutely no regrets! My friend had one of the skillets, and that was a lot of food!  The lunch menu looks just as good, will have to try it. 

The place was busy, but we got seated quickly, and the service was good. Basic ambiance, but plenty of parking (strip mall) and easy to find. Will definitely put it in the rotation.

I come here every now and again with my dad. It's around the corner from where I live, but rather than just the convenience I come for the food. It's not super fancy, but everything always tastes good and fills you up. The staff is always nice and friendly, and they will continue to refill your coffee or water until you tell them to quit. They seem really helpful with food suggestions too, from what I've overheard. Had Joe's Omelet today, less the mushrooms which the waitress agreed with me was a wise move lol.

No matter how hard I try to behave when I go eat at Jamms, I just can't seem to do it! The biscuits and gravy never fail me! And today I had not one, but two, of the famed pots of bread. I chose to sample the Cinnamon Raisin pot and the Pumpkin pots today. Topping the bread with the scrumptious cream cheese frosting made me weak in the knees. Jamms KNOWS breakfast!!
Great "home-cooking" restaurant with enough unique dishes to keep you interested.  Staff is always friendly and helpful.  Love it.
Great food and a very wide selection of items on the menu. Go early they get real busy around 9 am.
Breakfast joints tend to disappoint me, but not Jamms. The service was great. I felt like i was being served by clones of my mom. You know how that is. Food was good and reasonably priced.

One of my favorite breakfast spots in town! The Corned Beef Hash...just no words, it's so good. Oh and you have to get a pot of bread because if you don't there was no point of you coming to Jamm's, the bread is where it's at!

I ordered the Ruben Eggs Benedict, they where not greedy with the corn beef and it came with hash browns cooked to perfection. My friend ordered The White Castle Omlette and they where not shy with the beef inside at least 1lb of beef in the omlette. She also got a side order of a Biscuit with gravy for only 75 cents it was perfect also. We both licked our plates clean it was that good. The service was very good, Jasmine our waitress was excellent. We ordered our food and with in 10 minutes it was delivered hot and ready to destroy. If your looking for a good breakfast in the Vegas community this is definitely a hot spot. Good job Jamms I will be back!!!!
Great service, great coffee, great food!  The Denver potato pancakes are amazing!  Can't wait to come back again and bring people with me.
I love this place!  A little ma & pop place & Sandy was my server again.  Super sweet & always packed.  Had an inlet with home style potatoes & a honey bacon bun
Great pork chop and eggs.  We never miss this spot when we come to Vegas.  Best breakfast in town!
While off the beaten path, the warm atmosphere of Jamm's, their friendly staff, and great breakfast is a must if you're looking for a new spot!
We loved this place!  Everything on our table was hot, tasty, and exactly as ordered.   We loved Shirley too!

This was a pleasant surprise.  Kind of a drive from the north end of town, but totally worth it if you like a homey family diner kinda place.  Very family-friendly atmosphere.

It was a little while ago, but I remember the food was really good (and inexpensive!!) and in generous portions.  We were there for a weekend breakfast and I think we got a free pot of bread because we mentioned we found them on Yelp.
Good breakfast. The service was good,  the little muffin the give you for checking in was delicious.

Jamms French toast, veggie omelette, and Ruben Benedict.  I like the fact that they serve real corn beef not the can stuff.  The place is plainly decorated.  Not very busy the Sunday after Thanksgiving which was a shocker.  I enjoy the food, but it didn't wow me.  As a visitor, I probably prefer the Bagle Cafe's selections better. BUT, if you have a sweet tooth, I do like their french toast fried with a corn flake coating.  That was pretty tasty.

Had breakfast with my wife. Had Joe s omelet was grest
I hssd the breakfast burrito. 
Devyn was great!!!!!!!!

This is the place for breakfast and brunch slash comfort food. Every week they have a unique flavor of potted bread which is offered as a side to most entrees.  I like the omelette selection.  The wait staff is attentive and very nice. At peak hours there's usually a short 15-30min wait for a table. I like to burn time at Dead Poets Used Bookstore also located in the same strip mall.

Wow. this breakfast based restaurant is by far my favorite in the whole valley. Luckily it's right by where I go to school, so I come in here for a quick bite in between classes often. 

While this place is practically always packed, it's worth the wait. Usually the staff is working very proficiently and the wait isn't even that long. The breakfast food is very good, and they have a few vegetarian options. 

The pumpkin pancakes were my favorite when they were in season, but there's plenty other crazy combinations to choose from. The eggs benedict is usually what I get and the sauce is awesome. Yeah, awesome sauce.
Amazing friendly service! Great food! I have yet to have something I didn't like. So yummy!
Good place it's allways friendly and they give a discount for yelping. I love the bread and the menue has allot of healthy choices

Went with the hubby today- we both ordered corned beef hash based on these glowing, stellar recommendations of fellow yelpers!! ...and we were not disappointed!!! He loved his plain pot of bread and my cin raisin one was awesome. Fresh coffee, great service. Really glad this business has survived the sucky economy. Will definitely re-visit! :)
First time here, amazing breakfast and great service in a clean restaurant, can't ask for more than that!

After visiting Hash House A Go Go, and finding to our dismay, a ridiculous 1 hour wait, we decided to try Jamm's for brunch instead.  

Jamm's is unpretentious, unassuming, honest-to-goodness mom 'n' pop little joint (the complete opposite of Hash House).  Service is fast and friendly and they treat you like family (they were really accommodating to my husband's request for hard boiled eggs).

The food was good solid diner fare.  We ordered the eggs benedict, the chicken fried steak and eggs, and a side of corned beef hash. Everything was good, but we loved loved LOVED the house fries and the corned beef hash (which was perfected seasoned and lightly crisped).  Food was reasonably priced and portions were very generous.

Will return if in the area again!

We have been going to Jamms for years!  The food is amazing and the staff are even better.  Try the pot of bread, the omelets are fabulous.  MY favorite is the mushroom delight, cream cheese in a omelet, so good.   My husband's is the white castle omelets, ground beef, onions and cheese.  So Yummy.  Don't forget the biscuits and gravy!
The best home style restaurant you'll find anywhere! Amazing food, great portions. The best country fried steak in Nevada and the best place to find grits!
So I  heard about this place and had to try it. Great food and attitudes from everyone made the atmosphere amazing. Pot O' bread was awesome. Recommending to friends.

Was it good? Sure. Was it great? Nope. We decided to come here since it's been on my bookmark list for a while now and from what I heard it's supposed to be very good. It was kind of a check in the box for me, so if nothing else I'm glad to knock another one off the list. 

Came here on a Sunday and the line was out the door, which is usually a good indication the food is worth the wait. And surprisingly, the line moved rather quickly. And thank goodness because we were all in desperate need of nourishment after the night out we had. (Note to self: lots of sake, sushi & shots are a recipe for disaster, ugh!) Lol! 

Anyways...first impression: it's a very small busy diner that could use some major updating. Lots of noise and hustle & bustle. Sitting near the kitchen I got a good glimpse of the waitresses & cooks frantically trying to get food out. Even so, our food took a bit longer than expected to make it's way to our table but in all fairness it was a Sunday not to mention, Mother's Day. We should feel lucky we were able to get seated so quickly. 

On to the food. The pot-o-bread was good, free with your Yelp check-in. I guess that's what they're known for. Nothing here that really stood out to me. The guys seemed to be pleased with their meals. My omelet was just okay. The cheese on top wasn't melted. And the bacon inside seemed a bit over cooked, as were the side of potatoes which made it difficult to eat. (See my photo and you'll understand). 

All in all, it wasn't terrible, it also wasn't the best. Great prices so that's a plus. But there are better options for breakfast around town.
I love this place their friendly. I lovethe fresh coffee and veriety of omlets they have.

I really wanted to like this place!

Walked in and was immediately transported back to Woodbury, New Jersey!  Smells exactly like a NJ diner!  Made me smile & homesick all at once!  Hostess greeted/seated us with a warm greeting! 
Place was fairly full, but we were seated right away.  It's a good sign for a Wednesday morning!

Pot-o-bread - Was expecting a typical fresh, doughy bread like you'd get at dinner. However, it was a like a light, moist pastry type "bread", which was a perfect side for breakfast.  Don't hesitate to try it for fear of filling up before the main course!

Belgium Waffle & fruit & coffee - I got the half order.  My honest opinion is that I've had better Belgium waffles.  This one had good flavor, but it was unusually thin for a Belgium and surprisingly  "tough" to cut with a fork.

Signature omelet w/well done hash browns, ice water- the husband got this for breakfast. He specifically requested "well done" hash browns.  What he got, tho, were actually lightly browned & under cooked.  He was not happy.  He scraped off the sauce on top of the omelette as he said it has way too much tarragon and the consistency was "gelatinous".  He said the actual omelette had little flavor and he had to douse it in hot sauce.

The bill was under $20.  Fair for the amount of food.

Went in to this place today for a late lunch with family members. It was super busy but that doesn't stop us from being seated promptly. It also didn't impact the service! We were treated kindly, respectfully, and promptly.

As a vegetarian Jamms let me subsitute vegetables for meat ingredients at no extra charge.

We all ordered different types of food. I ordered breakfast and some of my family members ordered lunch entrees. The portions were enormous!!! I noted that I would take a to go box for my omelette I would be able to eat off of for the next couple of days :-)

All servers and workers make patrons feel as though they are " regular" customers.

They also give a small discount if you post on social media which shows they are in touch with the social media aspect of our culture.

If you are looking for a casual, cool place to eat that has a down home feeling , I would highly recommend this place! Definitely will return.
Absolutely love JAMMS! Great choices, excellent service and most of all everything on the menu is wonderful!

This is my go-to spot for breakfast on the weekends.  Their Irish Skillet is amazing and doesn't have that icky corned beef from a can...it's real.  Their pot of bread is my favorites thing here.  Service is good.  Wait can be long on the weekends but it's worth it.
Pina Colada French Toast was delicious! Rueben Omelet was delicious! Staff was so customer friendly. Loved it!
This place is hands down the best place to go and have breakfast in Vegas. Everyone is so friendly and the food is extremely fresh!!
Loved their classic breakfast!! The old school hash brown and their cinnamon raisin pot of bread got me!

I apologize to my friends @ Egg, but Jamms has the best breakfest in town! Today I had butterscotch pot of bread & the signature omlet. It brought tears of joy to my eyes. The waitress, Carol Ann, my friend, had to pry the plate out of my clenched fists. I had already licked the top clean, but she had a point, no need to lick the bottom. BTW, Carol Ann is an atrocious spellern

Fantastic surprise. The food was delicious and the staff is... Well, fantastic! This is a secret only locals know about, so if you are coming to Vegas, take a detour from The Strip. You taste buds will thank you for days!

Burnt hash browns, steak was 1/2 an inch thick and smaller then a steak from south point. Pot of bread is just bread in a tin cup.... Ok? Zagat rated their food at a 25..... How is that even possible? I think they need to reassess their decision. They might have been good in 2014, but not now.

super delicious and huge portions. We checked in on yelp and got a free pot o bread (delicious) and posted a photo to social media with their tag and saved on our bill! Fast service, bomb food and discounts. Loved it
I come here all the time i love the french toast sticks ....my fav and the chicken fried steak bomb sooo good not watery just yum yum yum

My husband and I look for a few things when we go out: friendly service , drinks refilled and nicely portioned great tasting food. 
We definitely found all of these at Jamms! My Jamm's steak omelet was very tasty with fluffy eggs and the home fries were seasoned well and didn't skimp on the portion. My husband's chicken fried steak, home fries and 3 eggs over easy were equally as delicious.  The cinnamon raisin pot of bread was tasty and tender. His ice tea and my coffee were never empty.
Our wait time was nil as we were seated as soon as we arrived at 10:30 on a Wed. We will definitely be going back as there are many more dishes we want to try.

I walked in and the place was packed!

The decor reminded me of an episode of the Golden Girls...  it was charming.

The service was excellent.  

I had a Rueben for lunch.  The sandwich was pretty tasty. The pastrami was good, but they were real skimpy with the pastrami.  They had a total of 4 slices of pastrami...  When I was served the sandwich I had to lift the top piece of bread to see the pastrami.  

When I eat a rueben I want layers of pastarmi, kraut and dressing slopping out the back of the sandwich when I eat it.  

I like the place and I will probably end up there eating breakfast sometime...

Have been going here for...  hmm probably 10 years.  I live around the corner and I love this breakfast spot.  Service is good, prices are reasonable, food is tasty.  They also deal REALLY well with specialty orders to the point where they know..  eggs benedict, dry english muffin, sauce on the side, fruit instead of potatoes lol.
Thus place was awesome! Service was great and fast. Everyine was very friendly. All of thr good was delicious. You MUST try the stuffed French toast. It is amazing!

Visited here on my first time in Vegas. I am still so grateful my friend showed me this gem. 

You really feel the love in this place! I still dream of pots of bread. Just like having a home cooked meal with your grandparents. :)
